translation.en: ‘Even the dirt from your town that sticks to our feet we wipe off against you. But remember that God’s kingdom is coming soon.’
translation.bj: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan daang Onu Kiamat nyaꞌa soꞌ kota Sodom lobih jangan ukum-e soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kota itih.” Ukum kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus

translation.en: Jesus said, “There was a rich man who always dressed in the finest clothes. He was so rich that he was able to enjoy all the best things every day.
translation.bj: Soꞌ daang neraka, sidagal inoh sukup susah jolaꞌ. Takal iyoh inoh moꞌ bigalong keꞌ somu, soꞌ juaꞌ yoh moꞌ kilin Lazarus guluꞌ sinoꞌ Abraham deꞌ topat paling paguh-e.

translation.en: Tell us, is it right for us to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”
translation.bj: “Suba bitanga niꞌ kiping duit pilak tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, gamal duoh adon osi itih?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Kaisar!”

translation.en: Or, if he asked for an egg, would you give him a scorpion? Of course not!
translation.bj: atou ngin liangotis, nyam basa onak-e mitiaꞌ tuluah!

translation.en: But first, the Son of Man must suffer many things. The people of today will refuse to accept him.
translation.bj: Pak-e Okuꞌ totap halus dioꞌ yaꞌ ngoon susah jolaꞌ duoh obuah nulak odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip joman adin.

translation.en: “The tax collector stood alone too. But when he prayed, he would not even look up to heaven. He felt very humble before God. He said, ‘O God, have mercy on me. I am a sinner!’
translation.bj: Pak-e pinagih suke inoh mujuag juaꞌ, kan-e diꞌ-e bilani bigalong keꞌ longit, simadi-e modug-modug soduaꞌ-e sobab yoh moꞌ ngoon nang odop-e bidosa simadi-e bidoa in neh, ‘O Topaꞌ masiꞌleh tuduꞌ okuꞌ ulang bidosa itih!’

translation.en: I studied it all carefully from the beginning. Then I decided to write it down for you in an organized way.
translation.bj: Sobab inoh okuꞌ moꞌ tiluti silita inoh tiꞌ-e soꞌ sibungas-e, okuꞌ kila paguh okuꞌ nulis buk-e saꞌan ingan.

translation.en: Jesus was coming close to Jerusalem. He was already near the bottom of the Mount of Olives. The whole group of followers was happy. They were very excited and praised God. They thanked God for all the powerful things they had seen.
translation.bj: Takal Yesus moꞌ sinok-e yaꞌ nog Yerusalem deꞌ olan muun deꞌ punguꞌ Zaitun, susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ponu nunaꞌ Iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ daang munuas-e nang bogan-e mudi Topaꞌ saꞌan susuaꞌ mukjizat deꞌ moꞌ kilin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: They were led to a place called “The Skull.” There the soldiers nailed Jesus to the cross. They also nailed the criminals to crosses beside Jesus—one on the right and the other on the left.
translation.bj: Takal-e moꞌ nog tanaꞌ deꞌ adon-e Tikuluok, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nyalip Yesus bisamah duoh ulang jaꞌat deꞌ duwoh noh, niꞌ naꞌan nuwaꞌ boit-E, deꞌ niꞌ naꞌan kawa touh-e.

translation.en: An angel of the Lord appeared to them, and the glory of the Lord was shining around them. The shepherds were very afraid.
translation.bj: Tang-tang niꞌ naꞌan malaikat Topaꞌ bitanga odop-e, sinok odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, jawaꞌ sijaꞌ-a soꞌ Topaꞌ, deꞌ ting odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tolu.

translation.en: “The second servant said, ‘Sir, with your one bag of money I earned five bags.’
translation.bj: Kuli ke duwoh-e moꞌ in-e geh, ‘Niꞌ kiping duit mas deꞌ ngin ingan tuduꞌ okuꞌ moh moꞌ bitamah jadin limoh kiping.’

translation.en: Everyone was surprised when they heard what the shepherds told them.
translation.bj: Yoh moꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa ilan takal-e ngojit silita kudu-kudu naꞌan gembala deꞌ nguan domba inoh.

translation.en: When Jesus was twelve years old, they went to the festival as usual.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ nyamut Onu Paskah inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ, pak-e Yesus diꞌ-e paliꞌ duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ. Yoh aluaꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem, pingoma-E diꞌ-e puꞌan-e.

translation.en: “Later, Lazarus died. The angels took him and placed him in the arms of Abraham. The rich man also died and was buried.
translation.bj: Duoh ogiꞌ gilongung geh deꞌ sukup ayuh-e deꞌ osah otoꞌ, saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ katiꞌ diꞌ-e dapod odi kanoꞌ duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ diꞌ-e dapod odi katiꞌ.’

translation.en: “Before John the Baptizer came, people were taught the Law of Moses and the writings of the prophets. But since the time of John, the Good News about God’s kingdom is being told. And everyone is trying hard to get into it.
translation.bj: Deꞌ boꞌon tiban boli sidagal inoh, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag adon-e Lazarus deꞌ gonan-e punuaꞌ odaꞌ pinonaꞌ deꞌ buꞌuh.

translation.en: But they did not find his body there. They came and told us they had seen some angels in a vision. The angels told them Jesus was alive!
translation.bj: pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e dapod todang Yesus. Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nog yoh moꞌ kilakal oniꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ-e tuduꞌ koꞌih nog odop-e bitapod duoh malaikat. Malaikat inoh tanon nang Yesus idip.

translation.en: You will eat and drink at my table in that kingdom. You will sit on thrones and judge the twelve tribes of Israel.
translation.bj: Ngan-e watinoh ingan dapod suaꞌ sonang-doon duoh Okuꞌ takal Okuꞌ jadin Laja duoh ingan guluꞌ militah keꞌ tun ke simoong duwoh suku bangsa Israel.” Nutaꞌ Simon

translation.en: This is exactly how it will be when the Son of Man comes again.
translation.bj: Watinoh geh doiꞌ nyaꞌa sakaꞌ siniaꞌ Okuꞌ Onak Manusia nog duoh tang-tang bitanga odopKuꞌ.

translation.en: This is what he promisedthrough his holy prophets long ago.
translation.bj: Topaꞌ moꞌ ngin pinyilamat inoh kodaꞌ deꞌ janyi-E, pakai nabi-nabi deꞌ obuah pilih-E nouh-e,

translation.en: When Herod saw Jesus, he was very happy. He had heard all about him and had wanted to meet him for a long time. Herod wanted to see a miracle, so he was hoping that Jesus would do one.
translation.bj: Herodes sonang otin-e takal-e kilin Yesus, sobab yoh moꞌ tui ngojit gah Yesus duoh yaꞌ ningaꞌ mun-e. Yoh bialap yaꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus nai mukjizat.

translation.en: He is a light to show your way to the other nations.And he will bring honor to your people Israel.”
translation.bj: Pinyilamat inoh kodaꞌ jawaꞌ deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ kaꞌan bangsa-bangsa deꞌ bokon, iyohleh jawaꞌ deꞌ ngin adon deꞌ paguh kaꞌan umat Ingan, Israel.”

translation.en: Pilate heard this and asked if Jesus was from Galilee.
translation.bj: Takal Pilatus ngojit-e, yoh moꞌ sikien-e, “Podo nyaꞌa itih ulang Galilea?”

translation.en: So the men came to Jesus. They said, “John the Baptizer sent us to you with this question: ‘Are you the one who is coming, or should we wait for someone else?’”
translation.bj: Soꞌ duwoh pinunaꞌ Yohanes inoh odi tuduꞌ Yesus yoh moꞌ nang, “Yohanes Pembaptis odaꞌ koꞌih sikien tuduꞌ Ingan, podo Ingan nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nog kodaꞌ deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ, podo koꞌih kajon nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon?”

translation.en: The people said to Elizabeth, “But no one in your family has that name.”
translation.bj: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang in-e, “Doiꞌ nak ogiꞌ madih ayuamuꞌ deꞌ adon inoh.”

translation.en: It was late on Preparation day. When the sun went down, the Sabbath day would begin.
translation.bj: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jadi daang onu limoh. Takal gituang-e yaꞌ Onu Sabat.

translation.en: Really, what did you expect to see? Someone dressed in fine clothes? Of course not. People who wear fancy clothes and live in luxury are all in kings’ palaces.
translation.bj: Duoh odi kalik nyaꞌa deꞌ kai pimakai paguh baya idip sonang idoh diꞌ-e deꞌ padang pasil, nyaꞌa deꞌ watinoh iyoh loꞌo deꞌ istana!

translation.en: The one named Cleopas said, “You must be the only person in Jerusalem who doesn’t know what has just happened there.”
translation.bj: Niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ duwoh noh adon-e Kleopas, sikien tuduꞌ Yesus, “Podo jok-e Ingan binua deꞌ Yerusalem, deꞌ diꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ moꞌ jadi datiꞌ baꞌuh-baꞌuh tih?”

translation.en: I am very happy because God is my Savior.
translation.bj: duoh kilakuꞌ sonang sobab Topaꞌ Pinyilamat okuꞌ.

translation.en: He was so hungry that he wanted to eat the food the pigs were eating. But no one gave him anything.
translation.bj: Okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ patut obuah sobot onak ingan. Odaꞌ sijaꞌ-a okuꞌ itih jadi kuli ingan.’

translation.en: The prophets wrote many things about the time when God will punish his people. The time I am talking about is when all these things must happen.
translation.bj: Sobab onu inohleh onu bangsa itih obuah ukum, saꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis odaꞌ nabi-nabi jadi.

translation.en: The Lord said, “Who is the wise and trusted servant? The master trusts one servant to give the other servants their food at the right time. Who is the servant that the master trusts to do that work?
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Jadileh kuli deꞌ setia duoh bijak! Sobab kuli deꞌ kodaꞌ inoh, nyam toke-e yaꞌ buu toke-e pakat jadi pimipin kaꞌan suaꞌ kuli-e, yoh deꞌ ngin man tuduꞌ kuli-kuli-e deꞌ bokon takal sukup jam-e.

translation.en: After this, the Lord chose
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ soꞌ inoh Yesus pilih juꞌ puluꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e deꞌ bokon, mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh moꞌ odaꞌ odi ngak duwoh-duwoh naꞌan, dioꞌ soꞌ odop-E keꞌ suaꞌ kota duoh topat deꞌ bokon soꞌ Yesus yaꞌ odi.

translation.en: How bad it will be for you people who are full now,because you will be hungry.How bad it will be for you people who are laughing now,because you will be sad and cry.
translation.bj: Binasaleh ingan deꞌ busuah adin sobab tiaꞌ ijoꞌ ingan deꞌ yaꞌ pilai! Binasaleh ingan deꞌ towoh adin sobab tiaꞌ ijoꞌ ingan deꞌ yaꞌ siꞌian!

translation.en: “It will be bad for you, Chorazin! It will be bad for you, Bethsaida! I did many miracles in you. If those same miracles had happened in Tyre and Sidon, then the people in those cities would have changed their lives and stopped sinning a long time ago. They would have worn sackcloth and sat in ashes to show that they were sorry for their sins.
translation.bj: Pak-e takal Onu Kiamat, kota Tirus duoh kota Sidon obuah ukum pak-e ukum inoh lobih jangan soꞌ ukum deꞌ obuah ingan.

translation.en: You say to your friend, ‘Let me get that little piece of dust out of your eye.’ Why do you say this? Can’t you see that big piece of wood in your own eye? You are a hypocrite. First, take the wood out of your own eye. Then you will see clearly to get the dust out of your friend’s eye.
translation.bj: Oniwat ngan ingan ponai tanon tuduꞌ madih ingan, ‘Tiꞌ kuꞌ kadi lonas soꞌ botonmu,’ daang boton odop ingan sijaꞌ-e ogiꞌ botang koyuh deꞌ diꞌ ingan kilin-e? Maꞌ lika pibulaꞌ kadi dioꞌ botang koyuh deꞌ ogiꞌ daang boton odopmuꞌ. Ke muꞌu tapod ningaꞌ, mokuaꞌ noh tapod kadi lonas soꞌ boton madihmuꞌ.” Tongon jojak duoh buaꞌ-e

translation.en: The angel said to Mary, “The Holy Spirit will come to you, and the power of the Most High God will cover you. The baby will be holy and will be called the Son of God.
translation.bj: Malaikat inoh moꞌ nyawot Maria in-e, “Iyang Topaꞌ muun tuduꞌ muꞌu, kuasa Topaꞌ inohleh deꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu bitiiaꞌ inoh ngan Onak Kudus deꞌ yaꞌ muꞌu milaꞌ inoh obuah sobot Onak Topaꞌ.

translation.en: The Pharisees and teachers of the law could say nothing against what he said.
translation.bj: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tiaꞌ ponai nang oni-oni takal ngojit pingunang Yesus inoh. Topat piayuh duoh topat nyaꞌa biasa

translation.en: Then the owner will show you a large room upstairs that is ready for us. Prepare the meal there.”
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli inoh deꞌ yaꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan kamal deꞌ somu deꞌ muaꞌ motiꞌ-e deꞌ moꞌ bilasa sidia, danoꞌ leh ingan nyidia pinguman Paskah toꞌ.”

translation.en: “Now, Lord, you can let me, your servant, die in peace as you said.
translation.bj: “Topaꞌ, tanahleh adin okuꞌ kobos daang kila deꞌ sonang, sobab Ingan moꞌ nai kodaꞌ deꞌ janyi ingan tuduꞌ okuꞌ.

translation.en: Then the people will say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ They will say to the hills, ‘Cover us!’
translation.bj: Sobab susah jolaꞌ deꞌ sikia mun-e deꞌ pulow inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ dolod duoh punguꞌ, ‘Patuab mei nyonug leh koꞌih!’

translation.en: sheep there in the field and go out and look for the lost sheep. You will continue to search for it until you find it.
translation.bj: Toban paliꞌ keꞌ boli. Mokuaꞌ inoh ingan moꞌ mogan madih ayua duoh dingan-dingan ngan, ingan moꞌ sina in-e, ‘Doon mei duoh okuꞌ, sobab dombakuꞌ deꞌ moyap itih moꞌ dapodkuꞌ!’

translation.en: You will be very happy, and many others will share your joy over his birth.
translation.bj: Muꞌu baya suaꞌ nyaꞌa suwaꞌ doon takal onak inoh limokah tieꞌ sodiꞌ neh.

translation.en: “When someone invites you to a wedding, don’t sit in the most important seat. They may have invited someone more important than you.
translation.bj: “Nyam ingan obuah ngunang odi keꞌ topat biluman maꞌleh guluꞌ deꞌ topat piayuh, jak-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ lobih penting lagiꞌ soꞌ muꞌu obuah ngunang,
Asal muꞌu nyomah okuꞌ, okuꞌ yaꞌ ngin suaꞌ-e tuduꞌ muꞌu.”

translation.en: The men went to Jesus. They begged Jesus to help the officer. They said, “This officer is worthy to have your help.
translation.bj: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nog duꞌ Yesus, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bonal-bonal mitiaꞌ tulung saꞌ Yesus tulung panglima inoh. In nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ duꞌ Yesus, “Panglima itih patut Ingan tulung-e,

translation.en: Jesus answered, “But the Scriptures also say, ‘You must not test the Lord your God.’”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Onu itih ayat-ayat itih moꞌ jadi takal ingan ngojit-e.”

translation.en: They will destroy you and all your people. Not one stone of your buildings will stay on top of another. All this will happen because you did not know the time when God came to save you.”
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-e, “Daang Kitab deꞌ nulis deꞌ in tih, ‘BoliKuꞌ iyohleh topat nyaꞌa bidoa,’ pak-e ingan pakai topat kaꞌan ngakal nipu nyaꞌa.”

translation.en: He said, “You have been chosen to know the secret truths about God’s kingdom. But I use stories to speak to other people. I do this so that‘They will look,but they will not see,and they will listen,but they will not understand.’ Isaiah
translation.bj: Itih loti perumpamaan inoh, biniaꞌ inoh Pingunang Topaꞌ.

translation.en: A few days later, Jesus went out to a mountain to pray. He stayed there all night praying to God.
translation.bj: Diꞌ-e tuwi soꞌ noh Yesus maꞌad keꞌ punguꞌ soꞌ-e yaꞌ bidoa. Danoꞌ Yoh niꞌ ngalom-ngalom bidoa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ .

translation.en: The demons begged Jesus not to send them into the bottomless pit.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikoduh buu mokuaꞌ ningaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ moh. Yoh moꞌ kilakal hal inoh deꞌ kota Gerasa duoh deꞌ kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ deꞌ sinoꞌ noh.

translation.en: That night, some shepherds were out in the fields near Bethlehem watching their sheep.
translation.bj: Diꞌ-e juaꞌ soꞌ kota Betlehem ngan onu moꞌ ngalom ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan gembala ngilumon deꞌ padang nguan domba deꞌ kidip-e.

translation.en: “Whoever is not with me is against me. And anyone who does not work with me is working against me.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e nuwaꞌ Okuꞌ, loti-e yoh bakang Okuꞌ, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e kiloja duoh Okuꞌ, loti-e yoh kiloja lawan Okuꞌ!” Munua paliꞌ

translation.en: This surprised the followers. They were afraid. They thought they were seeing a ghost.
translation.bj: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e deꞌ munoꞌ obuaꞌ gogoh duoh tolu, baꞌ-e nang inoh munua.

translation.en: They will beat him with whips and then kill him. But on the third day after his death, he will rise to life again.”
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pijolaꞌ duoh ngabos Okuꞌ, pak-e onu ke taluh-e Okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ idip.”

translation.en: You always put new wine into new wineskins.
translation.bj: Piꞌin angul deꞌ baꞌuh halus daang topat piꞌin deꞌ soꞌ kulit deꞌ baꞌuh geh.

translation.en: Jesus said, “I can promise that everyone who has left their home, wife, brothers, parents, or children for God’s kingdom
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Osi mun ingan deꞌ togan boli-e, sowon-e, madih ayua-e, pingoma-e, duoh onak opot-e saꞌ Topaꞌ dapod militah idip-e,

translation.en: years old. Anna was always at the Temple; she never left. She worshiped God by fasting and praying day and night.
translation.bj: Takal Simeon aluaꞌ sina tuduꞌ Maria duoh Yusuf, Hana odi tuduꞌ Yesus, yoh mudi Topaꞌ, yomoꞌ Hana silalu silita Yesus obuah milaꞌ tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kajon onu Topaꞌ pilopas ulang Israel soꞌ Roma. Yusuf duoh Maria paliꞌ keꞌ Nazaret

translation.en: So he called ten of his servants together. He gave a bag of money to each servant. He said, ‘Do business with this money until I come back.’
translation.bj: Takal-e yaꞌ ponu yomoꞌ mogan simoong naꞌan kuli-e, yomoꞌ ngin kiping duit mas tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ. Iyoh moꞌ sina in-e, ‘Kai leh duit itih kaꞌan modal ingan bidagang nog okuꞌ paliꞌ.’

translation.en: All those who lived in the area around Gerasa asked Jesus to go away because they were afraid.So Jesus got into the boat to go back to Galilee.
translation.bj: Takal Yesus paliꞌ soꞌ polad donu, nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ nyamut Yesus sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tui ngati-ngati Iyoh nog.

translation.en: He walked to the open coffin and touched it. The men who were carrying the coffin stopped. Jesus spoke to the dead son: “Young man, I tell you, get up!”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ odi sinok todang noh Yoh moꞌ tomaꞌ ponam-e, tukang tawiak noh moꞌ loꞌo. Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Onak bujang mokat mei!”

translation.en: men.
translation.bj: Doiꞌ tiaꞌ guna-e, bait inoh kaꞌan umoh duoh jadi abok, jadin saꞌat sijaꞌ-e. Osi deꞌ ogiꞌ kojit ngojit nyeꞌ!”

translation.en: Jesus looked up and saw some rich people putting their gifts to God into the Temple collection box.
translation.bj: Takal Yesus deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ Iyoh ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya suad duit kaang poti persembahan.

translation.en: One time Jesus was in a town where a very sick man lived. This man was covered with leprosy. When the man saw Jesus, he bowed before Jesus and begged him, “Lord, you have the power to heal me if you want.”
translation.bj: Takal inoh Yesus odi keꞌ niꞌ kota. Deꞌ kota inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dali deꞌ obuah onam kulit deꞌ sukup palah. Yomoꞌ takal ningaꞌ Yesus yoh moꞌ bikunyug deꞌ jowin Yesus simadi-e nang, “Nyam Ingan laꞌan odaꞌleh okuꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onamkuꞌ.”

translation.en: Simeon took the baby in his arms and thanked God:
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Simeon pakuaꞌ Yesus. Simeon moꞌ mudi Topaꞌ in-e,

translation.en: The man answered, “‘Love the Lord your God with all your heart, all your soul, all your strength, and all your mind.’ Also, ‘Love your neighbor the same as you love yourself.’”
translation.bj: Pak-e ngan-e yaꞌ ngibonal odop-e, yoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Osi mei siodopkuꞌ manusia?”

translation.en: Zacchaeus said to the Lord, “I want to do good. I will give half of my money to the poor. If I have cheated anyone, I will pay them back four times more.”
translation.bj: Takal Zakheus deꞌ boli-e yomoꞌ mokat mujuag yomoꞌ in-e, “Gulu, okuꞌ yaꞌ kutung binuoh haltakuꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag, yomoꞌ nyam basa okuꞌ ogiꞌ ngakal nyaꞌa, okuꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ-e pat sidoh soꞌ deꞌ ngakal Kuꞌ!”

translation.en: I was afraid of you because you are a hard man. You even take money that you didn’t earn and gather food that you didn’t grow.’
translation.bj: Okuꞌ tolu deꞌ ingan sobab ingan nyaꞌa deꞌ kolas, ingan mit oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e kakuꞌ ingan, duoh ingan ngutuam koyuh deꞌ diꞌ ingan puluah-e.’

translation.en: But wisdom is shown to be right by those who accept it.”
translation.bj: Deꞌ kota inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ dayung adoh. Takal yoh ngojit Yesus man deꞌ boli ulang Farisi inoh, yoh moꞌ odi kanoꞌ toban niꞌ jobul deꞌ isiꞌ-e inyuaꞌ lona deꞌ maal.

translation.en: A third man said, ‘I just got married; I can’t come.’
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ nikan-e lagiꞌ nang, ‘Okuꞌ baꞌuh sijaꞌ-e kawin, inohleh ngan kuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ dapod odi.’

translation.en: I was with you every day in the Temple area. Why didn’t you try to arrest me there? But this is your time—the time when darkness rules.”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan kuli dayung kilin Petrus guluꞌ deꞌ bingon opui inoh, yoh moꞌ nakit-e ningaꞌ Petrus daang-e lasuꞌ nang in-e, “Nyaꞌa itih tuong ogiꞌ geh duoh Yesus ti-e neh!”

translation.en: While Jesus was still speaking, someone came from the house of the synagogue leader and said, “Your daughter has died! Don’t bother the Teacher anymore.”
translation.bj: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa siꞌian sobab onak opot inoh moꞌ kobos. Pak-e Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Maꞌ ingan siꞌian. Onak opot inoh idoh diꞌ-e kobos neh, yoh jok-e boꞌos sijaꞌ-e.”

translation.bj: Pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nai kodaꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus, yomoꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ guluꞌ.

translation.en: But Jesus said, “The people who hear the teaching of God and obey it—they are the ones who have God’s blessing.”

Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi deꞌ suaꞌ duoh uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ yomoꞌ sina duoh Yesus, “Gulu odaꞌleh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌmuꞌ inoh saꞌ diꞌ-e sina in tih.”

translation.en: The women who had come from Galilee with Jesus followed Joseph. They saw the tomb. Inside they saw where he put Jesus’ body.
translation.bj: Dayung-dayung deꞌ nunaꞌ duoh Yesus soꞌ Galilea nunaꞌ Yusuf soꞌ juaꞌ ngan-e yaꞌ ningaꞌ kubul Yesus duoh oniwat Yusuf posan todang Yesus daang kubul.

translation.en: About an hour later, another man said, “It’s true. I’m sure this man was with him, because he is from Galilee.”
translation.bj: Petrus moꞌ lasuꞌ luah soꞌ kanoꞌ daang-e siꞌien ngilasod. Yesus obuah nguyat duoh obuah posut-pupuꞌ nyaꞌa

translation.en: Jesus said to the followers, “This is how you should pray:‘Father, we pray that your name will always be kept holy.We pray that your kingdom will come.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ Yesus sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Nyam ingan bidoa, nang leh in tih, ‘Topaꞌ Samaꞌ koꞌih deꞌ sulga, Koꞌih bidoa saꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa nyomah adon Ingan deꞌ kudus. Nogleh duoh jadileh Laja koꞌih daang dunia itih.

translation.en: Jesus said to the Pharisees and teachers of the law, “If your son or work animal falls into a well on the Sabbath day, you know you would pull him out immediately.”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, “Nyam basa onak ingan atou onak lembu ingan deꞌ labuꞌ daang lubang takal Onu Sabat, totu ingan lasuꞌ nalik piluah soꞌ daang lubang takal Onu Sabat inoh geh!”

translation.en: Zechariah and Elizabeth were both good people who pleased God. They did everything the Lord commanded, always following his instructions completely.
translation.bj: Idip Zakharia duwoh sowon-e nyonang otin Topaꞌ, sobab odop-e deꞌ duwoh silalu idip nunaꞌ plitah Topaꞌ.

translation.en: Jesus’ father and mother were amazed at what Simeon said about him.
translation.bj: Takal Yusuf duoh Maria ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Simeon yoh moꞌ ilan-e.

translation.en: Even your parents, brothers, relatives, and friends will turn against you. They will have some of you killed.
translation.bj: Ingan yaꞌ obuah nyelah tuduꞌ musoh odaꞌ pingoma ngan, odaꞌ madih ayua ngan, odaꞌ dingan-dingan ngan, kudu naꞌan soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ obuah ngabos odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: He asked them, “What’s this I hear you discussing with each other as you walk?”The two men stopped, their faces looking very sad.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e duwoh, “Oni leh deꞌ kilakal ingan neh?” Yomoꞌ soꞌ duwoh odop-e moꞌ tog mun-e loꞌo daang susah otin-e.

translation.en: Herod the ruler heard about all these things that were happening. He was confused because some people said, “John the Baptizer has risen from death.”
translation.bj: Takal Herodes mipin deꞌ daerah Galilea, iyoh klingah gah mukjizat deꞌ nai Yesus. Iyoh moꞌ bigaduh kila-e, sobab ogiꞌ nyaꞌa nang Yesus inoh Yohanes Pembaptis c deꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ idip.

translation.en: He said to them, “When you travel, don’t take a walking stick. Also, don’t carry a bag, food, or money. Take for your trip only the clothes you are wearing.
translation.bj: In Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e ponu, “Maꞌ toban oni-oni daang pimonu ingan; maꞌ toban sikuud; maꞌ toban duit; maꞌ toban sikabiat; maꞌ toban onyad ingan; duoh maꞌ toban pimakai ingan deꞌ bokon.

translation.en: Jesus said, “Stop!” Then he touched the servant’s ear and healed him.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ takap Yesus yomoꞌ toban keꞌ boli pimipin agama deꞌ paling ayuh-e, Petrus moꞌ nunaꞌ-e soꞌ juaꞌ.
Mokuaꞌ ningaꞌ hal inoh, Simon moꞌ bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus, yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Toganleh okuꞌ sobab okuꞌ itih nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa.”

translation.en: Every year Jesus’ parents went to Jerusalem for the Passover festival.
translation.bj: Takal umul Yesus simoong duwoh sowaꞌ, Yesus nunaꞌ pingoma-E odi keꞌ Yerusalem nyamut Onu Paskah inoh kodaꞌ deꞌ silalu-e.

translation.en: The Lord said, “If your faith is as big as a mustard seed, you can say to this mulberry tree, ‘Dig yourself up and plant yourself in the ocean!’ And the tree will obey you.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Nyam ingan ogiꞌ bisayaꞌ ingan motiꞌ luang sabih negeh, sina sijaꞌ-a tuduꞌ tongon koyuh inoh, ‘Numut odopmuꞌ nyeꞌ moꞌ jug odopmuꞌ deꞌ laut.’ Totap iyoh lasuꞌ nunaꞌ sinamuꞌ.” Toke duoh kuli

translation.en: “When the Son of Man comes again, you will know it. On that day he will shine like lightning flashes across the sky.
translation.bj: Sobab samah kodaꞌ jawaꞌ kijat deꞌ longit, munoh geh tieꞌ ijoꞌ takal Okuꞌ Onak Manusia yaꞌ nog lagiꞌ baꞌuh.

translation.en: Any of you who try to save the life you have will lose it. But you who give up your life for me will save it.
translation.bj: Moꞌ nyam nyaꞌa dasaꞌ ngakuꞌ Okuꞌ duoh pingunangkuꞌ deꞌ dunia itih, Okuꞌ Onak Manusia dasaꞌ geh yaꞌ ngakuꞌ nyaꞌa inoh takal Okuꞌ yaꞌ nog daang kuasaKuꞌ, duoh daang kuasa Samaꞌ baya kuasa malaikat-malaikat deꞌ kudus.

translation.en: Some of the Pharisees asked Jesus, “When will God’s kingdom come?”Jesus answered, “God’s kingdom is coming, but not in a way that you can see it.
translation.bj: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi sikien tuduꞌ Yesus, nang siniaꞌ Topaꞌ yaꞌ nog jadin Laja. Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Topaꞌ militah jadin laja idoh diꞌ-e mulai soꞌ tanda-tanda deꞌ dapod nyaꞌa kilin-e.

translation.en: When the apostles came back, they told Jesus what they had done on their trip. Then he took them away to a town called Bethsaida. There, he and his apostles could be alone together.
translation.bj: Takal pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ e Yesus paliꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ Yesus oni deꞌ moꞌ nai odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ. Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ ngijaꞌ pinunaꞌ sijaꞌ-a odi keꞌ kota deꞌ adon Betsaida.

translation.en: He will come and kill those farmers. Then he will lease the land to some other farmers.”When the people heard this story, they said, “This should never happen!”
translation.bj: Totu nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh nog yomoꞌ ngabos ayua deꞌ nyewa kobon-e inoh, yomoꞌ ngin tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon daꞌ sewa-e.” Ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nai ayua deꞌ sewa kobon inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ nang in tuduꞌ Yesus, “Maꞌ boow-e daꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ watnoh jadi neh!”
Yesus moꞌ kuab kitab inoh, Yoh moꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jugan kitab inoh, Yoh moꞌ guluꞌ yaꞌ ngajal. Suaꞌ nyaꞌa daang boli topat simayang ngiduang-E.

translation.en: But Jesus said to the apostles, “You give them something to eat.”They said, “We have only five loaves of bread and two fish. Do you want us to go buy food for all these people?” There are too many!
translation.bj: Pak-e in Yesus nyawot pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Ingan deꞌ halus ngin pinguman tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mutiꞌ.” Pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ nang in-e, “Deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ koꞌih itih jok-e limoh kuehf baya duwoh polong ikian. Koꞌih halus odi milih deꞌ baꞌuh lagiꞌ keꞌ sukup kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ kiang-kiang itih.”

translation.en: Then an expert in the law stood up to test Jesus. He said, “Teacher, what must I do to get eternal life?”
translation.bj: Gulu agama Yahudi moꞌ nyawot nang in-e, “Deꞌ daang buk-buk deꞌ nulis Musa deꞌ basa koꞌih in-e, ‘Nyayangleh Topaꞌ, sipunuaꞌ otinmuꞌ, sipunuaꞌ jiwamuꞌ, suaꞌ tenagamuꞌ, sipunuaꞌ pikilmuꞌ, yomoꞌ nyayangleh siodopmuꞌ manusia kodaꞌ muꞌu nyayang odopmuꞌ!’ ”

translation.en: Jesus said to another man, “Follow me!”But the man said, “Lord, let me go and bury my father first.”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ gituang-e nyakul pak-e iyoh poyaꞌ-poyaꞌ kumiat keꞌ bilakang oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e doiꞌ guna-e, watinoh geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ pak-e iyoh aluaꞌ natong pingidip oma-e iyoh idoh diꞌ-e dapod jadi umat Topaꞌ.”

translation.en: “This is what the story means: The seed is God’s teaching.
translation.bj: Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ uun totaꞌ lojaꞌ iyohleh kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ inoh, yoh tumuꞌ duoh biaꞌat; pak-e yoh bigaduh duoh idip-e, yoh yaꞌ idip mewah duoh sonang deꞌ dunia itih. Suaꞌ-e inohleh deꞌ odaꞌ odop-e munoꞌ ngapit nog diꞌ-e ponai bibuaꞌ masak.

translation.en: Then the women remembered what Jesus had said.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh dayung-dayung deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ lasuꞌ natong sina Yesus inoh.

translation.en: Jesus said to the Sadducees, “On earth, people marry each other.
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ samah kodaꞌ malaikat diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ ponai kobos, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ jadi onak Topaꞌ. Sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ idip baꞌuh.

translation.en: There the devil tempted Jesus for
translation.bj: Danoꞌ Yesus obuah suba odaꞌ Muot laja munua pat puluꞌ onu pat puluꞌ ngalom, deꞌ tian-tian inoh Yoh diꞌ-e man nog Yoh sukup pilai-e.

translation.en: Jesus said to him, “You can see now. You are healed because you believed.”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Ningaꞌ mei sobab muꞌu bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ muꞌu mokuaꞌ.”

translation.en: A man named Simeon lived in Jerusalem. He was a good man who was devoted to God. He was waiting for the time when God would come to help Israel. The Holy Spirit was with him.
translation.bj: Takal inoh deꞌ Yerusalem ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ adon-e Simeon. Simeon nyaꞌa deꞌ paguh, nyaꞌa deꞌ taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, Iyang Topaꞌ ogiꞌ duoh-e. Iyoh silalu bialap Laja deꞌ Janyi Topaꞌ nog nyilamat bangsa Israel.

translation.en: One day Jesus was in the Temple area teaching the people. He was telling them the Good News. The leading priests, teachers of the law, and older Jewish leaders came to talk to Jesus.
translation.bj: Takal Yesus ngajal duoh tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ. Takal inoh ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh, gulu-gulu agama Yahudi duoh pimipin ulang Yahudi nog,

translation.en: And when you find it, you will be very happy. You will carry it
translation.bj: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Watinoh geh lobih ayuh doon deꞌ jadi deꞌ sulga takal ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa bitobat, soꞌ pliꞌi puluꞌ pliꞌi naꞌan deꞌ paguh deꞌ diꞌ-e plelu bitobat.” Duit deꞌ moyap

translation.en: Jesus said to them, “I saw Satan falling like lightning from the sky.
translation.bj: Pak-e maꞌ yaꞌ sikia doon manah-manah sobab munua nulut deꞌ ingan, pak-e doonleh ingan sobab ogiꞌ adon ingan obuah nulis deꞌ sulga.” Yesus doon duoh bisukul

translation.en: The soldiers led Jesus away. At that same time there was a man from Cyrene named Simon coming into the city from the fields. The soldiers forced him to carry Jesus’ cross and walk behind him.
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ toban Yesus. Daang pimonu-e, bidapod duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Simon soꞌ Kirene, deꞌ tuong-e yaꞌ molot keꞌ kota. Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ gan salib noh deꞌ tun papi-e, odaꞌ yoh golong-e salib inoh gati Yesus.

translation.en: So the followers did this and everyone sat down.
translation.bj: Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ limoh libu naꞌan inoh man nog-e busuah. Yomoꞌ ogiꞌ simoong duwoh bakul kuban pinguman deꞌ diꞌ-e obuah man. Petrus ngakuꞌ Yesus Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ

translation.en: “But God said to that man, ‘Foolish man! Tonight you will die. So what about the things you prepared for yourself? Who will get those things now?’
translation.bj: Pak-e in Pingunang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ-e, ‘Muꞌu nyaꞌa deꞌ budua, ngalom itih muꞌu yaꞌ kobos, jadi kaꞌan osi halta deꞌ nguluk muꞌ noh?’

translation.en: I will show you the one to fear. You should fear God, who has the power to kill you and also to throw you into hell. Yes, he is the one you should fear.
translation.bj: Okuꞌ yaꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, tuduꞌ osi ingan patut tolu. Toluleh tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, sobab mokuaꞌ ngabos, Iyoh ogiꞌ kuasa kaꞌan tolan nyaꞌa kaang neraka, inoh Nyaꞌa deꞌ patut muꞌu tolu daꞌ-E.

translation.en: The teacher of the law answered, “The one who helped him.”Jesus said, “Then you go and do the same.”
translation.bj: Marta inoh ogiꞌ sudiꞌ-e deꞌ dayung deꞌ adon-e Maria. Maria inoh guluꞌ sinoꞌ poꞌon Yesus ngan-e ngojit pingunang-E.

translation.en: If the people living there love peace, your blessing of peace will stay with them. But if not, your blessing of peace will come back to you.
translation.bj: Loꞌo daang boli inoh man nuak sijaꞌ-e oni deꞌ ngin nyaꞌa tuduꞌ ingan; sobab nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja patut soꞌon pah-e. Maꞌ yaꞌ bilalih katiꞌ-kanih topat ingan loꞌo neh.

translation.en: People who have the lowest place in life now will have the highest place in God’s kingdom. And people who have the highest place now will have the lowest place in God’s kingdom.”
translation.bj: Pak-e Okuꞌ halus nyamung pimonuKuꞌ onu itih, tiaꞌ pagi duoh baton-e sobab diꞌ-e patut nabi obuah ngabos deꞌ sopaꞌ kota Yerusalem.

translation.en: John’s answer to this was, “I baptize you in water, but there is someone coming later who is able to do more than I can. I am not good enough to be the slave who unties his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ Herodes kibalot Yohanes keꞌ daang jel inohleh pingunai-e deꞌ lobih jaꞌat soꞌ pingunai jaꞌat-e deꞌ bokon. Yesus obuah baptis

translation.en: He sent them to tell about God’s kingdom and to heal the sick.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh moꞌ odaꞌ pinunaꞌ-E odi saꞌ-a odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ monam mokuaꞌ duoh tanon oniwat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.

translation.en: John criticized Herod the ruler for what he had done with Herodias, the wife of Herod’s brother, as well as for all the other bad things he had done.
translation.bj: Takal umul Yesus taluh puluꞌ sowaꞌ Yoh mulai kiloja. Nyaꞌa pikil nang, Yesus iyohleh onak Yusuf, onak Eli,

translation.en: And what about the seed that fell on the good ground? That is like the people who hear God’s teaching with a good, honest heart. They obey it and patiently produce a good crop.
translation.bj: Jadi, ngojit nyeꞌ bonal-bonal-e! Sobab nyaꞌa deꞌ tilimaꞌ oni deꞌ nang Kuꞌ, Topaꞌ odaꞌ yoh sukup lobih ngiloti lagiꞌ; pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang Kuꞌ, bial yoh pikil nang odop-e ngiloti sit, Topaꞌ yaꞌ nai yoh diꞌ-e ngiloti oni-oni.” Yesus duoh madih ayua-E

translation.en: The servant should not get any special thanks for doing his job. He is only doing what his master told him to do.
translation.bj: Kuli inoh diꞌ-e jolaꞌ obuah mudi sobab iyoh moꞌ nunaꞌ plitah toke-e.

translation.en: Everyone was filled with fear. They began praising God and said, “A great prophet is here with us!” and “God is taking care of his people.”
translation.bj: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa obuaꞌ tolu yoh moꞌ mudi Topaꞌ. Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ nang, “Niꞌ naꞌan nabi deꞌ ayuh moꞌ nog deꞌ uluk otoꞌ! Topaꞌ moh nog nyilamat umat-e!”

translation.en: The time is coming when people will say, ‘The women who cannot have babies are the ones God has blessed. It’s really a blessing that they have no children to care for.’
translation.bj: Sobab yaꞌ nog onu-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ nang, ‘Utung manah dayung deꞌ manang deꞌ doiꞌ onu-e ogiꞌ onak-e duoh siduaꞌ onak-e!’

translation.en: While the two men were saying these things to the other followers, Jesus himself came and stood among them. He said to them, “Peace be with you.”
translation.bj: Daang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ kilakal, tang-tang jaꞌ-e Yesus mujuag deꞌ uun odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ simadi-e nang, “Sonangleh ingan!”

translation.en: There will be great earthquakes, sicknesses, and other bad things in many places. In some places there will be no food for the people to eat. Terrible things will happen, and amazing things will come from heaven to warn people.
translation.bj: duoh tieꞌ sodiꞌ-e, daki-daki sijaꞌ-e yaꞌ jadi gempa bumi deꞌ dolas, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa miliap duoh obuah pinyakit deꞌ bijakit. Yaꞌ jadi oniꞌ deꞌ saluh-saluh deꞌ tolu nyaꞌa daꞌ-a duoh tanda-tanda dahsyat deꞌ longit.

translation.en: They all came to hear Jesus teach and to be healed of their sicknesses. He healed the people who were troubled by evil spirits.
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi kanoꞌ yaꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus, danoꞌ geh Yesus moꞌ odaꞌ onam odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mokuaꞌ. Ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ munua molot daang gonan-e suaꞌ geh odi kanoꞌ tuang mokuaꞌ geh.

translation.en: Later, the apostles began to argue about which one of them was the most important.
translation.bj: Kudu-kudu naꞌan soꞌ pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ bikalah osi deꞌ paling penting soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: As the crowd listened to what he was saying, Jesus went on to tell a story. He was now near Jerusalem and knew that the people thought it was almost time for God’s kingdom to come.
translation.bj: Takal Yesus moꞌ sinok soꞌ kota Yerusalem bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sakaꞌ nang takal Yesus nog keꞌ Yerusalem, Yoh lasuꞌ militah jadin Laja danoꞌ duoh pilopas negli Israel soꞌ penjajahan Roma. Sobab inoh Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan, in-e,

translation.en: Whoever will not carry the cross that is given to them when they follow me cannot be my follower.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ doliaꞌ-e sidia susah jolaꞌ duoh nunaꞌ Okuꞌ diꞌ-e dapod jadi pinunaꞌKuꞌ.

translation.en: One day Jesus and his followers got into a boat. He said to them, “Come with me across the lake.” And so they started across.
translation.bj: Yesus lasuꞌ in-e tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E noh, “Maꞌ tolu! Ingan halus bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.” Odop deꞌ-e munoꞌ ilan duoh daang kila tolu tuduꞌ Yesus yomoꞌ in-e sitipan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Osi sibonal-e nyaꞌa itih ngan sobak duoh gilumang nunaꞌ pingunang-e!” Yesus kasig munua soꞌ nyaꞌa Gerasa

translation.en: “The older son was angry and would not go in to the party. So his father went out and begged him to come in.
translation.bj: Samaꞌ-a moꞌ nyawot in-e, ‘Onakkuꞌ, muꞌu ali-ali ogiꞌ duoh okuꞌ datiꞌ. Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ okuꞌ tuang kakuꞌ muꞌu geh.

translation.en: I will give it all to you, if you will only worship me.”
translation.bj: Sobab daang Kitab moꞌ obuah nulis, ‘Topaꞌ odaꞌ malaikat-malaikat-E jaga Ingan.

translation.en: Give us the food we need for each day.
translation.bj: Ngin pinguman tuduꞌ koꞌih, deꞌ sukup bilang konu.

translation.en: So Peter and John left. Everything happened the way Jesus said. So they prepared the Passover meal.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ Petrus duoh Yohanes odi keꞌ Yerusalem yoh moꞌ tapod samah kodaꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e noh ti-e yomoꞌ nyidia pinguman Paskah-e. Perjamuan Topaꞌ

translation.en: A man named Jairus came to him. He was a leader of the synagogue. He had only one daughter. She was twelve years old, and she was dying. So Jairus bowed down at the feet of Jesus and begged him to come to his house.While Jesus was going to Jairus’ house, the people crowded all around him.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sikien deꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Osi deꞌ tomaꞌ Okuꞌ?” Suaꞌ nyaꞌa diꞌ-e ngakuꞌ-e. Yomoꞌ Petrus moꞌ in-e, “Gulu ogiꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kililing Ingan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bitodod-todod sinok ingan!”

translation.en: The angel said to her, “Don’t be afraid, Mary, because God is very pleased with you.
translation.bj: Inohleh sobab-e malaikat moꞌ sina in-e, “Maꞌ muꞌ tolu Maria, sobab Topaꞌ yaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh tuduꞌ muꞌu.

translation.en: He began to teach in the synagogues, and everyone praised him.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Doiꞌ nabi deꞌ obuah nabiꞌ deꞌ kupuaꞌ soꞌo obuah milaꞌ.

translation.en: The Son of Man came eating and drinking. And you say, ‘Look at him! He eats too much and drinks too much wine! He is a friend of tax collectors and other sinners!’
translation.bj: Niꞌ naꞌan ulang Farisi, adon-e Simon, ngijaꞌ Yesus odi man. Yesus moꞌ odi keꞌ boli-e Yoh moꞌ man.

translation.en: The two followers went into town. They found the donkey exactly like Jesus told them.
translation.bj: Ke duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ Yesus inoh moꞌ odi, yomoꞌ dapod suaꞌ oniꞌ danoꞌ samah kodaꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e.

translation.en: Then Jesus said, “Why do people say that the Messiah is the Son of David?
translation.bj: nog Okuꞌ monang tun musohmuꞌ.’

translation.en: “Suppose one of you has a servant who has been working in the field, plowing or caring for the sheep. When he comes in from work, what would you say to him? Would you say, ‘Come in, sit down and eat’?
translation.bj: “Nyam basa soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ ogiꞌ kuli deꞌ tukang nyakul deꞌ toyaꞌ kobon ingan keh, mokuaꞌ jaga koming ingan keh, asal kuli inoh paliꞌ nog boli podo ingan moꞌ lasuꞌ ngijaꞌ man?

translation.en: “On the judgment day, you people who live now will be compared with the queen of the South, and she will be a witness who shows how guilty you are. Why do I say this? Because she traveled from far, far away to listen to Solomon’s wise teaching. And I tell you that someone greater than Solomon is right here, but you won’t listen!
translation.bj: Takal Onu kiamat, latu negli Syeba yaꞌ mokat nyalah ingan nyaꞌa joman itih. Sobab joman nouh-e latu inoh nog soꞌ tubon bumi kaꞌan ngojit ajal Laja Salomo deꞌ bijak. Pak-e datiꞌ adin ogiꞌ Okuꞌ deꞌ lobih ayuh soꞌ Laja Salomo pak-e doliaꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ!

translation.en: Then the whole group stood up and led Jesus away to Pilate.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ Pengadilan Agama inoh mokat mujuag, yoh moꞌ toban Yesus tuduꞌ Pilatus.

translation.en: He learned that Jesus was under Herod’s authority. Herod was in Jerusalem at that time, so Pilate sent Jesus to him.
translation.bj: Takal yoh puꞌan nang Yesus soꞌ pulow deꞌ mipin Herodes, Pilatus moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ toban tuduꞌ Herodes, deꞌ takal noh boot-boot-e Herodes ogiꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem. Yesus deꞌ sulung jowin Herodes

translation.en: Also with these women were Joanna, the wife of Chuza (the manager of Herod’s property), Susanna, and many other women. These women used their own money to help Jesus and his apostles.
translation.bj: Yohana sowon Khuza, iyohleh pingulus daang istana Herodes; Susana baya bogoꞌ dayung deꞌ bokon tulung Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E kai duit odop-e masim-masim. Perumpamaan nyaꞌa miniaꞌ

translation.en: “But the father said to his servants, ‘Hurry! Bring the best clothes and put them on him. Also, put a ring on his finger and good sandals on his feet.
translation.bj: Pak-e takal inoh onak-e deꞌ pinuan ogiꞌ deꞌ umoh-e, takal iyoh paliꞌ, ngan-e moh sinok boli-e, iyoh moꞌ ngojit sowoꞌ lagu duoh sowoꞌ nyaꞌa bitanaꞌ.

translation.en: Moses clearly showed that people are raised from death. When Moses wrote about the burning bush, he said that the Lord is ‘the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’
translation.bj: Ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus noh, kudu-kudu naꞌan gulu-gulu agama Yahudi nang, “Bonal oniꞌ deꞌ nang Ingan inoh neh.”
Ki deꞌ lobih sonang, nang dosamuꞌ moꞌ obuah ngapun atou nang mokatleh duoh ponuleh!

translation.en: He said to them, “There is such a big harvest of people to bring in. But there are only a few workers to help harvest them. God owns the harvest. Ask him to send more workers to help bring in his harvest.
translation.bj: Sus odi, Okuꞌ pait ingan kodaꞌ onak domba keꞌ uluk kosuang deꞌ gaus.”

translation.en: I am no longer worthy to be called your son. But let me be like one of your hired workers.’
translation.bj: Pak-e samaꞌ-e inoh moꞌ mogan kuli-kuli-e yomoꞌ sina in-e, ‘Katiꞌ laju-e likas-e! Mit pimakai deꞌ paling paguh-e soꞌ tuduꞌ-e, yomoꞌ soꞌ sisin deꞌ tlinyu-e, duoh soꞌ kasut deꞌ poꞌon-e.

translation.en: Everyone who makes themselves important will be made humble. But everyone who makes themselves humble will be made important.”
translation.bj: Sobab osi deꞌ pakat odop-e, yoh yaꞌ obuah pimuun, osi deꞌ pimuun odop-e yoh yaꞌ obuah pakat.”

translation.en: I will never drink wine again until God’s kingdom comes.”
translation.bj: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Soꞌ adin Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tiyaꞌ nuak angul itih nog Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.”

translation.en: One time on a Sabbath day, Jesus was walking through some grain fields. His followers picked the grain, rubbed it in their hands, and ate it.
translation.bj: Takal onu Sabat Yesus ngilusuꞌ kobon gandum, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ tuk buaꞌ gandum deꞌ munoꞌ. Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ gisik gandum inoh deꞌ tongan-e ngan-e yaꞌ man isin-e.

translation.en: This is like the words written in the book of Isaiah the prophet:“There is someone shouting in the desert:‘Prepare the way for the Lord.Make the road straight for him.
translation.bj: Nimok nyeꞌ suaꞌ baluah, suaꞌ dolod, suaꞌ punguꞌ obuah pilata. Olan deꞌ bidikoꞌ bidiyuah obuah nongon, duoh deꞌ muguꞌ moluak obuah pilata.

translation.en: “But if you go into a town and the people don’t welcome you, then go out into the streets of that town and say,
translation.bj: ‘Debu kota ingan deꞌ lokat deꞌ poꞌon koꞌih, koꞌih nupapa saꞌ-e luluh deꞌ sulung jowin ingan saꞌ jadin tanda ingan yaꞌ obuah ukum. Pak-e natong nyeꞌ Topaꞌ moh nog jadin Laja daang idip ingan.’

translation.en: And if you can’t do the little things, why worry about the big things?
translation.bj: Nyam basa ingan diꞌ ngan ponai namah sit geh umul ingan, nai oni ingan bigaduh duoh oniꞌ deꞌ bokon!

translation.en: That night there may be two people sleeping in one room. One will be taken and the other will be left.
translation.bj: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Ngalom inoh duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ boꞌos daang niꞌ tilam, niꞌ naꞌan obuah mit toban buu, niꞌ naꞌan obuah supiah.

translation.en: Then Levi gave a big dinner at his house for Jesus. At the table there were many tax collectors and some other people too.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ noh Lewi nyamut Yesus yoh moꞌ ngunang pinagih suke duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon saꞌ-e suwaꞌ man samah-samah duoh odop-e.

translation.en: “Father, if you are willing, please don’t make me drink from this cup. But do what you want, not what I want.”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ bidoa Yesus paliꞌ lagi tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, Yoh ningaꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E boꞌos sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kowok duoh susah otin-e.

translation.en: Suppose someone is suing you, and you are both going to court. Try hard to settle it on the way. If you don’t settle it, you may have to go before the judge. And the judge will hand you over to the officer, who will throw you into jail.
translation.bj: Sobab, nyam ingan duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ lawan ingan odi tuduꞌ plitah, daang pimonu ingan subaleh bidamai saꞌ-e diꞌ-e toban ingan tuduꞌ hakim, yomoꞌ hakim moꞌ tod ingan tuduꞌ sidadu, sidadu inoh kibalot ingan daang jel.

translation.en: “Why can’t you decide for yourselves what is right?
translation.bj: “Odop ingan sipatut-e puꞌan oni deꞌ bonal.

translation.en: That’s what all those people who don’t know God are always thinking about. But your Father knows that you need these things.
translation.bj: Sobab suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ kalik nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, pak-e Samaꞌ ingan puꞌan suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ plelu ingan.

translation.en: I am not important,but he has shown his care for me, his lowly servant.From now until the end of time,people will remember how much God blessed me.
translation.bj: Iyoh natong okuꞌ, kuli-E deꞌ hina itih! Soꞌ adin suaꞌ-suaꞌ binua nang okuꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ paling sonang-e.

translation.en: The devil finished tempting Jesus in every way and went away to wait until a better time.
translation.bj: Pingunang Yesus suaꞌ-e paguh, yoh ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus suaꞌ-e bonal duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jadi ilan, yomoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-e, “Oni ngan-e ponai nang oni watinoh, Yoh kan jok-e onak Yusuf?”

translation.en: While Jesus was praying, his face began to change. His clothes became shining white.
translation.bj: Odop-e duwoh inoh daang jawaꞌ geh, yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus oniwat Yesus yaꞌ kobos deꞌ Yerusalem, kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah notu Topaꞌ.

translation.en: Then he will say to you, ‘I don’t know you. Where did you come from? Get away from me! You are all people who do wrong!’
translation.bj: Sobab, osi deꞌ nang odop-e bigatung yoh obuah pimuun, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ pimuun odop-e yoh obuah pakat.” Yesus masiꞌ tuduꞌ Yerusalem

translation.en: Then he said to John’s followers, “Go tell John what you have seen and heard: The blind can see. The crippled can walk. People with leprosy are healed. The deaf can hear. The dead are brought back to life. And the Good News is being told to the poor.
translation.bj: Jadi Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Paliꞌleh tuduꞌ Yohanes tanon oni deꞌ ngojit ingan duoh oni deꞌ kilin ingan, nyaꞌa butaꞌ ponai ningaꞌ, nyaꞌa gilagan ponai ponu, nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah onam kulit deꞌ sukup palah ponai mokuaꞌ, nyaꞌa bongam ponai klingah, nyaꞌa kobos ponai paliꞌ idip duoh Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ obuah tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag.

translation.en: Jesus was teaching in every town and village. He continued to travel toward Jerusalem.
translation.bj: Nyam nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli kuab tiban-e, ingan mujuag deꞌ sopaꞌ simadi netek-netek tiban, ingan nang, ‘Tulung, bukaꞌ leh tiban kaꞌan koꞌih!’ Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Osi ingan, idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ piluh ingan neh!’

translation.en: Eliakim was the son of Melea.Melea was the son of Menna.Menna was the son of Mattatha.Mattatha was the son of Nathan.Nathan was the son of David.
translation.bj: onak Kenan, onak Arpakhsad, onak Sem, onak Nuh, onak Lamekh,

translation.en: Jesus answered them, “It is the sick people who need a doctor, not those who are healthy.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ sehat diꞌ-e plelu doktol jok-e nyaꞌa deꞌ monam sijaꞌ-e.

translation.en: In Capernaum there was an army officer. He had a servant who was very sick; he was near death. The officer loved the servant very much.
translation.bj: Danoꞌ ogiꞌ panglima Roma deꞌ nyayang kuli-e. Kuli-e inoh monam, sinok-sinok-e yaꞌ kobos.
Ukum Topaꞌ samah kodaꞌ kapak deꞌ moꞌ sidia kaꞌan nobong tongon koyuh baya banang-banang-e deꞌ diꞌ-e ponai bibuaꞌ paguh, duoh yaꞌ obuah timalong kaang opui.”

translation.en: So he went through the whole area around the Jordan River and told the people God’s message. He told them to be baptized to show that they wanted to change their lives, and then their sins would be forgiven.
translation.bj: Kodaꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk deꞌ nulis Nabi Yesaya nouh-e, “Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nang bogan-e dolas-dolas deꞌ padang pasil, sidia leh olan kaꞌan Topaꞌ, pilataleh olan kaꞌan-E.

translation.en: Do any of you have a son? What would you do if your son asked you for a fish? Would any father give him a snake?
translation.bj: Doiꞌ ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan samaꞌ deꞌ ngin dipoh deꞌ onak-e takal onak-e mitiaꞌ ikian,

translation.en: Then Zechariah came outside, but he could not speak to them. So the people knew that he had seen a vision inside the Temple. He was not able to speak, so he could only make signs to the people.
translation.bj: Takal-e luah, iyoh diꞌ-e ponai sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yomoꞌ tanon tanda pakai tongan-e. Takal inoh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ puꞌan nang iyoh ogiꞌ kilin tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ.

translation.en: I have seen with my own eyes how you will save your people.
translation.bj: Sobab pakai botonkuꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ Pinyilamat deꞌ soꞌ Ingan.

translation.en: He said to them, “You brought this man to me. You said he was trying to change the people. But I judged him before you all and have not found him guilty of the things you say he has done.
translation.bj: Yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Ingan toban nyaꞌa itih tuduꞌ okuꞌ duoh napo nyaꞌa tih nang yoh ngasut rakyat. Adin deꞌ sulung jowin ingan, okuꞌ moꞌ sikien Iyoh, pak-e doiꞌ kuꞌ dapod salah-e kodaꞌ deꞌ napo ingan tuduꞌ-e.

translation.en: “You men have stayed with me through many struggles.
translation.bj: Daang suaꞌ susahkuꞌ ingan totap ogiꞌ bisamah-samah duoh Okuꞌ.
Suaꞌ nyaꞌa baya pinagih-pinagih suke ngojit pingunang Yesus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nunaꞌ pilitah Topaꞌ, sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ obuah baptis odaꞌ Yohanes.

translation.en: The angel said to them, “Don’t be afraid. I have some very good news for you—news that will make everyone happy.
translation.bj: Pak-e malaikat inoh moꞌ in-e, “Maꞌ tolu, Sobab Okuꞌ nog tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh kaꞌan ingan, Gah deꞌ odaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa sonang.”

translation.en: But the followers did not understand what he meant. The meaning was hidden from them so that they could not understand it. But they were afraid to ask Jesus about what he said.
translation.bj: Yoh moꞌ sina in-e tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-E, “Osi deꞌ nyamut onak opot itih daang adon Okuꞌ, iyoh nyamut Okuꞌ geh. Osi deꞌ yaꞌ nyamut Okuꞌ, iyoh nyamut geh SamaꞌKuꞌ deꞌ ngutus Okuꞌ katiꞌ. Sobab osi deꞌ paling isit-e soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ, iyohleh deꞌ paling ayuh-e.” Nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e lawan ingan loti-e yoh nuwaꞌ ingan

translation.en: So the man sent a third servant to the farmers. They hurt this servant badly and threw him out.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ odaꞌ kuli-e deꞌ ke taluh-e. Pak-e kuli-e inoh tuong obuah geh pakung pijolaꞌ nog-e kinaman simadi nyaꞌa munoꞌ matak toban luah soꞌ kobon inoh.

translation.en: Before you go into a house, say, ‘Peace be with this home.’
translation.bj: Nyam basa-e danoꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ patut tilimaꞌ bilokat inoh, sina inoh totap jadi tuduꞌ-e. Pak-e nyam basa-e idoh, sina inoh paliꞌ tuduꞌ odop ingan.

translation.en: The Lord said to him, “The washing you Pharisees do is like cleaning only the outside of a cup or a dish. But what is inside you? You want only to cheat and hurt people.
translation.bj: Sobab inoh Topaꞌ Yesus sina tuduꞌ-e, “Ingan ulang Farisi samah kodaꞌ pingian deꞌ bisig sopaꞌ-e sijaꞌ, pak-e nuwaꞌ daang otin odop ingan punuaꞌ odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat duoh pinganguak.

translation.en: Jesus answered, “You people today have no faith. Your lives are all wrong. How long must I be with you and be patient with you?” Then Jesus said to the man, “Bring your son here.”
translation.bj: “Ngojit nyeꞌ moꞌ nyikon daang otin ingan sinaKuꞌ itih, Okuꞌ Onak Manusia yaꞌ obuah ngin keꞌ tongan nyaꞌa deꞌ lawan Okuꞌ.”

translation.en: men, he will try to decide if he is able to defeat the other king who has
translation.bj: Piobuaꞌ-e Yesus sina, “Watinoh geh suaꞌ ingan. Niꞌ naꞌan pun doiꞌ soꞌ ingan deꞌ dapod jadi pinunaꞌKuꞌ nyam basa ingan diꞌ ngan posan susuaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ ingan.” Galuaꞌ deꞌ doiꞌ sap-e

translation.en: The Son of Man came to find lost people and save them.”
translation.bj: Sobab Okuꞌ Onak Manusia nog keꞌ dunia kaꞌan kalik duoh nyilamat nyaꞌa deꞌ moyap.” Perumpamaan duit mas

translation.en: Then the boy sat up and began to talk, and Jesus gave him back to his mother.
translation.bj: Onak bujang deꞌ moꞌ kobos inoh moꞌ mokat guluꞌ yoh moꞌ sina, mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ ngin tuduꞌ sinoꞌ-e.

translation.en: When you go into a house, stay there until it is time to leave.
translation.bj: Daki sijaꞌ-e ingan obuah tilimaꞌ, danoꞌ soꞌ ingan loꞌo nog ingan buu soꞌ topat inoh.

translation.en: days. Jesus ate nothing during this time, and when it was finished, he was very hungry.
translation.bj: Muot moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Muꞌu tih kan Onak Topaꞌ, odaꞌleh batuh itih jadi pinguman!”

translation.en: Er was the son of Joshua.Joshua was the son of Eliezer.Eliezer was the son of Jorim.Jorim was the son of Matthat.Matthat was the son of Levi.
translation.bj: onak Yakub, onak Ishak, onak Abraham, onak Terah, onak Nahor,

translation.en: They went in, but they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ molot kaang kubul inoh pak-e todang Yesus moꞌ doiꞌ daang-e.

translation.en: Jesus saw two boats at the shore of the lake. The fishermen were washing their nets.
translation.bj: Yesus ningaꞌ ogiꞌ duoh olud deꞌ bingon donu inoh doiꞌ nyaꞌa daang, nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ mokuaꞌ paliꞌ kalik ikian yomoꞌ mamiaꞌ jala-e.

translation.en: So they were not still dead, because he is the God only of living people. Yes, to God they are all still living.”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tiaꞌ blani sikien oni-oni tuduꞌ Yesus. Yesus duoh Daud

translation.en: Jesus said, “What are you talking about?”They said, “It’s about Jesus, the one from Nazareth. To God and to all the people he was a great prophet. He said and did many powerful things.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sikien, “Oni deꞌ jadi neh?” Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi tuduꞌ Yesus nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ Nazaret inoh. Iyoh inoh nabi. Sina duoh oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e suaꞌ-e bikuasa, paguh duoh bonal deꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa.

translation.en: Then Jesus said, “What is God’s kingdom like? What can I compare it to?
translation.bj: Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja samah kodaꞌ lagi deꞌ isit deꞌ obuah kaluꞌ duoh tepong deꞌ kiang oni nog-e komang.” Tiban deꞌ koꞌot

translation.en: The men who saw these things happen told the others all about how Jesus made the man well.
translation.bj: “Paliꞌleh duoh tanon oni deꞌ moꞌ nai Topaꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu.” Lasuꞌ nyaꞌa noh buu odi tanon keꞌ suaꞌ topat deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ kota-e, oni deꞌ moꞌ nai Yesus tuduꞌ-e. Yesus kidip onak Yairus duoh odaꞌ mokuaꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dayung deꞌ monam bonaꞌ

translation.en: So they went running and found Mary and Joseph. And there was the baby, lying in the feeding box.
translation.bj: Kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ nguan domba lasuꞌ odi. Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh dapod Maria duoh Yusuf baya kuweꞌ-e deꞌ piguling-e deꞌ topat pinguman binatang.

translation.en: One time Jesus was out praying, and when he finished, one of his followers said to him, “John taught his followers how to pray. Lord, teach us how to pray too.”
translation.bj: Niꞌ onu takal inoh Yesus odi bidoa keꞌ niꞌ topat. Mokuaꞌ bidoa, niꞌ soꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E sina tuduꞌ-e, “Gulu, suba ngajal koꞌih bidoa kodaꞌ Yohanes ngajal pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E bidoa.”

translation.en: And the third brother married the woman, and he died. The same thing happened with all the other brothers. They all died and had no children.
translation.bj: Soꞌ juꞌ madih odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kawin duoh dayung inoh. Moꞌ nyam-e watinoh, osi mun-e soꞌ juꞌ naꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ jadin bonon dayung inoh, takal onu nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos paliꞌ idip?”

translation.en: When the woman saw that she could not hide, she came forward, shaking. She bowed down before Jesus. While everyone listened, she told why she touched him. Then she said that she was healed immediately when she touched him.
translation.bj: Takal Yesus ngojit hal inoh, Yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yairus, “Maꞌ tolu, bisayaꞌ sijaꞌ-e, onakmuꞌ totap mokuaꞌ.”

translation.en: During that time it will be hard for women who are pregnant or have small babies, because very bad times will come to this land. God will be angry with these people.
translation.bj: Masiꞌ manah nyeꞌ ningaꞌ dayung-dayung deꞌ bitiiaꞌ duoh deꞌ aluaꞌ siduaꞌ onak-e takal inoh. Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ jolaꞌ sobab lolah posah saꞌan-e bikoduh buꞌu. Susuaꞌ nyaꞌa daang kota inoh yaꞌ sukup jolaꞌ-e takal bangsa itih obuah ngukum.

translation.en: In a loud voice she said to Mary, “God has blessed you more than any other woman. And God has blessed the baby you will have.
translation.bj: Elisabet moꞌ nang sina dolas-dolas-e, “Obuah bilokat muꞌu soꞌ suaꞌ dayung deꞌ bokon! Obuah bilokat onakmuꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ limokah!

translation.en: He will come ready to clean the grain. He will separate the good grain from the straw, and he will put the good part into his barn. Then he will burn the useless part with a fire that cannot be stopped.”
translation.bj: Takal Yohanes aluaꞌ diꞌ-e obuah jel yoh moꞌ baptis nyaꞌa bogoꞌ, Yesus moꞌ obuah baptis geh. Takal Yesus bidoa, longit tibukaꞌ,

translation.en: They said, “If you are the Messiah, then tell us that you are.”Jesus said to them, “If I tell you I am the Messiah, you will not believe me.
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nang, “Moꞌ nyam-e in noh, muꞌu itih Onak Topaꞌ?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Odop ingan deꞌ nang in inoh neh.”

translation.en: The time was coming near when Jesus would leave and go back to heaven. He decided to go to Jerusalem.
translation.bj: Takal pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ adon Yakobus duoh Yohanes moꞌ puꞌan hal inoh, yomoꞌ sina in-e, “Gulu tanahleh koꞌih odaꞌ opui muun soꞌ longit saꞌ nyouh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ!”

translation.en: And you know his commands: ‘You must not commit adultery, you must not murder anyone, you must not steal, you must not tell lies about others, you must respect your father and mother ….’”
translation.bj: Totu muꞌu moꞌ puꞌan plitah-plitah Topaꞌ: ‘Maꞌ biamai, maꞌ ngabos nyaꞌa, maꞌ noku, maꞌ sina pibulaꞌ, yomoꞌ nulut leh tuduꞌ pingomamuꞌ.’”

translation.en: You hypocrites! You can understand the weather. Why don’t you understand what is happening now?
translation.bj: Ingan nyaꞌa deꞌ lika pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ! Oni deꞌ jadi deꞌ bumi duoh longit ingan puꞌan tanda-e. Pak-e keajaiban deꞌ moh nai Kuꞌ joman itih idoh ingan puꞌan-e?” Bidamai duoh musohmuꞌ

translation.en: When his time of service was finished, he went home.
translation.bj: Takal onu kiloja-e moꞌ obuaꞌ, iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ boli-e.

translation.en: They said, “If you are the king of the Jews, save yourself!”
translation.bj: simadi-e sina, “Moꞌ nyam Ingan tok Laja ulang Yahudi, nyilamat leh odop Ingan!”

translation.en: I tell you, on the judgment day it will be worse for the people of that town than for the people of Sodom.
translation.bj: “Binasaleh ingan nyaꞌa soꞌ kota Khorazim duoh ingan nyaꞌa soꞌ kota Betsaida! Sobab nyam basa-e deꞌ kota Tirus b duoh deꞌ kota Sidon ogiꞌ mukjizat-mukjizat kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi tuduꞌ ingan, moꞌ tui odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyesalc duoh bitobat.

translation.en: Jesus was going through the city of Jericho.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E nog keꞌ kota Yerikho, Yomoꞌ nyamung pimonu-e ngilusuꞌ kota inoh.

translation.en: When the teachers of the law and the leading priests heard this story, they knew it was about them. So they wanted to arrest Jesus right then, but they were afraid of what the people would do.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina in neh, “Gulu, puꞌan koꞌih nang buak sina duoh ajal Ingan suaꞌ-e bonal, Ingan diꞌ ngan pilih-pilih nyaꞌa, Ingan ngajal nunaꞌ oni deꞌ paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ kaꞌan manusia.

translation.en: But Jesus said, “Why are you troubled? Why do you doubt what you see?
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oni ingan diꞌ bisayaꞌ daang otin ingan? Oni deꞌ soꞌ ingan tolu?

translation.en: He always gives mercyto those who worship him.
translation.bj: Duoh Topaꞌ silalu masiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip tolu tuduꞌ Iyoh.

translation.en: Then people will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
translation.bj: Takal inoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa kilin Okuꞌ Onak Manusia nog daang abun duoh punuaꞌ odaꞌ kuasa baya jawaꞌ deꞌ sukup telang.

translation.en: Jesus’ followers asked him, “What does this story mean?”
translation.bj: Yesus lasuꞌ nyawot, “Tuduꞌ ingan moꞌ obuah tanon gah deꞌ paguh oniwat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja, pak-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon Kuꞌ tanon kai perumpamaan, saꞌ-e nyam basa odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e kilin-e; duoh nyam basa odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngojit-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ngiloti-e geh.

translation.en: The angel came to her and said, “Greetings! The Lord is with you; you are very special to him.”
translation.bj: Malaikat inoh nog tuduꞌ Maria yoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Salam, muꞌu deꞌ obuah bilokat deꞌ jok-e saꞌan muꞌu soꞌ Topaꞌ, Topaꞌ bisamah duoh muꞌu!”

translation.en: It will bring light to those who live in darkness, in the fear of death.It will guide us into the way that brings peace.”
translation.bj: Iyoh nog toban jawaꞌ-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip daang mopung baya tolu yaꞌ kobos. Topaꞌ kayak otoꞌ saꞌ otoꞌ idip bidamai duoh-E.”

translation.en: You did not greet me with a kiss, but she has been kissing my feet since I came in.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ bisamah-samah guluꞌ man duoh Yesus, sina sitipan odop-e, “Osi nyaꞌa itih ngan-e dapod ngapun dosa nyaꞌa?”

translation.en: My son was dead, but now he is alive again! He was lost, but now he is found!’ So they began to have a party.
translation.bj: Kuli inoh moꞌ nyawot in-e, ‘Sudiꞌ ingan moꞌ paliꞌ! Samaꞌ ingan moꞌ odaꞌ koꞌih simoliah onak sapi deꞌ gomuꞌ tutuꞌ, sobab sudiꞌ ingan paliꞌ daang silamat!’

translation.en: They came near the town of Emmaus, and Jesus acted as if he did not plan to stop there.
translation.bj: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sinok-e yaꞌ nog keꞌ kupuaꞌ Emaus. Yesus singaji-e mun nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ pilasuꞌ pimonu-e.

translation.en: The followers said, “Look, Lord, here are two swords.” Jesus said to them, “That’s enough.”
translation.bj: Takal yoh nog danih Yesus sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e, “Bidoa leh saꞌ ingan diꞌ ngan labuꞌ daang dosa takal ngan obuah pingisuba.”

translation.en: Very early Sunday morning, the women came to the tomb where Jesus’ body was laid. They brought the sweet-smelling spices they had prepared.
translation.bj: Daang onu Minggu, suom-suom pagi-e dayung-dayung deꞌ munoꞌ odi keꞌ kubul. Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ toban inyuaꞌ lona deꞌ moꞌ sidia-e.

translation.en: Look at the birds. They don’t plant, harvest, or save food in houses or barns, but God feeds them. And you are worth much more than crows.
translation.bj: Suba ningaꞌ manuk kakuang deꞌ diꞌ-e bipuluah diꞌ-e ngutuam yomoꞌ doiꞌ geh basal-e, pak-e Topaꞌ ngin man daꞌ-e. Ingan juaꞌ lobih biloga soꞌ manuk-manuk inoh.

translation.en: Great blessings belong to those who don’t have a problem accepting me.”
translation.bj: Sonangleh nyaꞌa deꞌ totap bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.”

translation.en: Jesus looked around at all of them and then said to the man, “Hold out your hand.” The man held out his hand, and it was healed.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ ningaꞌ tuduꞌ suaꞌ-suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ. Yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos tongan-e inoh, “Jugan tonganmuꞌ.” Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ jugan tongan-e, tongan-e lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e.

translation.en: “When birds are sold, five small birds cost only two pennies. But God does not forget any of them.
translation.bj: Idoh keh ingan puꞌan nang, manuk piit limoh polong loga-e duwoh kiping pilak deꞌ diꞌ-e sikia biloga? Sungu-e kiang inoh niꞌ polong idoh geh diꞌ-e Topaꞌ komut-e.

translation.en: He thought to himself, ‘What will I do? I have no place to keep all my crops.’
translation.bj: Sidagal kaya inoh sina daang otin-e, ‘Bogoꞌ hasil gandum soꞌ umohkuꞌ, pak-e topat soꞌ kuꞌ yaꞌ nyikon-e diꞌ-e sukup.’

translation.en: “It will be bad for you Pharisees because you love to have the most important seats in the synagogues. And you love for people to show respect to you in the marketplaces.
translation.bj: Binasaleh ingan ulang Farisi! Ingan liga guluꞌ deꞌ topat-topat deꞌ suka obuah nabiꞌ daang boli topat simayang, duoh saji ingan odi keꞌ pasal-pasal saꞌ odop ingan obuah nabiꞌ.

translation.en: Jesus said to them, “At a wedding you can’t ask the friends of the bridegroom to be sad and fast while he is still with them.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ odi keꞌ boli topat biluman totu idoh diꞌ-e puasa sobab tunang deꞌ dali aluaꞌ bisamah-samah duoh odop-e.

translation.en: In the same way, it’s a happy time for the angels of God when one sinner decides to change.”
translation.bj: Kudu-kudu onu onak-e deꞌ sibusuꞌ inoh moꞌ jua susuaꞌ halta duman-e, yomoꞌ odi keꞌ pulow deꞌ sukup juaꞌ-e. Danoꞌ iyoh idip bual saꞌat sayou duit-e inoh duoh idip suat simun-e nog-e obuaꞌ halta inoh.

translation.en: It is the same with you. When you finish doing all that you are told to do, you should say, ‘We are not worthy of any special thanks. We have only done the work we should do.’”
translation.bj: Watinoh geh ingan. Nyam ingan moꞌ nai suaꞌ-suaꞌ kiloja deꞌ patut ingan nai-e, ingan moꞌ nang sijaꞌ-a, ‘Koꞌih itih madas kuli sijaꞌ-a, koꞌih jok koꞌih nai kiloja deꞌ patut koꞌih nai-e sijaꞌ-a.’ ” Simoong naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah onam kulit deꞌ sukup palah

translation.en: This is why God in his wisdom said, ‘I will send prophets and apostles to them. Some of my prophets and apostles will be killed by evil men. Others will be treated badly.’
translation.bj: Inoh sobab-e Topaꞌ sina daang bijak-e, ‘Okuꞌ yaꞌ ngutus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nabi-nabi duoh rasulKuꞌ, pak-e ogiꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ obuah ngabos duoh ogiꞌ deꞌ obuah nyiksa!’

translation.en: The Pharisees were listening to all these things. They criticized Jesus because they all loved money.
translation.bj: Dali deꞌ posan sowon-e yomoꞌ kawin duoh dayung deꞌ bokon yoh inoh biamai. Dali deꞌ kawin duoh dayung deꞌ moꞌ biposan yoh tuang biamai geh.” Sidagal duoh Lazarus

translation.en: This news about Jesus spread all over Judea and to all the other places around there.
translation.bj: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kupuaꞌ Yudea duoh kupuaꞌ deꞌ sinok noh moꞌ ngojit gah Yesus. Yesus duoh Yohanes Pembaptis

translation.en: Then, on the right side of the incense table, an angel of the Lord came and stood before Zechariah.
translation.bj: Takal inoh ogiꞌ malaikat Topaꞌ bitanga odop-e tuduꞌ Zakharia. Iyoh mujuag deꞌ nuwaꞌ touh mija soꞌ topat-e nyouh kinamai.

translation.en: good people who don’t need to change.
translation.bj: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Malaikat Topaꞌ doon kila-e sobab ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa moꞌ bitobat.” Onak deꞌ Moyap

translation.en: So they answered, “We don’t know the answer.”
translation.bj: Jadi odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Diꞌ koꞌih puꞌan neh.”

translation.en: There were also some women with him. Jesus had healed these women of sicknesses and evil spirits. One of them was Mary, who was called Magdalene. Seven demons had come out of her.
translation.bj: Mun noh geh ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan dayung deꞌ Yesus odaꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ munua duoh onam-e deꞌ bokon. Soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ogiꞌ Maria geh, deꞌ nyaꞌa sobot Magdalena deꞌ juꞌ munua luah soꞌ ang gonan-e;

translation.en: more followers. He sent them out in groups of two. He sent them ahead of him into every town and place where he planned to go.
translation.bj: Takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e ponu Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pakai perumpamaan, “Bogoꞌ podi deꞌ moꞌ siap nyeꞌ yaꞌ ngutuam-e, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ ngutuam diꞌ bogoꞌ. Sobab inoh mitiaꞌleh tuduꞌ Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ umoh, saꞌ-e odaꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa odi ngutuam podi.

translation.en: The people who were in front leading the group criticized the blind man. They told him to be quiet. But he shouted more and more, “Son of David, please help me!”
translation.bj: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ dioꞌ ponu moꞌ ngalah nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh joman bidaluag, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh makin-e dolas nang bogan-e, “Yesus onak-sukun laja Daud masiꞌleh tuduꞌ okuꞌ!”

translation.en: They arrested Jesus and took him away to the house of the high priest. Peter followed Jesus but stayed back at a distance.
translation.bj: Pak-e Petrus lasuꞌ nang, “Doiꞌ leh! Idoh diꞌ kuꞌ piluh nyaꞌa inoh neh!”

translation.en: When his parents saw him, they wondered how this was possible. And his mother said, “Son, why did you do this to us? Your father and I were very worried about you. We have been looking for you.”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Oni ngan Ingan kalik Okuꞌ? Idoh keh diꞌ Ingan puꞌan-e, Okuꞌ halus ogiꞌ daang Boli SamaꞌKuꞌ?”

translation.en: He came near Bethphage and Bethany, towns near the hill called the Mount of Olives. He sent out two of his followers.
translation.bj: Takal-e moꞌ yaꞌ nog deꞌ kupuaꞌ Betfage duoh Betania deꞌ punguꞌ Zaitun, Iyoh moꞌ odaꞌ duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ-e dioꞌ ponu,

translation.en: They did not understand this. While they were wondering about it, two men in shining clothes stood beside them.
translation.bj: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ mujuag daang-e ilan ningaꞌ oni deꞌ jadi danoꞌ, tang-tang sijaꞌ-e duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bikilap jaꞌ-e pimakai-e mujuag sinok odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: But his mother said, “No, he will be named John.”
translation.bj: pak-e sinoꞌ-e nang, “Idoh! Adon-e Yohanes.”

translation.en: But Jesus turned and criticized them for saying this.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Musang ogiꞌ topat-e loꞌo duoh manuk ogiꞌ solin-e pak-e Okuꞌ Onak Manusia doiꞌ soꞌ topat saꞌan Kuꞌ guling.”

translation.en: “So the manager called in each person who owed the master some money. He asked the first one, ‘How much do you owe my master?’
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus duit inoh moꞌ mogan osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ bilutang tuduꞌ toke-e, yoh moꞌ mogan nyaꞌa deꞌ keꞌ niꞌ-e, yoh sikien tuduꞌ-e, ‘Kudu tang muꞌ tuduꞌ tokekuꞌ?’

translation.en: About eight days after Jesus said these things, he took Peter, John, and James and went up on a mountain to pray.
translation.bj: Tang-tang tonga duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa nog sina tuduꞌ Yesus, deꞌ sina inoh Musa duoh Elia.
“Galuaꞌ inoh paguh saꞌan pinguman, pak-e moꞌ nyam galuaꞌ inoh moꞌ doiꞌ sap-e idoh toꞌ dapod odaꞌ pidiaꞌ lagiꞌ!

translation.en: But on the judgment day it will be worse for you than for Tyre and Sidon.
translation.bj: Ingan nyaꞌa soꞌ kota Kapernaum, ingan pikil Topaꞌ yaꞌ paꞌad ingan keꞌ sulga saꞌ-e ingan obuah nabiꞌ. Idoh! Pak-e ingan obuah pimuun kaang neraka!”

translation.en: John said many other things like this to encourage the people to change, and he told them the Good News.
translation.bj: yomoꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ muun keꞌ tun-E kodaꞌ manuk merpati. Yoh moꞌ kilingah sina Topaꞌ deꞌ in-e, “Muꞌu leh OnakKuꞌ deꞌ nyayang Kuꞌ deꞌ nyonang otinKuꞌ.” Sumuk babai Yesus

translation.en: The Pharisee stood alone, away from the tax collector. When the Pharisee prayed, he said, ‘O God, I thank you that I am not as bad as other people. I am not like men who steal, cheat, or commit adultery. I thank you that I am better than this tax collector.
translation.bj: Ulang Farisi noh mujuag sadiꞌ-e yoh moꞌ bidoa in-e, ‘O Topaꞌ tilimaꞌ kasih tuduꞌ Ingan, sobab okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, deꞌ pinganguak, pingakal, duoh biamai. Okuꞌ bisukul okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ kodaꞌ pinagih suke inoh.

translation.en: Jesus said to them, “Why are you sleeping? Get up and pray for strength against temptation.”
translation.bj: Takal pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus ningaꞌ oniꞌ jadi inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ lasuꞌ nang, “Gulu, podo ingan odaꞌ koꞌih nyelang negeh nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ pakai podang?”

translation.en: I have prayed that you will not lose your faith! Help your brothers be stronger when you come back to me.”
translation.bj: Pak-e Okuꞌ moh bidoa kaꞌan muꞌu Simon, saꞌ bisayaꞌmuꞌ togap duoh takal muꞌu moꞌ paliꞌ bitobat muꞌu ponai ngin simangat tuduꞌ madih ayuamuꞌ.”

translation.en: “If you go into a town and the people welcome you, eat the food they give you.
translation.bj: Duoh odaꞌleh nyaꞌa deꞌ monam danoꞌ mokuaꞌ nyeꞌ moꞌ tanon nang, ‘Topaꞌ moꞌ nog jadin Laja daang idip ingan.’

translation.en: Jesus came near Jerusalem. Looking at the city, he began to cry for it
translation.bj: Sobab yaꞌ nog onu-e musoh yaꞌ nog kapung ingan nunaꞌ sinung kota ingan boit-touh mun neh ngan neh yaꞌ nyelang ingan.

translation.en: He is the enemy, but know that I have given you more power than he has. I have given you power to crush his snakes and scorpions under your feet. Nothing will hurt you.
translation.bj: Takal inoh doonleh Yesus daang Iyang Topaꞌ, Yoh moꞌ bidoa in-e, “Okuꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Ingan, Samaꞌ, Topaꞌ deꞌ militah tun longit duoh bumi, sobab suaꞌ-e inoh Ingan sukan soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bijak duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ ponai; pak-e Ingan tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ponai. Samaꞌ, inohleh deꞌ nyonang otin Ingan.

translation.en: Everything that is hidden will become clear. Every secret thing will be made known, and everyone will see it.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tanon tuduꞌ Yesus nang, “Sinoꞌ duoh madih ayuaMuꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ sopaꞌ. Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ bitapod duoh ingan.”

translation.en: because the sun stopped shining. The curtain in the Temple was torn into two pieces.
translation.bj: Duoh tabial deꞌ daang Boli Topaꞌ totak tipiliaꞌ duwoh.

translation.en: The Scriptures say,‘He was considered a criminal.’ Isaiah
translation.bj: Sobab Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Ayat Kitab deꞌ nang in-e, ‘Iyoh obuah sobot nyaꞌa nang yoh inoh ulang jaꞌat,’ halus jadi tuduꞌ Okuꞌ. Sobab oni deꞌ obuah nulis daang Kitab moh jadi tuduꞌ Okuꞌ adin.”

translation.en: But suppose a stronger man comes and defeats him. The stronger man will take away the weapons that the first man trusted to keep his house safe. Then the stronger man will do what he wants with the other man’s things.
translation.bj: Pak-e Okuꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ lobih dolas soꞌ iyoh odi nyelang, yoh totap alah odaꞌKuꞌ, mokuaꞌ inoh mit suaꞌ senjata deꞌ kakuꞌ-e duoh toban halta-e buu.

translation.en: Heal the sick people who live there, and tell them, ‘God’s kingdom is now very near you!’
translation.bj: Pak-e nyam basa-e ingan molot keꞌ kupuaꞌ, nyaꞌa danoꞌ diꞌ-e tilimaꞌ ingan, odileh keꞌ olan laya daang kupuaꞌ inoh yomoꞌ tanon nang,

translation.en: But the Pharisees and experts in the law refused to accept God’s plan for themselves; they did not let John baptize them.)
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kodaꞌ onak opot deꞌ nai koduk-e deꞌ pasal, niꞌ uluk nang bogan-e tuduꞌ uluk deꞌ bokon, ‘Koꞌih mamak lagu deꞌ sonang kaꞌan ingan pak-e ingan doliaꞌ ngan gogo! Koꞌih ngilagu saꞌan nyaꞌa kobos pak-e idoh geh diꞌ ingan siꞌian!’

translation.en: Now filled with the Holy Spirit, Jesus returned from the Jordan River. And then the Spirit led him into the desert.
translation.bj: Yesus deꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ yoh moꞌ buu soꞌ sungi Yordan, yomoꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ mipin Yesus keꞌ padang pasil deꞌ ayuh.

translation.en: There was a sinful woman in that town. She knew that Jesus was eating at the Pharisee’s house. So the woman brought some expensive perfume in an alabaster jar.
translation.bj: Takal Simon deꞌ ngunang Yesus ningaꞌ hal inoh, yoh sina daang otin-e, “Nyam basa nyaꞌa itih nabi oni nai diꞌ-e puꞌan ngan dayung deꞌ tomaꞌ odop-E inoh, dayung adoh!”

translation.en: When their master sees that they are ready and waiting for him, it will be a great day for those servants. I can tell you without a doubt, the master will get himself ready to serve a meal and tell the servants to sit down. Then he will serve them.
translation.bj: Obuah bilokatleh kuli-kuli deꞌ moꞌ siap sidia takal toke-e nog. Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Toke inoh siap yaꞌ layan kuli-kuli-e inoh yomoꞌ odaꞌ guluꞌ, yomoꞌ ngin man tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: Today your Savior was born in David’s town. He is the Messiah, the Lord.
translation.bj: Onu itih moꞌ obuah milaꞌ kaꞌan ingan Pinyilamat manusia deꞌ kota laja Daud.d Yoh iyohleh Piayuh, Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ.
Yesus moꞌ buꞌu muaꞌ juꞌan-e. Kila-e taluh puluꞌ meter soꞌ pinunaꞌ-e, Iyoh moꞌ bikunyug duoh bidoa

translation.en: Jesus taught in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath day.
translation.bj: Danoꞌ ogiꞌ dayung deꞌ monam simoong moih sowaꞌ, iyoh mudug diꞌ-e ponai mujuag tongon sobab daang gonan-e ogiꞌ munua.

translation.en: There was also a very poor man named Lazarus. Lazarus’ body was covered with sores. He was often put by the rich man’s gate.
translation.bj: Sidagal inoh moꞌ nang bogan-e tuduꞌ Abraham, ‘O samaꞌkuꞌ Abraham! Masiꞌleh tuduꞌ okuꞌ! Odaꞌleh Lazarus suad tilinyu-e keꞌ daang piꞌin duoh natiag-e saꞌ-e misaꞌ jolaꞌkuꞌ sobab okuꞌ datiꞌ sukup nyam jolaꞌ-e daang opui datiꞌ.’

translation.en: But what about the servant who does not know what his master wants? He also does things that deserve punishment. But he will get less punishment than the servant who knew what he should do. Whoever has been given much will be responsible for much. Much more will be expected from the one who has been given more.”
translation.bj: Pak-e kuli deꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan oni deꞌ suka toke-e duoh nai oniꞌ deꞌ salah obuah posut kudu-kudu sidoh-e sijaꞌ-a. Sobab Topaꞌ ngalap bogoꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moh tilimaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ, duoh ngalap lobih bogoꞌ lagiꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tilimaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ sukup bogoꞌ lagiꞌ deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ.” Yesus toban opui

translation.en: Jesus said to her, “My daughter, you are made well because you believed. Go in peace.”
translation.bj: Takal Yesus nog deꞌ boli Yairus, Yoh joman nyaꞌa molot nunaꞌ odop-E; jok-e Petrus, Yohanes, Yakobus duoh sinoꞌ samaꞌ onak opot inoh sijaꞌ-e deꞌ soꞌon molot.

translation.en: “The son realized that he had been very foolish. He thought, ‘All my father’s hired workers have plenty of food. But here I am, almost dead because I have nothing to eat.
