translation.bj: Iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ boli samaꞌ-e. Daang pimonu keꞌ boli-e, soꞌ juaꞌ samaꞌ-e moꞌ kilin-e, samaꞌ-a moꞌ masiꞌ tuduꞌ-e. Yomoꞌ bikoduh tuduꞌ-e simadi-e dokuop baya sium-e.

translation.en: “You cannot serve two masters at the same time. You will hate one master and love the other. Or you will be loyal to one and not care about the other. You cannot serve God and Money at the same time.”
translation.bj: Moꞌ nyam-e watnoh lobih sonang kaꞌan Topaꞌ kasuap longit duoh bumi soꞌ sit ukum Topaꞌ tikadi.

translation.en: So the two men got up then and went back to Jerusalem. There they found the followers of Jesus meeting together. The eleven apostles and the people with them
translation.bj: Takal inoh odop-e deꞌ duwoh inoh lasuꞌ mokat piet odop-e paliꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem. Danoꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh dapod pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ simoong niꞌ naꞌan inoh moꞌ tikuluꞌ duoh dingan-dingan-e deꞌ bokon.

translation.en: “Teacher, Moses wrote that if a married man dies and had no children, his brother must marry his widow. Then they will have children for the dead brother.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh sudiꞌ-e kawin duoh ipal-e pak-e iyoh kobos geh, doiꞌ onak-e.

translation.en: People were eating, drinking, and getting married even on the day when Noah entered the boat. Then the flood came and killed them all.
translation.bj: Manusia bidu man nuak, bidu kalik sowon bonon-e, nog onu-e takal Nuh molot daang kapal-e yomoꞌ nog kilamu deꞌ sukup tui-e moꞌ lasuꞌ plongod suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: They untied it, but its owners came out. They said to the followers, “Why are you untying our donkey?”
translation.bj: Takal-e pilopas tolin keledai inoh soꞌ tiang, nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Oni nai ingan pilopas tolin keledai inoh soꞌ tiang-e neh?”

translation.en: But all seven brothers married her. So when people rise from death, whose wife will this woman be?”
translation.bj: Pak-e daang dunia deꞌ yaꞌ nog dali duoh dayung deꞌ ngakuꞌ deꞌ boton Topaꞌ kaꞌan-e paliꞌ idip baꞌuh idoh tiyaꞌ diꞌ-e kawin.

translation.en: “So you people who live now will be punished for the deaths of all the prophets who were killed since the beginning of the world.
translation.bj: Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngukum nyaꞌa joman itih sobab suaꞌ nabi-nabi moh obuah ngabos soꞌ sibungas dunia obuah nai.

translation.en: The boy said, ‘Your brother has come back, and your father killed the best calf to eat. He is happy because he has his son back safe and sound.’
translation.bj: Pak-e onak ingan deꞌ sibusuꞌ inoh moꞌ bual halta ingan duoh dayung adoh, pak-e takal iyoh paliꞌ ingan moꞌ simoliah onak sapi deꞌ gomuꞌ tutuꞌ kaꞌan-e!’

translation.en: sheep, but one of them gets lost. What will you do? You will leave the other
translation.bj: Nyam basa ingan moꞌ dapod domba deꞌ moyap inoh, totu otin ngan moꞌ munuas, ingan moꞌ golong-e,

translation.en: The leading priests and teachers of the law wanted to kill Jesus. But they were trying to find a quiet way to do it, because they were afraid of what the people would do.
translation.bj: pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi kalik watki wat gaya-e yaꞌ ngabos Yesus pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tolu jaꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai-e. Yudas situju yaꞌ nyelah Yesus

translation.en: When Jesus saw the men, he said, “Go and show yourselves to the priests.”While the ten men were going to the priests, they were healed.
translation.bj: Takal Yesus kilin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yomoꞌ nang in-e, “Sus odi, bitanga odop ingan tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi.” Daang pimonu-e deꞌ olan onam-e moꞌ mokuaꞌ.

translation.en: Yes, the Powerful One has done great things for me.His name is very holy.
translation.bj: Sobab Topaꞌ deꞌ Paling Bikuasa duoh deꞌ moꞌ nai bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ayuh tuduꞌ okuꞌ. Kudusleh adon-E!

translation.en: “Later, the servant said to him, ‘Master, I did what you told me to do, but we still have places for more people.’
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh kuli inoh moꞌ nang, ‘Suaꞌ oni deꞌ odaꞌ ingan moꞌ nai kuꞌ pak-e topat aluaꞌ bogoꞌ.’

translation.en: Then Jesus used this story: “There was a rich man who had some land. His land grew a very good crop of food.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ silita tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ perumpamaan in-e, “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan sidagal kaya, bogoꞌ hasil soꞌ umoh-e.
Nyaꞌa ngin buk deꞌ nulis nabi Yesaya tuduꞌ Yesus, takal Yoh bukaꞌ buk inoh yoh dapod ayat itih yomoꞌ basa-e,

translation.en: But I use the power of God to force out demons. This shows that God’s kingdom has now come to you.
translation.bj: Pak-e Okuꞌ kasig munua daang kuasa Topaꞌ, inohleh tanda Topaꞌ moꞌ mulai militah jadin Laja deꞌ uun ingan.

translation.en: “During the time of Elijah it did not rain in Israel for three and a half years. There was no food anywhere in the whole country. There were many widows in Israel during that time. But the fact is, Elijah was sent to none of those widows in Israel. He was sent only to a widow in Zarephath, a town in Sidon.
translation.bj: Takal onu moꞌ puꞌun ngumi, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kota inoh toban madih ayua-e deꞌ obuah masam-masam onam. Yesus moꞌ gan tongan-e keꞌ masim-masim odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mokuaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus.

translation.en: You are the mother of my Lord, and you have come to me! Why has something so good happened to me?
translation.bj: Bituah manah okuꞌ itih ngan sinoꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌkuꞌ nog tuduꞌ okuꞌ.

translation.en: They were doing these things even on the day when Lot left town. Then fire and sulfur rained down from the sky and killed them all.
translation.bj: Pak-e onu Lot buu soꞌ Sodom, onu inoh geh opui muun baya batuh deꞌ biduduꞌ labuꞌ soꞌ longit ngasul odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: God’s kingdom is like the seed of the mustard plant. Someone plants this seed in their garden. The seed grows and becomes a tree, and the birds build nests on its branches.”
translation.bj: Daang pimonu-E keꞌ Yerusalem, Yesus ngilusuꞌ kota-kota duoh kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ simadi-e ngajal.

translation.en: Remember that I will send you the one my Father promised. Stay in the city until you are given that power from heaven.”
translation.bj: Okuꞌ geh yaꞌ pait tuduꞌ ingan oni deꞌ moꞌ janyi Topaꞌ SamaꞌKuꞌ. Pak-e ingan halus kajon deꞌ kota itih nog kuasa deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ muun tun ingan.” Yesus maꞌad keꞌ sulga

translation.en: Give love and mercy the same as your Father gives love and mercy.
translation.bj: Ingan halus masiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa kodaꞌ Samaꞌ ingan deꞌ sulga tuang masiꞌ geh tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa.” Maꞌ sibalang nyalah nyaꞌa

translation.en: But they would not answer his question. So he took the man and healed him. Then he sent the man away.
translation.bj: Gulu-gulu agama Yahudi duoh ulang Farisi loꞌo sijaꞌ-e Yesus moꞌ tomaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh duoh odaꞌ mokuaꞌ, Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ buu.

translation.en: Good people have good things saved in their hearts. That’s why they say good things. But those who are evil have hearts full of evil, and that’s why they say things that are evil. What people say with their mouths comes from what fills their hearts.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ paguh nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh sobab otin-e punuaꞌ odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ paguh. Nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat sobab otin-e punuaꞌ odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat. Sobab oniꞌ deꞌ nang nyaꞌa kai bobaꞌ-e inoh, luah soꞌ otin-e.” Boli deꞌ togap
Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ bingon olan inohleh nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ ngojit; pak-e takal Muot nog, yoh mit Pingunang Topaꞌ soꞌ otin nyaꞌa inoh. Saꞌ nyaꞌa inoh diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ duoh diꞌ-e obuah nyilamat.

translation.en: Jesus went to the house. He let only Peter, John, James, and the girl’s father and mother go inside with him.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ kagong tongan onak opot inoh Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Mokat mei!”

translation.en: He was sent to the place of death and was in great pain. He saw Abraham far away with Lazarus in his arms.
translation.bj: Sidagal inoh moꞌ in-e, ‘Nyam-e watinoh tulungleh odaꞌleh Lazarus odi keꞌ boli pingomakuꞌ.

translation.en: “So don’t always think about what you will eat or what you will drink. Don’t worry about it.
translation.bj: Jadi maꞌ lika pikil oni deꞌ yaꞌ man ingan atou oni deꞌ yaꞌ nuak ingan duoh maꞌ bigaduh otin ingan.

translation.en: “It will be bad for you, you experts in the law! You have taken away the key to learning about God. You yourselves would not learn, and you stopped others from learning too.”
translation.bj: Binasaleh ingan gulu-gulu agama Yahudi! Kusi kaꞌan bukaꞌ tiban deꞌ odaꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ bonal ogiꞌ deꞌ ingan pak-e ingan doliaꞌ molot keꞌ daang kaꞌan kalik oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ lolah posah yaꞌ molot keꞌ daang-e ingan jaman-e.”

translation.en: But her sister Martha was busy doing all the work that had to be done. Martha went in and said, “Lord, don’t you care that my sister has left me to do all the work by myself? Tell her to help me!”
translation.bj: Tolah niꞌ geh deꞌ plelu nyeꞌ nai-e deꞌ biguna. Maria moꞌ pilih oniꞌ deꞌ paguh, deꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ ponai mit soꞌ-o.”

translation.en: “What would a homeowner do if he knew when a thief was coming? You know he would not let the thief break in.
translation.bj: Pak-e natong nyeꞌ, nyam basa-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli puꞌan pukul kudu pinoku yaꞌ nog, idoh diꞌ iyoh tanah odaꞌ pinoku molot kaang boli-e.

translation.en: “Satan has asked to test you men like a farmer tests his wheat. O Simon, Simon,
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Simon Petrus, “Simon, Simon, ngojit nyeꞌ! Muot moꞌ obuah ngin ijin odaꞌ nguji ingan samah kodaꞌ podi deꞌ obuah napan saꞌ-e pisah isin-e soꞌ oping-e.

translation.en: When it comes back, it finds that home all neat and clean.
translation.bj: Takal iyoh nog danih, yoh dapod boli inoh bisig duoh tiatul.

translation.en: But they kept on saying, “His teaching is causing trouble all over Judea. He began in Galilee, and now he is here!”
translation.bj: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bitokan paksa Pilatus lagiꞌ, “Pak-e soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal-e, yoh ngasut susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ Yudea; sibungas-e deꞌ Galilea, yoh moꞌ adin moꞌ nog katiꞌ.”

translation.en: She had a sister named Mary. Mary was sitting at Jesus’ feet and listening to him teach.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Marta, Marta, muꞌu sikia bigaduh duoh nyusah odopmuꞌ nai oniꞌ masam-masam.

translation.en: John’s followers told him about all these things. John called for two of his followers.
translation.bj: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yohanes tanon tuduꞌ Yohanes suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai Yesus. Yohanes moꞌ mogan duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ-e.

translation.en: The Son of Man has power on earth to forgive sins. But how can I prove this to you? Maybe you are thinking it was easy for me to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven.’ There’s no proof that it really happened. But what if I say to the man, ‘Stand up and walk’? Then you will be able to see that I really have this power.” So Jesus said to the paralyzed man, “I tell you, stand up! Take your mat and go home!”
translation.bj: Pak-e puꞌan muꞌ kedoh deꞌ bumi itih Okuꞌ Onak Manusia ogiꞌ kuasa kaꞌan ngapun dosa.” Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ gilagan inoh, “Mokat tunuk amuakmuꞌ sus paliꞌ.”

translation.en: “You can go now. But listen! I am sending you, and you will be like sheep among wolves.
translation.bj: In Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e ponu, “Maꞌ toban lopet, onyad atou kasut; yomoꞌ maꞌ nosaꞌ sina sikia tui duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ olan.

translation.en: One of the men sitting at the table with Jesus heard these things. The man said to him, “It will be a great blessing for anyone to eat a meal in God’s kingdom!”
translation.bj: Takal inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ suaꞌ man danoꞌ ngojit sina Yesus inoh ti-e, yoh moꞌ sina, “Utung manah nyaꞌa deꞌ man bisamah duoh Topaꞌ takal Yoh nog jadin Laja.”

translation.en: and to announce that the time has come for the Lord to show his kindness.” Isaiah
translation.bj: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ boli topat simayang inoh, sukup-sukup tiwas takal-e ngojit hal inoh.

translation.en: A short time later, someone else saw Peter and said, “You are also one of them.”But Peter said, “Man, I am not!”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ kumiat ningaꞌ Petrus. Mokuaꞌ inoh Petrus moꞌ lasuꞌ natong sina Topaꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e, “Aluaꞌ diꞌ siuak bitadu onu tih, ogiꞌ taluh sidoh muꞌu diꞌ muꞌ ngakuꞌ Okuꞌ neh.”

translation.en: One time there were seven brothers. The first brother married a woman but died. He had no children.
translation.bj: Watinoh geh deꞌ obuah sudiꞌ-e deꞌ nomol taluh nog ke juꞌ-e.

translation.en: Jesus warned them not to tell anyone.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ in sina-E tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, “Osi deꞌ yaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ, halus sidia lawan oni deꞌ nang kila-e; sidia susah jolaꞌ bilang konu daang idip-e, yomoꞌ sitelus-e nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.

translation.en: “Suppose a woman has ten silver coins, but she loses one of them. She will take a light and clean the house. She will look carefully for the coin until she finds it.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sina lagiꞌ in-e, “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan samaꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ duwoh naꞌan onak dali.

translation.en: When all the people were being baptized, Jesus came and was baptized too. And while he was praying, the sky opened,
translation.bj: onak Matica, onak Amos, onak Nahum, onak Hesli, onak Nagai,

translation.en: When the people in the synagogue heard this, they were very angry.
translation.bj: Soꞌ siliꞌ jawaꞌ, Yesus ponu keꞌ niꞌ topat deꞌ otug-otug-e doiꞌ manah nyaꞌa daꞌ-e. Pak-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa mulai kalik-E, takal nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ tapod-E, yoh moꞌ jaman Yesus buu.

translation.en: But they had no children. Elizabeth could not have a baby, and both of them were very old.
translation.bj: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh aluaꞌ doiꞌ onak-e sobab Elisabet manang yomoꞌ soꞌ duwoh odop-e moꞌ sikia nyoma.

translation.en: When the farmers saw the son, they said to each other, ‘This is the owner’s son. This vineyard will be his. If we kill him, it will be ours.’
translation.bj: Pak-e takal ayua nyaꞌa deꞌ nyewa kobon inoh ningaꞌ onak nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh nog, yomoꞌ sina sitipan odop-e, in-e, ‘Ningaꞌ! Deꞌ nog inoh onak odop nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon, iyoh deꞌ yaꞌ kakuꞌ kobon itih takal samaꞌ-e doiꞌ, jaꞌ toꞌ ngabos-e saꞌ kobon itih jadin kakuꞌ otoꞌ.’

translation.en: But Jesus said, “The time will come when all that you see here will be destroyed. Every stone of these buildings will be thrown down to the ground. Not one stone will be left on another.”
translation.bj: “Tieꞌ sodiꞌ, suaꞌ oni deꞌ ningaꞌ ingan itih obuah pilubuh, niꞌ kiluang batuh tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ lokat bisusun duoh dingan-e, suaꞌ-suaꞌ obuaꞌ posik-polai katiꞌ-kanih.”

translation.en: Pilate asked Jesus, “Are you the king of the Jews?”Jesus answered, “Yes, what you say is true.”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh, Pilatus moꞌ sikien tuduꞌ Yesus, “Podo bonal muꞌu Laja ulang Yahudi?” Yesus nyawot-e, “Odop ingan deꞌ nang in noh.”

translation.en: “When a strong man with many weapons guards his own house, the things in his house are safe.
translation.bj: Beelzebul laja munua inoh, kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dolas, senjata-e lekap kaꞌan-e jaga boli-e saꞌ-e silamat.

Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ tanaꞌ bibatuh iyohleh kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ inoh, yoh moꞌ tilimaꞌ daang otin-e sonang; pak-e Pingunang Topaꞌ inoh diꞌ-e tumuꞌ biaꞌat daang otin-e. Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bisayaꞌ niꞌ tiliaꞌ-e geh, pak-e takal pingisuba nog, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tiaꞌ bisayaꞌ.
Pak-e Yesus ponu deꞌ osah odop-e deꞌ munoh Yoh moꞌ buu. Yesus daang boli topat simayang deꞌ kota Kapernaum

translation.en: He wanted to see who Jesus was. There were many others who wanted to see Jesus too. Zacchaeus was too short to see above the people.
translation.bj: Iyoh yaꞌ ningaꞌ oni mun nyaꞌa deꞌ adon-e Yesus inoh, pak-e ngan juag-e kodoꞌ yomoꞌ diꞌ-e ponai kilin-e sobab nyaꞌa sikia lami.

translation.en: Everyone was completely amazed and began to praise God. They were filled with great respect for God’s power. They said, “Today we saw amazing things!”
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ Nyaꞌa deꞌ ningaꞌ hal inoh ilan-e simadi-e mudi Topaꞌ. Duoh daang kila tolu nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nang, “Ilan kuꞌ nyam-e ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ moh jadi onu itih!” Pinagih suke deꞌ adon Lewi nunaꞌ Yesus

translation.en: What you say in the dark will be told in the light. And what you whisper in a private room will be shouted from the top of the house.”
translation.bj: Sobab oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nutu ingan, sijakaꞌ-jakaꞌ-e totap puꞌan nyaꞌa geh duoh oni deꞌ bikayas ingan daang bilit, totap nyaꞌa deꞌ sopaꞌ puꞌan-e geh.

translation.en: “The Spirit of the Lord is on me.He has chosen me to tell good news to the poor.He sent me to tell prisoners that they are freeand to tell the blind that they can see again.He sent me to free those who have been treated badly
translation.bj: Watinoh geh joman nabi Elisa ogiꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ Israel obuah onam kulit deꞌ sukup palah, pak-e doiꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mokuaꞌ, jok-e Naaman nyaꞌa soꞌ negli Siria inoh.”

translation.en: But Jesus turned and said to the women, “Women of Jerusalem, don’t cry for me. Cry for yourselves and for your children too.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ kumiat Yoh moꞌ sina, “Ingan dayung-dayung Yerusalem! Maꞌ ngan siꞌien saꞌan Okuꞌ. Siꞌien leh saꞌan odop ingan duoh onak opot ingan.

translation.en: Pilate called all the people together with the leading priests and the Jewish leaders.
translation.bj: Pilatus moꞌ nguluk pimipin-pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh, pimipin-pimipin Yahudi, duoh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ.

translation.en: Jesus spoke to the group that came to arrest him. They were the leading priests, the older Jewish leaders, and the Jewish soldiers. He said to them, “Why did you come out here with swords and clubs? Do you think I am a criminal?
translation.bj: Deꞌ uun limang boli pimipin agama inoh, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa nai opui daꞌ-e yomoꞌ Petrus moꞌ suaꞌ geh guluꞌ sinok nyaꞌa deꞌ bikuluk ngan-e ngunuh.

translation.en: I tell you, not one of those people I invited first will eat any of this food I prepared.’”
translation.bj: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Niꞌ naꞌan doiꞌ geh soꞌ deꞌ tamu-tamu deꞌ obuah ngunang inoh dapod man pinguman deꞌ pestaKuꞌ itih.’” Posan suaꞌ oniꞌ moꞌ nyeꞌ yaꞌ nunaꞌ Topaꞌ

translation.en: The synagogue leader was angry because Jesus healed on the Sabbath day. He said to the people, “There are six days for work. So come to be healed on one of those days. Don’t come for healing on the Sabbath day.”
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ datiꞌ ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dayung soꞌ onak-sukun Abraham, deꞌ moh simoong moih sowaꞌ ogiꞌ Muot daang gonan-e. Idoh keh iyoh dapod obuah pilopas soꞌ Muot daang Onu Sabat?”

translation.en: measures.’
translation.bj: Nyam basa-e nyaꞌa diꞌ-e dapod bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan odaꞌ ngulus halta deꞌ isit daang dunia, lobih lagiꞌ Topaꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan odaꞌ ngulus halta sulga deꞌ ayuh.

translation.en: If the people in the town will not welcome you, go outside the town and shake the dust off your feet as a warning to them.”
translation.bj: Daki soꞌ ingan diꞌ-e obuah tilimaꞌ, asal ingan buꞌu soꞌ kanoꞌ ingan nguguah a debu soꞌ poꞌon ingan, saꞌ jadi tanda tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.”

translation.en: Then Jesus said, “Who touched me?”They all said they had not touched him. And Peter said, “Master, people are all around you, pushing against you.”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ dayung inoh, “MadihKuꞌ, sobab muꞌu bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, muꞌu mokuaꞌ. Buuleh toban otin deꞌ sonang.”

translation.en: But Mary was very confused about what the angel said. She wondered, “What does this mean?”
translation.bj: Maria moꞌ gogoh sijaꞌ-e ngojit sina malaikat inoh, yoh moꞌ sina daang otin-e oni loti salam inoh.

translation.en: It was about that same time that Augustus Caesar sent out an order to all people in the countries that were under Roman rule. The order said that everyone’s name must be put on a list.
translation.bj: Kila-kila nuam bulan mokuaꞌ Yohanes obuah milaꞌ, takal inoh Kaisara Agustus ngin pilitah tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kerajaan Roma odi daftal odop-e deꞌ kupuaꞌ sumuk babai-e, ngan-e yaꞌ ngituang nyaꞌa.

translation.en: Peter said, “Lord, did you tell this story for us or for all people?”
translation.bj: Petrus moꞌ sikien in-e, “Gulu, podo koꞌih sijaꞌ-e deꞌ ngajal Ingan daang perumpamaan itih atou suaꞌ nyaꞌa?”

translation.en: “But before all these things happen, people will arrest you and do bad things to you. They will judge you in their synagogues and put you in jail. You will be forced to stand before kings and governors. They will do all these things to you because you follow me.
translation.bj: Pak-e takal suaꞌ hal inoh aluaꞌ diꞌ-e jadi ingan obuah takap nyaꞌa nyiksa ingan, ingan obuah ngadel deꞌ boli topat simayang yomoꞌ kibalot ingan kaang jel, ingan moꞌ obuah toban keꞌ jowin laja-laja duoh pinguasa sobab ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.

translation.en: He had a servant who took care of his garden. So he said to his servant, ‘I have been looking for fruit on this tree for three years, but I never find any. Cut it down! Why should it waste the ground?’
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌ kobon inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Maꞌ dioꞌ doh tanah saꞌ-e idip daang niꞌ sowaꞌ itih, saꞌ kuꞌ suba nyakul tanaꞌ deꞌ puꞌun-e yomoꞌ dabul abok daꞌ-a,

translation.en: Simon answered, “I think it would be the one who owed him the most money.”Jesus said to him, “You are right.”
translation.bj: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Dosa-e deꞌ bogoꞌ noh moh obuah ngapun! Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ nang dosa odop-e isit, yoh diꞌ-e plelu bogoꞌ obuah ngapun jadi yoh isit geh nyayang.”

translation.en: So he called to one of the servant boys and asked, ‘What does all this mean?’
translation.bj: Pak-e iyoh nyawot samaꞌ-e in-e, ‘Moꞌ bisowaꞌ-sowaꞌ okuꞌ kiloja lolah posah kaꞌan ingan, doiꞌ onukuꞌ lawan sina ingan. Oni deꞌ ngin ingan tuduꞌ okuꞌ? Niꞌ onak koming tuang doiꞌ geh ingan ngin tuduꞌ okuꞌ saꞌ okuꞌ man duoh dingan-dingankuꞌ neh!

translation.en: Jesus went into the Temple area. He began to throw out the people who were selling things there.
translation.bj: Bilang konu Yesus ngajal deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ, pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi baya nyaꞌa deꞌ timogah adon-e deꞌ ulang Israel bilusaha oni wat-e yaꞌ ngabos Yesus,

translation.en: Then Zechariah, John’s father, was filled with the Holy Spirit and told the people a message from God:
translation.bj: Zakharia, samaꞌ onak kueꞌ inoh punuaꞌ daang Iyang Topaꞌ, yomoꞌ tanon sibaya soꞌ Topaꞌ.

translation.en: The law of the Lord also says that people must give a sacrifice: “You must sacrifice two doves or two young pigeons.” So Joseph and Mary went to Jerusalem to do this.
translation.bj: Kaꞌan upacara kibisig, odop-e duoh inoh ngin kulban tuduꞌ Topaꞌ. Yoh moꞌ toban duwoh polong manuk, kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah notu daang pilitah Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa, “Nyouhleh duwoh polong manuk gugul atou duwoh polong manuk merpati.” Simeon ningaꞌ Yesus

translation.en: Many thousands of people came together. There were so many people that they were stepping on each other. Before Jesus spoke to the people, he said to his followers, “Be careful of the yeast of the Pharisees. I mean that they are hypocrites.
translation.bj: Takal bilibu-libu nyaꞌa bogoꞌ bitodod-todod bikuluk. Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-E in-e, “Tauꞌ-tauꞌ tuduꞌ ulang Farisi sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ liga pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ, jaꞌ ingan samah kodaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: Believe me when I say that some of you people standing here will see God’s kingdom before you die.”
translation.bj: Takal-E bidoa, jowin duoh pimakai Yesus moꞌ bilubah jawaꞌ sijaꞌ-e.

translation.en: Give to everyone who asks you for something. When someone takes something that is yours, don’t ask for it back.
translation.bj: Nyam nyaꞌa mitiaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ muꞌu nginleh inoh tuduꞌ-e, nyam basa-e ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mit nyaꞌa soꞌ muꞌu maꞌ jolaꞌ mitiaꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ-e.

translation.en: When Moses and Elijah were leaving, Peter said, “Master, it is good that we are here. We will put three tents here—one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.” (He did not know what he was saying.)
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh ogiꞌ sina luah soꞌ aang abun inoh in-e, “Itihleh Onak deꞌ moꞌ notuKuꞌ! Ngojit nyeꞌ oni deꞌ nang-E!”

translation.en: All the people were amazed at the great power of God.The people were still amazed about all the things Jesus did. He said to his followers,
translation.bj: Niꞌ onu takal inoh pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ bikaꞌi-bikalah sitipan odop-e ngan yaꞌ puꞌan osi deꞌ paling ayuh.

translation.en: The book of Isaiah the prophet was given to him. He opened the book and found the place where this is written:
translation.bj: Topaꞌ diꞌ-e odaꞌ Elia odi tuduꞌ jana-jana Israel, pak-e odaꞌ odi jok-e tuduꞌ niꞌ jana deꞌ Sarfat deꞌ Sidon.

translation.en: But the people there would not welcome Jesus because he was going toward Jerusalem.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi keꞌ kupuaꞌ deꞌ bokon. Hal nunaꞌ Yesus

translation.en: John the Baptizer came and did not eat the usual food or drink wine. And you say, ‘He has a demon inside him.’
translation.bj: Pak-e bijak Topaꞌ tonga soꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tlimaꞌ ajal-E.” Yesus deꞌ boli Simon ulang Farisi

translation.en: But Peter said, “Man, I don’t know what you are talking about!”Immediately, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang jaga Yesus moꞌ ngatiaꞌ kaso Yesus simadi nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ biposud bipupuꞌ duoh-E.

translation.en: Then Jesus told this story: “Look at all the trees. The fig tree is a good example.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh, Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan, “Suba ningaꞌ tongon dunuk atou tongon koyuh oni sijaꞌ-e,
Yesus odi keꞌ Nazaret topat soꞌ Yoh ayuh. Daang Onu Sabat kodaꞌ deꞌ biasa-e Yoh odi keꞌ boli topat simayang, Yoh mujuag ngan-e yaꞌ basa Kitab.

translation.en: I tell you, God will help his people quickly. But when the Son of Man comes again, will he find people on earth who believe in him?”
translation.bj: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Topaꞌ totap lasuꞌ tulung odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ daang suaꞌ oniꞌ. Nyam basa-e, Okuꞌ Onak Manusia nog baꞌuh, aluaꞌ ogiꞌ kedoh keh Okuꞌ dapod nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ daang dunia itih?” Perumpamaan ulang Farisi duoh pinagih suke

translation.en: That is why I did not come to you myself. You need only to give the order, and my servant will be healed.
translation.bj: Inohleh sobab-e okuꞌ jaꞌ-e diꞌ bilani bidapod duoh Ingan. Jadi sobot sijaꞌ-e nang mokuaꞌ, kulikuꞌ totap lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ.

translation.en: “But it will be bad for you Pharisees! You give God a tenth of the food you get, even your mint, your rue, and every other little plant in your garden. But you forget to be fair to others and to love God. These are the things you should do. And you should also continue to do those other things.
translation.bj: Pak-e binasaleh ingan, ulang-ulang Farisi! Ingan diꞌ-e piduli oniꞌ deꞌ lobih penting. Ingan nunaꞌ pilitah Topaꞌ bayal persepuluhan soꞌ pimuluah, pak-e ingan diꞌ ingan adil tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon duoh ingan diꞌ-e nyayang Topaꞌ. Paduhal suaꞌ-e inoh halus ingan nai-e.

translation.en: When these things begin to happen, stand up tall and don’t be afraid. Know that it is almost time for God to free you!”
translation.bj: Asal suaꞌ inoh moꞌ jadi, mokatleh nyeꞌ moꞌ pakat jowinmuꞌ, maꞌ tolu sobab diꞌ-e tiaꞌ tui Topaꞌ yaꞌ nog nyilamat muꞌu.” Bilajal soꞌ tongon dunuk

translation.en: Levi got up, left everything, and followed Jesus.
translation.bj: Lewi moꞌ mujuag togan kiloja-e, yoh moꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus.

translation.en: Joda was the son of Joanan.Joanan was the son of Rhesa.Rhesa was the son of Zerubbabel.Zerubbabel was the son of Shealtiel.Shealtiel was the son of Neri.
translation.bj: onak Isai, onak Obed, onak Boas, onak Salmon, onak Nahason,

translation.en: The next day, Jesus traveled through some cities and small towns. Jesus told the people a message from God, the Good News about God’s kingdom. The twelve apostles were with him.
translation.bj: Diꞌ tui mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus ponu soꞌ kota keꞌ kota duoh kupuaꞌ keꞌ kupuaꞌ kaꞌan odi tanon gah deꞌ paguh oniwat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja. Soꞌ simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ-E bisamah-samah duoh Iyoh.

translation.en: The whole world, earth and sky, will be destroyed, but my words will last forever.
translation.bj: “Longit duoh bumi yaꞌ musuap-moyap pak-e sinaKuꞌ itih diꞌ-e yaꞌ ponai musuap-moyap.

translation.en: “But how bad it will be for you rich people,because you had your easy life.
translation.bj: Pak-e binasaleh ingan deꞌ kaya adin sobab ingan moꞌ blasa kiꞌan sonang!

translation.en: An evil spirit comes into him, and then he shouts. He loses control of himself and foams at the mouth. The evil spirit continues to hurt him and almost never leaves him.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Tok boꞌow mun suaꞌ ingan deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ duoh deꞌ kolas otin-e! Moh sukup tui Okuꞌ loꞌo duoh bisabal tuduꞌ ingan. Pak-e ingan idoh bonal-bonal bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ. Toban onakmuꞌ katiꞌ.”

translation.en: They worshiped him and went back to Jerusalem very happy.
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikunyug nyomah Yoh, yomoꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem daang otin deꞌ sonang manah-manah-e,

translation.en: Everyone who heard about these things wondered about them. They thought, “What will this child be?” They could see that the Lord was with him.
translation.bj: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit gah inoh moꞌ sina daang otin-e, “Yaꞌ jadi oni onak-e inoh tiaꞌ ijoꞌ?” Sobab Topaꞌ moꞌ bisamah duoh-o. Zakharia tanon sibaya soꞌ Topaꞌ

translation.en: But the time will come when the groom will be taken away from them. Then his friends will fast.”
translation.bj: Pak-e takal tunang deꞌ dali inoh obuah mit soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ. Takal inohleh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ puasa.”

translation.en: (Barabbas was a man who was in jail for starting a riot in the city and for murder.)
translation.bj: (Barabas obuah jel luban-e yoh ngijaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kota Yerusalem lawan plitah Roma duoh ngabos nyaꞌa.)

translation.en: “If you wanted to build a building, you would first sit down and decide how much it would cost. You must see if you have enough money to finish the job.
translation.bj: Nyam niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ ingan yaꞌ kajuag niꞌ boli deꞌ bigatung, totu yoh guluꞌ ngituang dioꞌ biaya-e saꞌ-e puꞌan podo duit-e sukup kaꞌan pijadi boli inoh atou idoh.

translation.en: But the angel said to him, “Zechariah, don’t be afraid. Your prayer has been heard by God. Your wife Elizabeth will give birth to a baby boy, and you will name him John.
translation.bj: Pak-e malaikat inoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Maꞌ tolu, Zakharia! Sobab Topaꞌ moꞌ ngojit doamuꞌ, sowonmuꞌ Elisabet yaꞌ milaꞌ onak dali, yomoꞌ muꞌu halus biladon onak inoh Yohanes.

translation.en: Jesus answered, “You have read about what David did when he and the people with him were hungry.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot ulang Farisi deꞌ munoꞌ, “Aluaꞌ doiꞌ keh ingan basa silita oni deꞌ nai Daud takal yoh duoh ayua deꞌ nunaꞌ-e pilai?

translation.en: he began to speak to them. He said, “While you heard me reading these words just now, they were coming true!”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nang munua inoh, “Loꞌo! Luahleh soꞌ nyaꞌa itih!” In Yesus tuduꞌ munua inoh. Munua inoh moꞌ paꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ molot-e daang gonan-e deꞌ jowin suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ. Yomoꞌ munua inoh luah soꞌ gonan nyaꞌa inoh pak-e diꞌ-e kanam-e.

translation.en: Every valley will be filled,and every mountain and hill will be made flat.Crooked roads will be made straight,and rough roads will be made smooth.
translation.bj: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dunia yaꞌ ningaꞌ Topaꞌ nyilamat manusia!”

translation.en: They gave him a piece of cooked fish.
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngin niꞌ polong ikian deꞌ moꞌ masak-e tuduꞌ Yesus.

translation.en: Someone said to Jesus, “Your mother and your brothers are standing outside. They want to see you.”
translation.bj: Takal odop deꞌ munoꞌ bilayal Yesus boꞌos. Tang-tang sobak libut nog deꞌ donu inoh, piꞌin mulai molot kaang olud-e duoh olud duam-e yaꞌ kuom.

translation.en: Late in the afternoon, the twelve apostles came to Jesus and said, “No one lives in this place. Send the people away. They need to find food and places to sleep in the farms and towns around here.”
translation.bj: Takal onu yaꞌ ngumi, keꞌ simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ ti-e odi tuduꞌ Yesus yomoꞌ sina in-e, “Paguh Ingan odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mutiꞌ buu keꞌ kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ deꞌ sinok katiꞌ, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ soꞌon pinguman duoh topat-e ngilumon, sobab topat itih doiꞌ oni-oni daꞌ-e.”

translation.en: Some other seed fell among thorny weeds. This seed grew, but later the weeds stopped the plants from growing.
translation.bj: Ogiꞌ geh biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ daang totaꞌ lojaꞌ. Totaꞌ lojaꞌ inoh tumuꞌ bisayaꞌ duoh biniaꞌ inoh. Yomoꞌ ngapit-e nog-e kobos.

translation.en: “Be careful not to spend your time having parties and getting drunk or worrying about this life. If you do that, you won’t be able to think straight, and the end might come when you are not ready.
translation.bj: Natong nyeꞌ! Maꞌ sikia pikil idip ingan duoh nuak mabuk jaꞌ ingan diꞌ ingan siap takal onu inoh tang-tang nog.

translation.en: There is a kind of baptism that I must suffer through. I feel very troubled until it is finished.
translation.bj: Pak-e ogiꞌ susah jolaꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ Kuꞌ obuah dioꞌ. Otinkuꞌ susah nyam natong oni deꞌ yaꞌ obuah odopkuꞌ neh.

translation.en: The apostles said to the Lord, “Give us more faith!”
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ rasul deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, tulungleh koꞌih saꞌ koꞌih lobih bisayaꞌ.”

translation.en: The people who were close friends of Jesus were there. Also, there were some women who had followed Jesus from Galilee. They all stood far away from the cross and watched these things.
translation.bj: Duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ piluh Yesus, baya dayung-dayung deꞌ nunaꞌ Yoh soꞌ Galilea, ningaꞌ soꞌ juaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moh jadi.

translation.en: Instead, when you give a feast, invite the poor, the crippled, and the blind.
translation.bj: Pak-e moꞌ muꞌ yaꞌ biluman ngunang leh ulang-ulang deꞌ sotok ulang-ulang deꞌ cacat, nyaꞌa deꞌ gilagan duoh nyaꞌa butaꞌ.

translation.en: He will save us from our enemiesand from the power of all those who hate us.
translation.bj: kaꞌan pilopas otoꞌ soꞌ musoh baya soꞌ kuasa nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ otoꞌ.

translation.en: Mary stayed with Elizabeth for about three months and then went home.
translation.bj: Kulang lobih taluh bulan Maria loꞌo duoh Elisabet, ke iyoh paliꞌ keꞌ boli-e. Yohanes Pembaptis limokah

translation.en: Jesus said to the Pharisees and experts in the law, “Is it right or wrong to heal on the Sabbath day?”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus sikien tuduꞌ gulu-gulu agama Yahudi duoh ulang Farisi deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, “Nunaꞌ ukum agama otoꞌ soꞌon kedoh otoꞌ odaꞌ mokuaꞌ nyaꞌa daang Onu Sabat?”

translation.en: “Then another servant came in and said to the king, ‘Sir, here is your bag of money. I wrapped it in a piece of cloth and hid it.
translation.bj: Kuli ke taluh-e moꞌ in-e, ‘Itihleh niꞌ kiping duit mas deꞌ ngin ingan tuduꞌ okuꞌ, nyikonkuꞌ daang sapu tongan.

translation.en: I tell you, no one ever born is greater than John. But even the least important person in God’s kingdom is greater than John.”
translation.bj: Pak-e ulang Farisi duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi inoh doliaꞌ-e tlimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ doliaꞌ-e obuah baptis odaꞌ Yohanes.

translation.en: So the secret thoughts of many will be made known. And the things that happen will be painful for you—like a sword cutting through your heart.”
translation.bj: Watinoh geh, nyaꞌa yaꞌ puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ nyikon daang kila nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon. Yomoꞌ yaꞌ nog onu-e otinmuꞌ monam kodaꞌ obuah ngamuk kai asual deꞌ lojaꞌ.” Hana ningaꞌ Yesus

translation.en: If someone hits you on the side of your face, let them hit the other side too. If someone takes your coat, don’t stop them from taking your shirt too.
translation.bj: Simoꞌo nyaꞌa napal paningmuꞌ deꞌ nuwaꞌ boit nginleh biaꞌ paningmuꞌ deꞌ nuwaꞌ touh. Nyam nyaꞌa mit jubah muꞌ ngin tuduꞌ-e baya bojuhmuꞌ.

translation.en: They will be afraid and worried about what will happen to the world. Everything in the sky will be changed.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa obuaꞌ yaꞌ kobos-kobos nyam-e tolu tuduꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jadi deꞌ tun dunia tih, sobab deꞌ tun auu longit obuaꞌ yaꞌ tiguyang-tikusuok.

translation.en: When I heard your voice, the baby inside me jumped with joy.
translation.bj: Takal okuꞌ ngojit salam muꞌu, onak daang toꞌinkuꞌ lasuꞌ kimilit doon.

translation.en: So he left and went to his father.“While the son was still a long way off, his father saw him coming and felt sorry for him. So he ran to him and hugged and kissed him.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh odi mit onak sapi deꞌ paling gomuꞌ tutuꞌ, nyeꞌ moꞌ simoliah-e. Saꞌ otoꞌ man lami-lami simadi otoꞌ bisukul.

translation.en: Peace in heaven and glory to God!”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Moꞌ nyam pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌKuꞌ diꞌ-e nang bogan-e, batuh-batuh deꞌ munoꞌ, deꞌ olan itih deꞌ yaꞌ nang bogan in tih geh.” Yesus siꞌien takal-e ningaꞌ kota Yerusalem

translation.en: Anna, a prophetess, was there at the Temple. She was from the family of Phanuel in the tribe of Asher. She was now very old. She had lived with her husband seven years
translation.bj: Ogiꞌ geh niꞌ nabi, odop-e dayung deꞌ moꞌ nyoma, umul-e moꞌ moih puluꞌ pat sowaꞌ, adon-e Hana.

translation.en: Outside, the people were still waiting for Zechariah. They were surprised that he was staying so long in the Temple.
translation.bj: Takal inoh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ kajon Zakharia, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ilan oni ngan Zakharia tian oni daang Boli Topaꞌ.

translation.en: When one of them saw that he was healed, he went back to Jesus. He praised God loudly.
translation.bj: Takal niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngoon onam-e moꞌ mokuaꞌ, iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus daang-e sina dolas-dolas-e mudi Topaꞌ.

translation.en: If you do good only to those who do good to you, should you get any special praise for doing that? No, even sinners do that!
translation.bj: Nyam ingan nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nai paguh duꞌ ingan sijaꞌ-e, patut keh ingan obuah mudi! Nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa tuang nai watnoh geh.

translation.en: Then Jesus said, “Which one of these three men do you think was really a neighbor to the man who was hurt by the robbers?”
translation.bj: Takal Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E daang pimonu-e odi keꞌ Yerusalem, yomoꞌ nog keꞌ niꞌ kupuaꞌ. Ogiꞌ dayung deꞌ adon Marta odaꞌ Yesus nosaꞌ deꞌ boli-e.

translation.en: I can tell you without a doubt, the master will choose that servant to take care of everything he owns.
translation.bj: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Totu toke inoh yaꞌ paꞌad pakat-e jadi pigawas kaꞌan suaꞌ-suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ-e.

translation.en: Then the Pharisees and the teachers of the law began to complain, “Look, this man welcomes sinners and even eats with them!”
translation.bj: Sobab inohleh ulang Farisi duoh gulu agama Yahudi bigotub-bigonom in-e, “Ningaꞌ Nyaꞌa noh tilimaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa baya man duoh-o!”

translation.en: The Samaritan went to him and poured olive oil and wine on his wounds. Then he covered the man’s wounds with cloth. The Samaritan had a donkey. He put the hurt man on his donkey, and he took him to an inn. There he cared for him.
translation.bj: Nyuang-nyuang silita Yesus, yoh moꞌ sikien tuduꞌ gulu agama Yahudi in-e, “Osi mei deꞌ soꞌ taluh naꞌan nyaꞌa noh deꞌ bonal-bonal nyayang nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah lapok inoh?”

translation.en: “So the servant returned and told his master what happened. The master was angry. He said, ‘Hurry! Go into the streets and alleys of the town. Bring me the poor, the crippled, the blind, and the lame.’
translation.bj: Kuli inoh paliꞌ yomoꞌ tanon tuduꞌ tuan-e oni ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ doliaꞌ-e odi. Tuan-e moꞌ tiwas yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ kuli-e, ‘Laju nyeꞌ odi keꞌ olan, keꞌ lolong duoh keꞌ pasal kota itih duoh toban nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag, nyaꞌa deꞌ cacat, nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ duoh gilagan.’

translation.en: The men guarding Jesus made fun of him and beat him.
translation.bj: Sipagi-e, pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi, pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi bikuluk, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ toban Yesus keꞌ Pengadilan Agama-e.

translation.en: It was the
translation.bj: Daang sowaꞌ ke simoong limoh Kaisar Tiberius militah Roma, sowaꞌ inoh Pontius Pilatus jadi gubenul deꞌ propinsi Yudea, duoh Herodes laja deꞌ militah deꞌ propinsi Galilea. Watnoh geh Filipus, madih soꞌ Herodes militah deꞌ propinsi Iturea duoh Trakhonitis, Lisanias iohleh laja deꞌ propinsi Abilene.

translation.en: He will be great. People will call him the Son of the Most High God, and the Lord God will make him king like his ancestor David.
translation.bj: Yoh yaꞌ jadi piayuh timogah duoh yaꞌ obuah sobot Onak Topaꞌ deꞌ Paling Bigatung-e. Topaꞌ yaꞌ pakat yoh jadi Laja kodaꞌ Daud sumuk babai-E.

translation.en: “When an evil spirit comes out of someone, it travels through dry places, looking for a place to rest. But it finds no place to rest. So it says, ‘I will go back to the home I left.’
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Nyam basa munua luah soꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa, munua inoh ngilayou keꞌ topat-topat deꞌ bokon sape nog topat deꞌ bodoh ngan kalik topat-e loꞌo, pak-e nyam iyoh diꞌ-e dapod-e, sobab inohleh iyoh sina in-e, ‘Okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ boli deꞌ moh ogiꞌ onukuꞌ loꞌo daꞌ-e!’

translation.en: Then the second brother married the woman, and he died.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh dayung inoh tuong kobos geh.

translation.en: times more grain.”Jesus finished the story. Then he called out, “You people who hear me, listen!”
translation.bj: Pinunaꞌ-pinuanaꞌ-E lasuꞌ sikien tuduꞌ Yesus oni loti soꞌ perumpamaan inoh.

translation.en: And all their neighbors were afraid. In all the hill country of Judea, people continued talking about these things.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo sinoꞌ iyoh moꞌ tolu, ngojit duoh ningaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ jadi, gah inoh suaꞌ-suaꞌ nyaꞌa ngojit-e nog suaꞌ dolod-dolod deꞌ propinsi Yudea.

translation.en: I tell you, many prophets and kings wanted to see what you now see, but they could not. And they wanted to hear what you now hear, but they could not.”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot, in-e, “Oni deꞌ basa ingan daang buk-buk deꞌ nulis Musa? Oni deꞌ pikil ingan daang-e?”

translation.en: But Jesus said, “Peter, before the rooster crows tomorrow morning, you will say you don’t know me. You will say this three times.”
translation.bj: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e: “Petrus, Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ muꞌu: Aluaꞌ diꞌ siuak babang bitadu sipagi itih muꞌu moꞌ taluh sidoh diꞌ muꞌ ngakuꞌ Okuꞌ.” Lopet duoh podang

translation.en: Mary said to the angel, “How will this happen? I am still a virgin.”
translation.bj: In Maria tuduꞌ malaikat inoh, “Pak-e okuꞌ tih dayung bujang tiboon, oni wat-e ngan neh ponai jadi watinoh?”

translation.en: Jesus answered, “God can do things that are not possible for people to do.”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot, “Oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e molot akal saꞌan otoꞌ manusia, molot akal saꞌan Topaꞌ.” Pah nunaꞌ Topaꞌ

translation.en: But some of the people said, “He uses the power of Satan to force demons out of people. Satan is the ruler of demons.”
translation.bj: Pak-e ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa nang, “Iyoh ponai kasig munua sobab kai kuasa Beelzebul,a laja suaꞌ munua inoh.”

translation.en: “The rich man said, ‘Then please, father Abraham, send Lazarus to my father’s house on earth.
translation.bj: Pak-e Abraham moh nyawot-e, ‘Moꞌ nyam plitah Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa duoh nabi-nabi yoh doliaꞌ-e ngojit duoh nunaꞌ-e lobih lagiꞌ moꞌ nyam nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos paliꞌ idip deꞌ tanon, yoh totap idoh diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ.’ ”

translation.en: And you, Capernaum, will you be lifted up to heaven? No, you will be thrown down to the place of death!
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ Yesus sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Osi deꞌ ngojit ingan, iyoh ngojit Okuꞌ. Osi deꞌ nulak ingan, iyoh nulak Okuꞌ. Osi deꞌ nulak Okuꞌ, iyoh nulak geh SamaꞌKuꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.” Juꞌ puluꞌ pinunaꞌ Yesus paliꞌ

translation.en: “You will see Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and all the prophets in God’s kingdom. But you will be left outside. There you will cry and grind your teeth with pain.
translation.bj: Takal onu inoh geh, ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi odi tuduꞌ Yesus yomoꞌ sina, “Maꞌ loꞌo datiꞌ! Buuleh keꞌ topat deꞌ bokon, sobab Herodes yaꞌ ngabos Ingan.”

translation.en: When he heard about Jesus, he sent some older Jewish leaders to him. He wanted the men to ask Jesus to come and save the life of his servant.
translation.bj: Takal panglima inoh ngojit gah Yesus, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan pimipin ulang Yahudi odi tuduꞌ Yesus, odaꞌ mitiaꞌ saꞌ Yesus odi duoh odaꞌ kuli-e mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e.

translation.en: I know what I will do! I will do something to make friends, so that when I lose my job, they will welcome me into their homes.’
translation.bj: Puꞌan kuꞌ oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai kuꞌ takal kuꞌ obuah piloꞌo neh, okuꞌ halus bogoꞌ dingan deꞌ laꞌan tlimaꞌ okuꞌ odaꞌ loꞌo deꞌ boli-e.’

translation.en: The shepherds went back to their sheep, praising God and thanking him for everything they had seen and heard. It was just as the angel had told them.
translation.bj: Kudu-kudu naꞌan gembala deꞌ nguan domba inoh paliꞌ keꞌ padang topat-e nguan binatang simadi-e mudi Topaꞌ deꞌ sulga, sobab suaꞌ oni deꞌ ngojit-e, suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ-e bonal-bonal kodaꞌ deꞌ nang malaikat.

translation.en: Naggai was the son of Maath.Maath was the son of Mattathias.Mattathias was the son of Semein.Semein was the son of Josech.Josech was the son of Joda.
translation.bj: onak Melea, onak Mina, onak Matata, onak Natan, onak Daud,

translation.en: While the followers watched, he took the fish and ate it.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ mit ikian inoh yomoꞌ lasuꞌ man-e deꞌ jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: “This is how it will be for anyone who saves things only for himself. To God that person is not rich.”
translation.bj: Wat inohleh deꞌ jadi tuduꞌ tiap-tiap nyaꞌa deꞌ nguluk halta saꞌan odop-e, pak-e iyoh diꞌ-e kaya deꞌ jowin Topaꞌ.” Bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ

translation.en: But the men shouted, “Jesus! Master! Please help us!”
translation.bj: yomoꞌ sina dolas-dolas-e, “Yesus! Gulu! Masiꞌleh tuduꞌ koꞌih!”

translation.en: One time Jesus was sending a demon out of a man who could not talk. When the demon came out, the man was able to speak. The crowds were amazed.
translation.bj: Niꞌ onu takal Yesus kasig munua luah soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bebeꞌ. Mokuaꞌ munua inoh luah, nyaꞌa inoh dapod sina, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa ilan-e.

translation.en: She went into Zechariah’s house and greeted Elizabeth.
translation.bj: Danoꞌ iyoh molot keꞌ boli Zakharia, yomoꞌ ngin salam tuduꞌ Elisabet.

translation.en: A voice came from the cloud and said, “This is my Son. He is the one I have chosen. Obey him.”
translation.bj: Onu deꞌ nikan-e takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ muun soꞌ bung dolod ogiꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa nog yaꞌ bitapod duoh Yesus.

translation.en: Everyone will hate you because you follow me.
translation.bj: Ingan yaꞌ obuah buꞌui sobab ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.

translation.en: Then everyone will seehow God will save his people!’” Isaiah
translation.bj: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa odi tuduꞌ Yohanes saꞌ-e obuah baptis. Yohanes moꞌ sina in-e, “Ingan nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat! Maꞌ ingan pikil ponai lopas soꞌ ukum Topaꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nog, moꞌ ingan jok ngan obuah baptis sijaꞌ-a.

translation.en: But Jesus said to him, “Judas, are you using the kiss of friendship to hand over the Son of Man to his enemies?”
translation.bj: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ lasuꞌ nang, “Moh tiaꞌ!” Daang-e lasuꞌ tomaꞌ kojit nyaꞌa inoh ngan-e daꞌ mokuaꞌ.

translation.en: Anna was there when Joseph and Mary came to the Temple. She praised God and talked about Jesus to all those who were waiting for God to free Jerusalem.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ pingoma Yesus nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ halus-e yoh nai-e, nunaꞌ pilitah Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ Nazaret deꞌ Galilea.

translation.en: Forgive our sins,just as we forgive everyone who has done wrong to us.And don’t let us be tempted.’”
translation.bj: Ngapunleh dosa koꞌih, sobab koꞌih ngapun suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nai salah tuduꞌ koꞌih. Maꞌleh tanah koꞌih odaꞌ idoh bisayaꞌ takal koꞌih obuah suba.’”

translation.en: Then the Holy Spirit made Jesus feel very happy. Jesus said, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth. I am thankful that you have hidden these things from those who are so wise and so smart. But you have shown them to people who are like little children. Yes, Father, you did this because it’s what you really wanted to do.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus kumiat yomoꞌ sina in-e tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E sijaꞌ-a, “Sonangleh ingan deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moh jadi adin.

translation.en: Then Peter went outside and cried bitterly.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ masam-masam geh in-e nguyat Yesus. Yesus obuah toban keꞌ Pengadilan Agama

translation.en: people.”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ mit limoh kueh baya duwoh polong ikian, Iyoh moꞌ pakat keꞌ longit. Iyoh moꞌ bisukul. Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ piliaꞌ-piliaꞌ kueh-e. Yoh moꞌ ngin deꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, saꞌ-e kutung tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.

translation.en: When John baptized people, did his authority come from God or was it only from other people?”
translation.bj: Osi deꞌ ngin hak tuduꞌ Yohanes Pembaptis nyaꞌa? Topaꞌ keh soꞌ odop Yohanes?”

translation.en: Then Jesus took the five loaves of bread and two fish. He looked up into the sky and thanked God for the food. Then he broke it into pieces, which he gave to the followers to give to the people.
translation.bj: Niꞌ onu takal inoh Yesus bidoa sadiꞌ-E. Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e ogiꞌ geh danoꞌ. Yomoꞌ Yesus sikien tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-E, “Osi in nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ nang Okuꞌ itih.”

translation.en: It will be very bad for anyone who makes one of these little children sin. It would be better for them to have a millstone tied around their neck and be drowned in the sea.
translation.bj: Lobih paguh lagiꞌ nyeꞌ gutan batuh deꞌ ayuh deꞌ tunguaꞌ-a, mokuaꞌ inoh timalong daang laut soꞌ yoh yaꞌ toban niꞌ naꞌan negeh nyaꞌa deꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ pikil-e tuꞌuh daang Topaꞌ nai dosa-e.

translation.en: Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” The man answered, “Legion.” (He said his name was “Legion” because many demons had gone into him.)
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ munua deꞌ munoꞌ luah soꞌ nyaꞌa noh yomoꞌ molot kaang oyuaꞌ-oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ. Yomoꞌ oyuaꞌ-oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ bikoduh buu keꞌ bingon gilongung yomoꞌ bitabum kaang donu. Susuaꞌ oyua-e kobos longod.

translation.en: It will come as a surprise to everyone on earth.
translation.bj: Sobab onu inoh nog saꞌan suaꞌ nyaꞌa samah kodaꞌ binatang tang-tang obuah jolat.

translation.en: It will be bad for you, because you are like hidden graves. People walk on them without knowing it.”
translation.bj: Binasaleh ingan! Ingan kodaꞌ kubul deꞌ doiꞌ tanda-e, deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa bokon ngunyak pak-e nyaꞌa inoh diꞌ-e puꞌan-e.”

translation.en: So Jesus said to them, “Then I will not tell you who gave me the authority to do these things.”
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ Yesus nyawot sina odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ tuong doliaꞌ Kuꞌ geh tanon soꞌ ki Okuꞌ soꞌon hak duoh daang adon osi, ngan Kuꞌ nai suaꞌ onik deꞌ munoꞌ.” Perumpamaan nyaꞌa deꞌ sewa kobon

translation.en: During Elizabeth’s sixth month of pregnancy, God sent the angel Gabriel to a virgin girl who lived in Nazareth, a town in Galilee. She was engaged to marry a man named Joseph from the family of David. Her name was Mary.
translation.bj: Gabriel odi tuduꞌ dayung bujang tiboon, deꞌ adon-e Maria. Maria inoh moꞌ bitunang duoh dali deꞌ adon-e Yusuf onak-sukun laja Daud.

translation.en: Some of the people will be killed by soldiers. Others will be made prisoners and taken to all the different countries. The holy city of Jerusalem will be under the control of foreigners until their time is completed.
translation.bj: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ bangsa Israel yaꞌ obuah ngabos pakai podang, duoh bogoꞌ geh deꞌ yaꞌ obuah takap duoh obuah toban keꞌ negli-negli bangsa deꞌ bokon, duoh bangsa-bangsa inoh yaꞌ militah kota Yerusalem nog onu deꞌ moh moꞌ notap Topaꞌ saꞌan bangsa-bangsa inoh.” Onak Manusia nog

translation.en: Jesus said to him, “What is written in the law? What do you understand from it?”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Bonal oni deꞌ nang ingan noh neh, naileh watinoh geh saꞌ ingan idip.”

translation.en: silver coins. The other man owed him
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ ngiduang dayung noh yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Simon, “Muꞌu ningaꞌ dayung itih? Okuꞌ nog keꞌ bolimuꞌ, doiꞌ muꞌu ngin piꞌin kaꞌan mamiaꞌ poꞌonkuꞌ, pak-e dayung tih mamiaꞌ poꞌonKuꞌ kai piꞌin boton-e, yoh moꞌ ngisuꞌ pakai buak-e.

translation.en: will get much more than they left. They will get many times more in this life. And in the world that is coming they will get the reward of eternal life.”
translation.bj: nyaꞌa deꞌ togan suaꞌ-e inoh yaꞌ tilimaꞌ lobih bogoꞌ lagiꞌ daang joman deꞌ adin, duoh deꞌ joman deꞌ yaꞌ nog baꞌuh yoh yaꞌ tilimaꞌ idip deꞌ sitelus-e.” Ke taluh sidoh-e Yesus sina nang Odop-e yaꞌ susah jolaꞌ

translation.en: There were some people who thought they were very good and looked down on everyone else. Jesus used this story to teach them:
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ nang idip odop-e bonal deꞌ jowin Topaꞌ duoh lobih paguh soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon:

translation.en: If you lend things to people, always expecting to get something back, should you get any special praise for that? No, even sinners lend to other sinners so that they can get back the same amount!
translation.bj: Nyam ingan ngin nyam duit jok-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dapod gati-e, patut keh ingan obuah mudi? Nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa tuang ngin nyam duit tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa geh, yoh moꞌ paliꞌ mitiaꞌ-e!

translation.en: He has done what he promised to our ancestors,to Abraham and his children forever.”
translation.bj: Iyoh tulung Israel kuli-E sobab Iyoh natong janyi-e tuduꞌ sumuk babai toꞌ. Topaꞌ natong janyi-e, Iyoh masiꞌ tuduꞌ Abraham baya otoꞌ onak sukun-e nog sitelus-e.”
Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus sina in-e lagiꞌ tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Nyam basa niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ ingan odi keꞌ boli dingan ingan tuluap ngalom duoh sina, ‘Dapod yeh muꞌu ngin dioꞌ taluh kuehmuꞌ neh?

translation.en: Those servants might have to wait until midnight or later for their master. But they will be glad they did when he comes in and finds them still waiting.
translation.bj: Kuli-kuli deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ lobih obuah bilokat lagiꞌ nyam basa toke-e paliꞌ tuluap ngalom atou suam pagi dapod odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ siap sidia.

translation.en: One time Jesus was praying alone. His followers came together there, and he asked them, “Who do the people say I am?”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sikien lagiꞌ tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-E, “Osi Okuꞌ tih?” Petrus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Inganleh Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ.”

Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mujuag yomoꞌ kasig duoh toban Yesus kai paksa keꞌ sopaꞌ kota, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ toban Yesus keꞌ bingon gilongung dolod sobab kota odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ bung dolod, ngan-e yaꞌ tulak Yesus kaang gilongung.

translation.en: So I tell you, continue to ask, and God will give to you. Continue to search, and you will find. Continue to knock, and the door will open for you.
translation.bj: Jadi Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Mitiaꞌleh, saꞌ ingan obuah ngin, kalikleh, saꞌ ingan soꞌon, netekleh, saꞌ tiban obuah bukaꞌ kaꞌan ingan.

translation.en: They called to their friends in the other boat to come and help them. The friends came, and both boats were filled so full of fish that they were almost sinking.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Simon moꞌ mogan dingan-dingan-e deꞌ pakai olud deꞌ bokon. Dingan-dingan-e moꞌ nog yomoꞌ ngisiꞌ soꞌ duwoh olud-e nog punuaꞌ duoh odaꞌ olud-e yaꞌ kuom.
Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Natong nyeꞌ deꞌ dunia itih doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ lobih ayuh soꞌ Yohanes Pembaptis. Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ paling isit soꞌ umat Topaꞌ, lobih ayuh soꞌ Yohanes Pembaptis.”

translation.en: “The door to heaven is narrow. Try hard to enter it. Many people will want to enter there, but they will not be able to go in.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli yaꞌ nang in-e, ‘Idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ pilih ingan neh! Buuleh soꞌ katiꞌ ingan deꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat!’

translation.en: Then Jesus said to them, “Suppose one of you went to your friend’s house very late at night and said to him, ‘A friend of mine has come into town to visit me. But I have nothing for him to eat. Please give me three loaves of bread.’
translation.bj: Sobab dingankuꞌ deꞌ daang pimonu-e, baꞌuh sijaꞌ nosaꞌ deꞌ boli. Duoh okuꞌ doiꞌ pinguman kaꞌan iyoh!’

translation.en: “But what will happen if that servant is evil and thinks his master will not come back soon? He will begin to beat the other servants, men and women. He will eat and drink until he has had too much.
translation.bj: Pak-e nyam basa kuli inoh jaꞌat yomoꞌ sina daang otin-e, ‘Tokekuꞌ diꞌ-e nog-nog’, iyoh moꞌ mosut kuli-kuli deꞌ bokon duoh man nuak nog-e mabuk,

translation.en: He agreed. Then he waited for the best time to hand him over to them. He wanted to do it when no one was around to see it.
translation.bj: Yudas moꞌ situju duoh kalik oni wat-e baya onu deꞌ pas kaꞌan-e ngin Yesus tuduꞌ musoh-e takal nyaꞌa bogoꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan-e. Pinguman Paskah

translation.en: followers came back from their trip, they were very happy. They said, “Lord, even the demons obeyed us when we used your name!”
translation.bj: Ngojit nyeꞌ! Sibonal-e Okuꞌ moꞌ ngin kuasa tuduꞌ ingan saꞌ ingan monang soꞌ kuasa Muot duoh munua. Musoh itih kodaꞌ dipoh duoh liangotis deꞌ bibisa, pak-e oni sijaꞌ-e doiꞌ deꞌ dapod kanam ingan.

translation.en: But Jesus answered, “I tell you, if my followers didn’t say them, these stones would shout them.”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Todah manah mun ingan deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kota itih. Sukup paguh-e moꞌ nyam ingan puꞌan oniꞌ wat ingan yaꞌ bidamai duoh Topaꞌ pak-e adin ingan diꞌ ngan ponai ngiloti-e!

translation.en: So the apostles went out. They traveled through all the towns. They told the Good News and healed people everywhere.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ b Yesus moꞌ odi keꞌ kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh duoh odaꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ daki sijaꞌ-e mokuaꞌ. Herodes bigaduh kila-e

translation.en: A large crowd followed Jesus. Some of the women were sad and crying. They felt sorry for him.
translation.bj: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa ponu nunaꞌ Yesus, soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan dayung deꞌ siꞌien masiꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus.

translation.en: but today some of our women told us an amazing thing. Early this morning they went to the tomb where the body of Jesus was laid.
translation.bj: Pak-e kudu-kudu naꞌan-e soꞌ dayung uluk koꞌih ngoꞌgoh koꞌih, Pagia-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi keꞌ kubul,

translation.en: Every tree is known by the kind of fruit it produces. You won’t find figs on thorny weeds. And you can’t pick grapes from thornbushes!
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa puꞌan tongon jojak soꞌ buaꞌ-e, totaꞌ lojaꞌ diꞌ-e bibuaꞌ buaꞌ ara, bikolam diꞌ-e bibuaꞌ buaꞌ angul.

translation.en: Others are like the seed that fell on rock. That is like the people who hear God’s teaching and gladly accept it. But they don’t have deep roots. They believe for a while. But when trouble comes, they turn away from God.
translation.bj: “Doiꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tung lapu kadis yomoꞌ kuab kai bona, atou yoh gan-e deꞌ libuaꞌ katel; pak-e lapu kadis inoh iyoh gan-e deꞌ tun pak, saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ molot dapod ningaꞌ jawaꞌ-e.

translation.en: The people who come to me, who listen to my teachings and obey them—I will show you what they are like:
translation.bj: Okuꞌ yaꞌ ngin sotoh nyaꞌa deꞌ nog duꞌ Okuꞌ deꞌ ngojit pingunangKuꞌ duoh nai-e.

translation.en: Just then some Pharisees came to Jesus and said, “Go away from here and hide. Herod wants to kill you!”
translation.bj: Ulang Yerusalem, ulang Yerusalem! Nabi obuaꞌ ingan ngabos! Nyaꞌa deꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ odi tuduꞌ ingan, ingan nyokad pakai batuh nog-e kobos! Moh kudu sidoh Okuꞌ yaꞌ nguluk suaꞌ ingan kodaꞌ sinoꞌ siuak ngukuap onak-e deꞌ libuaꞌ ilad-e, pak-e ingan doliaꞌ ngan!

translation.en: Jesus heard this and said to Jairus, “Don’t be afraid! Just believe and your daughter will be well.”
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ towoh Yesus, sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ puꞌan onak dayung inoh moh moꞌ kobos.

translation.en: Many people had come out of the city to see all this. When they saw it, they felt very sorry and left.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa bogoꞌ deꞌ nog ningaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ jadi. Susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ paliꞌ daang otin deꞌ sukup masiꞌ-e.

translation.en: The army officer there saw what happened. He praised God, saying, “I know this man was a good man!”
translation.bj: Takal pimipin sidadu noh ningaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ, jadi iyoh moꞌ mudi Topaꞌ. Yoh moꞌ sina, “Bonal, nyaꞌa itih tok doiꞌ salah-e!”

translation.en: Then Jesus said, “There was a man who had two sons.
translation.bj: Takal duit-e moꞌ obuaꞌ suaꞌ-e, pas takal inoh deꞌ pulow inoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa miliap, iyoh tuang doiꞌ geh oniꞌ deꞌ man-e yomoꞌ pilai sobab iyoh moꞌ botak kolag.

translation.en: Yes, even the spirits obey you. And you can be happy, not because you have this power, but because your names are written in heaven.”
translation.bj: Suaꞌ-suaꞌ oniꞌ moꞌ ngin SamaꞌKuꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, Onak-E. Doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ piluh Onak, nyam diꞌ-e Samaꞌ-e sijaꞌ-a. Doiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ piluh Samaꞌ, nyam diꞌ-e Onak-e sijaꞌ-a, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, deꞌ Onak inoh laꞌan tanon daꞌ-e.”

translation.en: But the Pharisees and those who taught the law for the Pharisees began to complain to the followers of Jesus, “Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and other sinners?”
translation.bj: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi diꞌ-e sonang, yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus, “Oni ngan ingan suaꞌ man duoh pinagih suke duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa?”

translation.en: Then Jesus said, “Don’t tell anyone about what happened. But go and let the priest look at you. And offer a gift to God for your healing as Moses commanded. This will show people that you are healed.”
translation.bj: Yesus jaman nyaꞌa inoh kilakal tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Sus odi tuduꞌ pimipin agama Yahudi mitiaꞌ saꞌ-e ningaꞌ muꞌu moh bonal-bonal mokuaꞌ. Yomoꞌ odileh ngin kulban kodaꞌ plitah Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa bukti muꞌu moꞌ bonal mokuaꞌ soꞌ onammuꞌ.”

translation.en: Then he and his followers went to another town.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, “Jaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ!” Pak-e nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Gulu, kajon okuꞌ yaꞌ ngubul samaꞌkuꞌ dioꞌ.”

translation.en: They said, “Tell us what authority you have to do these things. Who gave you this authority?”
translation.bj: yomoꞌ sikien tuduꞌ Yesus, “Suba tanon tuduꞌ koꞌih, osi deꞌ ngin hak duoh daang adon osi muꞌu nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ?”

translation.en: But Jesus knew what they were thinking and said, “Why do you have these questions in your minds?
translation.bj: Yesus puꞌan pikil odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ. Duoh lasuꞌ sina, “Oni ngan ingan pikil deꞌ watinoh daang otin ingan?

translation.en: But the Pharisee was surprised when he saw that Jesus did not wash his hands first before the meal.
translation.bj: Ulang Farisi inoh ilan ningaꞌ Yesus diꞌ-e mamiaꞌ togan-e takal-e yaꞌ man, kodaꞌ atulan ukum Yahudi.

translation.en: Then the man was able to see. He followed Jesus, thanking God. Everyone who saw this praised God for what happened.
translation.bj: Ngan-e moꞌ ponai ningaꞌ yomoꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus simadi-e mudi Topaꞌ, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ningaꞌ hal inoh suwaꞌ geh mudi Topaꞌ.

translation.en: Zechariah asked for something to write on. Then he wrote, “His name is John.” Everyone was surprised.
translation.bj: Zakharia moꞌ mitiaꞌ batuh, iyoh moꞌ nulis deꞌ tun-e, “Adon-e Yohanes.” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ilan-e.

translation.en: Some of the teachers of the law said, “Teacher, your answer was very good.”
translation.bj: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ sikien lagiꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oni ngan nyaꞌa ponai nang Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ inoh onak-sukun laja Daud?

translation.en: The demon inside the man had often seized him, and he had been put in jail with his hands and feet in chains. But he would always break the chains. The demon inside him would force him to go out to the places where no one lived. Jesus commanded the evil spirit to come out of the man. When the man saw Jesus, he fell down before him, shouting loudly, “What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? Please, don’t punish me!”
translation.bj: Deꞌ sinok topat noh ogiꞌ bogoꞌ oyuaꞌ kalik man-e deꞌ tilipang dolod. Munua moꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus saꞌ-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ molot daang oyuaꞌ-oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ. Yesus moꞌ tanah munua deꞌ munoꞌ molot daang oyuaꞌ inoh.

translation.en: But the apostles did not believe what they said. It sounded like nonsense.
translation.bj: Pak-e rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ silita dayung deꞌ munoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pikil nang dayung deꞌ munoꞌ madas nang koyuh adoh.

translation.en: Then Jesus took a cup of wine. He gave thanks to God for it and said, “Take this cup and give it to everyone here.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ mit gelas deꞌ ogiꞌ piꞌin angul daang-e, Yoh moꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, yomoꞌ sina, “Mit duoh kutungleh itih.

translation.en: Then Jesus taught the followers that they should always pray and never lose hope. He used this story to teach them:
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mala bidoa duoh diꞌ-e buꞌon-e.

translation.en: Now all people can see your plan.
translation.bj: Pinyilamat kaꞌan suaꞌ bangsa, Ingan moꞌ sidia-e.

translation.en: Peter said, “Look, we left everything we had and followed you.”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Petrus moꞌ lasuꞌ sina, “Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ koꞌih moꞌ obuaꞌ togan koꞌih ngan koꞌih nunaꞌ Ingan.”

translation.en: “Suppose one of you has
translation.bj: “Nyam basa niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ ingan datiꞌ ogiꞌ silatus polong domba, yomoꞌ moyap niꞌ polong, totu ingan togan deꞌ pliꞌi puluꞌ pliꞌi polong domba inoh deꞌ padang duh, ngan ingan yaꞌ odi kalik deꞌ niꞌ polong deꞌ moyap inoh nog ngan dapod-e.

translation.en: measures of wheat.’ Then the manager said to him, ‘Here is your bill; you can make it less. Write
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ dapod yeꞌ alap odaꞌ ngulus kiloja deꞌ isit, yoh tuang dapod geh yeꞌ bisayaꞌ-e odaꞌ ngulus kiloja deꞌ ayuh duoh penting. Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e jujul ngulus kiloja deꞌ isit, kiloja deꞌ ayuh duoh penting idoh geh diꞌ-e yaꞌ jujul ngulus-e.

translation.en: No one who drinks old wine wants new wine. They say, ‘The old wine is just fine.’”
translation.bj: Watinoh geh doiꞌ nyaꞌa laꞌan nuak piꞌin angul deꞌ baꞌuh mokuaꞌ nuak piꞌin angul deꞌ oma, sobab piꞌin angul deꞌ oma inoh lobih masog in-e.”

translation.en: In the same way, after supper, Jesus took the cup of wine and said, “This wine represents the new agreement from God to his people. It will begin when my blood is poured out for you.”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ man kueh inoh Yesus moꞌ mit gelas deꞌ ogiꞌ piꞌin angul inoh duoh ngin tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e Yoh moꞌ sina, “Piꞌin angul daang gelas itih iyohleh janyi Topaꞌ deꞌ baꞌuh, janyi-bipokat deꞌ obuah nogap pakai doyaꞌKuꞌ deꞌ soyang kaꞌan ingan.

translation.en: Then Jesus said to his followers, “And who do you say I am?”Peter answered, “You are the Messiah from God.”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e lagiꞌ, “Okuꞌ Onak Manusia totap halus susah jolaꞌ duoh diꞌ-e obuah tilimaꞌ odaꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi, pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh, duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi. Yomoꞌ obuah ngabos, pak-e daang onu keꞌ taluh-e paliꞌ idip.”

translation.en: The king said to him, ‘That’s great! You are a good servant. I see that I can trust you with small things. So now I will let you rule over ten of my cities.’
translation.bj: ‘Paguh,’ in laja inoh, ‘Muꞌu kuli deꞌ paguh, sobab daang oniꞌ deꞌ isit jaꞌ-e muꞌu ponai nyeꞌ bisayaꞌ daꞌ-e, sobab inohleh muꞌu yaꞌ militah tun simoong kota.’

translation.en: Some Pharisees said, “Why are you doing that? It is against the Law of Moses to do that on the Sabbath day.”
translation.bj: Ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi moꞌ ngalah odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang, “Oni nai ingan diꞌ nunaꞌ ukum daang agama otoꞌ, ingan nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaman nyaꞌa nai-e daang onu Sabat!”

translation.en: “John will help many people of Israel return to the Lord their God.
translation.bj: Yoh yaꞌ toban bogoꞌ ulang Israel paliꞌ saꞌan nunaꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ militah idip-e.

translation.en: Then two men were there, talking with him. They were Moses and Elijah.
translation.bj: Takal inoh Petrus duoh dingan-dingan-e loloꞌ boꞌos. Ngan-e moꞌ ngooh yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus daang jawaꞌ sijaꞌ, yomoꞌ ningaꞌ geh nabi Musa duoh nabi Elia mujuag sinoꞌ Yesus.

translation.en: Do you think I came to give peace to the world? No, I came to divide the world!
translation.bj: Maꞌ ingan sakaꞌ nang Okuꞌ nog toban damai keꞌ bumi! Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan Okuꞌ itih nog yaꞌ toban kaꞌi kalah.

translation.en: On another Sabbath day Jesus went into the synagogue and taught the people. A man with a crippled right hand was there.
translation.bj: Daang onu Sabat deꞌ bokon lagiꞌ Yesus molot keꞌ daang boli topat simayang Yoh moꞌ ngajal danoꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos tongan touh-e.

translation.en: Jesus often went away to other places to be alone so that he could pray.
translation.bj: Pak-e kodaꞌ deꞌ biasa-e Yesus odi bidoa keꞌ topat deꞌ doiꞌ manah nyaꞌa-e. Yesus odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ gilagan mokuaꞌ

translation.en: Jesus said, “Ten men were healed; where are the other nine?
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Idoh keh diꞌ-e simoong naꞌan deꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e, ki soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pliꞌi naꞌan?

translation.en: Then he said, “The truth is, a prophet is not accepted in his own hometown.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ buꞌu soꞌ boli topat simayang, Yesus odi keꞌ boli Simon. Madih ayua Simon tanon tuduꞌ Yesus nang tua Simon deꞌ dayung modud, duoh tulung odaꞌ mokuaꞌ.

translation.en: This was the promise he made to our father Abraham,
One of the criminals hanging there began to shout insults at Jesus: “Aren’t you the Messiah? Then save yourself, and save us too!”
translation.bj: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan ulang jaꞌat deꞌ obuah salib bisamah duoh Yesus, ngine Yesus. Yoh sina in-e, “Nyam Muꞌu Laja Pinyilamat, nyilamat leh odopMuꞌ duoh koꞌih!”

translation.en: But when the man heard Jesus tell him to give away his money, he was sad. He didn’t want to do this, because he was very rich.
translation.bj: Takal pimipin Yahudi noh ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus, yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ susah otin-e sobab yoh sukup kaya-e.

translation.en: Herod didn’t find him guilty either. He sent him back to us. Look, he has done nothing bad enough for the death penalty.
translation.bj: Herodes tuong doiꞌ geh dapod salah nyaꞌa itih, sobab inoh iyoh paliꞌ Yesus tuduꞌ otoꞌ datiꞌ. Niꞌ doiꞌ geh soꞌ salah deꞌ nai Yesus deꞌ patut odaꞌ Yoh obuah ukum kobos.

translation.en: I will leave and go to my father. I will say to him: Father, I have sinned against God and have done wrong to you.
translation.bj: Onak-e inoh moꞌ sina in-e, ‘Samaꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ bidosa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ baya ingan. Okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ patut obuah sobot onak ingan.’

translation.en: They stayed at the Temple all the time, praising God.
translation.bj: duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ silalu mudi Topaꞌ deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ.

translation.en: The soldiers started a fire in the middle of the yard and sat together. Peter sat with them.
translation.bj: Diꞌ-e tui mokuaꞌ inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon lagiꞌ ningaꞌ Petrus yomoꞌ nang, “Muꞌu tuang lika bitunaꞌ-tunaꞌ geh duoh Nyaꞌa inoh!” Pak-e petrus nyawot nang, “Doiꞌ leh, idoh diꞌ-e okuꞌ neh!”

translation.en: Also, no one ever pours new wine into old wineskins. The new wine would break them. The wine would spill out, and the wineskins would be ruined.
translation.bj: Watinoh geh doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ duwan piꞌin angul baꞌuh keꞌ daang topat piꞌin soꞌ kulit deꞌ oma. Sobab piꞌin angul baꞌuh inoh tapod yaꞌ odaꞌ topat piꞌin soꞌ kulit inoh totak, jadi piꞌin angul-e soyang duoh topat piꞌin soꞌ kulit inoh lusak.

translation.en: Then the devil led Jesus to Jerusalem and put him on a high place at the edge of the Temple area. He said to him, “If you are the Son of God, jump off!
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ Yesus paliꞌ keꞌ Galilea punuaꞌ daꞌ kuasa Iyang Topaꞌ. Gah Yesus moꞌ timogah katiꞌ-kanih deꞌ suaꞌ Galilea.

translation.en: The Jewish teachers of the law and the Pharisees thought to themselves, “Who is this man who dares to say such things? What an insult to God! No one but God can forgive sins.”
translation.bj: Gulu-gulu agama Yahudi duoh ulang Farisi moꞌ sina sitipan odop-e, “Nyaꞌa itih bilani nguyat Topaꞌ, jok-e Topaꞌ sijaꞌ-e deꞌ ponai ngapun dosa!”

translation.en: Be like servants who are waiting for their master to come home from a wedding party. The master comes and knocks, and the servants immediately open the door for him.
translation.bj: Samah kodaꞌ kuli deꞌ siap sidia kajon toke paliꞌ soꞌ topat nyaꞌa biluman, saꞌ-a nyam basa iyoh nog duoh netek tiban, lasuꞌ nyeꞌ bukaꞌ tiban saꞌan-e.

translation.en: But the people continued to shout. They demanded that Jesus be killed on a cross. Their shouting got so loud that
translation.bj: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ makin dolas nang bogan-e odaꞌ Yesus obuah nyalip. Nyuang-nyuang Pilatus nunaꞌ sijaꞌ sina nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: It was almost time for the Jewish Festival of Unleavened Bread, called the Passover.
translation.bj: Takal sinok onu-e yaꞌ Paskah,

translation.en: Then Jesus went about
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ niꞌ naꞌan malaikat nog tuduꞌ Yesus duoh nguat simangat Yesus.

translation.en: You will save yourselves by continuing strong in your faith through all these things.
translation.bj: Asal ingan taan sabal ngadap suaꞌ-e inoh ingan yaꞌ soꞌon idip deꞌ sitelus-e.” Yesus sina nang Yerusalem yaꞌ patuab

translation.en: He reached out his arm and showed his power.He scattered those who are proud and think great things about themselves.
translation.bj: Iyoh bitanga kuasa pakai tongan-E, Yoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ samuh otin-e buu katiꞌ-kanih.

translation.en: Simon (Jesus named him Peter),Andrew, brother of Peter,James,John,Philip,Bartholomew,
translation.bj: Simon deꞌ Yesus mogan Petrus, Andreas madih Simon, Yakobus, Yohanes, Filipus, Bartolomeus,

translation.en: The king said to this servant, ‘You can rule over five cities.’
translation.bj: ‘Muꞌu yaꞌ militah tun limoh kota,’ in laja inoh.

translation.en: One day Jesus was teaching the people. The Pharisees and teachers of the law were sitting there too. They had come from every town in Galilee and Judea and from Jerusalem. The Lord was giving Jesus the power to heal people.
translation.bj: Takal inoh Yesus ngajal ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi guluꞌ danoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nog soꞌ Yerusalem, soꞌ kota-kota deꞌ Galilea duoh Yudea. Kuasa Topaꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ Yesus, nyaꞌa deꞌ monam ponai mokuaꞌ.

translation.en: He rode along the road toward Jerusalem. The followers spread their coats on the road before him.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ takal Yesus moꞌ ponu simadi-E maꞌad deꞌ tun keledai inoh, nyaꞌa bogoꞌ moꞌ nopas olan pakai jubah-e.

translation.en: “I tell you, if you stand before others and are willing to say you believe in me, then I will say that you belong to me. I will say this in the presence of God’s angels.
translation.bj: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngakuꞌ Okuꞌ deꞌ sulung jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon nang odop-e jadi pinunaꞌKuꞌ, Okuꞌ Onak Manusia, tuang ngakuꞌ geh iyoh jadi pinunaꞌKuꞌ deꞌ sulung jowin malaikat-malaikat Topaꞌ.

translation.en: While Joseph and Mary were in Bethlehem, the time came for her to have the baby.
translation.bj: Takal Yusuf duoh Maria deꞌ Betlehem, Maria moꞌ nog onu-e yaꞌ milaꞌ.

translation.en: But Jesus knew what they were thinking. He said to the man with the crippled hand, “Get up and stand here where everyone can see.” The man got up and stood there.
translation.bj: Pak-e Yesus puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ pikil odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tongan-e kobos niꞌ kawa noh, “Mujuag katiꞌ got.” Nyaꞌa noh moꞌ mokat mujuag odi tuduꞌ-e.

translation.en: Some of the followers were talking about the Temple. They said, “This is a beautiful Temple, built with the best stones. Look at the many good gifts that have been offered to God.”
translation.bj: Takal inoh ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa kilakal sitipan odop-e simadi-e mudi Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ nai nyaꞌa pakai sinung batuh deꞌ paguh duoh balang-balang persembahan Topaꞌ. Yomoꞌ Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop deꞌ munoꞌ,

translation.en: Herod said, “I cut off John’s head. So who is this man I hear these things about?” Herod continued trying to see Jesus.
translation.bj: Herodes moꞌ in-e, “Tiep okuꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa notok tunguaꞌ Yohanes. Jadi osi bih Yesus itih neh? Moꞌ bogoꞌ kuꞌ klingah gah-e.” Mokuaꞌ noh Herodes bonal-bonal yaꞌ bidapod duoh Yesus. Yesus ngin man limoh libu naꞌan nyaꞌa

translation.en: So he ran to a place where he knew Jesus would come. Then he climbed a sycamore tree so he could see him.
translation.bj: Yoh moꞌ bikoduh pilowan nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ yomoꞌ nyikoh tongon koyuh ngan-e yaꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus deꞌ yaꞌ ngilusuꞌ kanoꞌ.

translation.en: “Then the manager asked another one, ‘How much do you owe my master?’ He answered, ‘I owe him
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus sina lagiꞌ in-e, “Ngojit nyeꞌ! Kalikleh dingan ingan kai duit deꞌ soꞌon ingan soꞌ dunia itih, saꞌ takal duit ingan deꞌ dunia itih moꞌ diꞌ-e tiꞌaꞌ biguna, ingan tapod idip duoh Topaꞌ.

translation.en: A third time Pilate said to the people, “Why? What wrong has he done? He is not guilty. I can find no reason to kill him. So I will let him go free after I punish him a little.”
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ saꞌan ketaluh sidoh-e Pilatus sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Pak-e oni salah deꞌ nai nyaꞌa itih? Doiꞌ kuꞌ dapod oni-oni salah deꞌ yaꞌ patut nyeꞌ odaꞌ Yoh obuah ukum ngabos! Sobab inohleh okuꞌ yaꞌ mosut pijolaꞌ-E, yoh moꞌ pilopas-e.”

translation.en: But the man wanted to show that the way he was living was right. So he said to Jesus, “But who is my neighbor?”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan pimipin agama Yahudi ponu deꞌ olan inoh. Ningaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh pak-e yoh nonan-e sijaꞌ-a soꞌ pang olan.

translation.en: When the people heard this, they said, “Then who can be saved?”
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus inoh moꞌ lasuꞌ in-e, “Moꞌ nyam-e watinoh doiꞌ leh nyaꞌa deꞌ dapod silamat?”

translation.en: But the leader said, “I have obeyed all these commands since I was a boy.”
translation.bj: In nyaꞌa inoh nyawot-e, “Suaꞌ-suaꞌ plitah deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nunaꞌ kuꞌ soꞌ kuꞌ isit geh.”

translation.en: He will be handed over to the foreigners, who will laugh at him, insult him, and spit on him.
translation.bj: Sobab danih Okuꞌ Onak Manusia obuah nyelah tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan Topaꞌ, Okuꞌ yaꞌ obuah ngatiaꞌ obuah ngine duoh obuah ngujaꞌ.

translation.en: Everyone there said good things about Jesus. They were amazed to hear him speak such wonderful words. They said, “How is this possible? Isn’t he Joseph’s son?”
translation.bj: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa ilan-e, yomoꞌ sina siodop-e, “Kuasa oni deꞌ ogiꞌ daang sina Nyaꞌa itih, ngan munua nunaꞌ pingunang-e?”

translation.en: God’s people shout to him night and day, and he will always give them what is right. He will not be slow to answer them.
translation.bj: Nyam hakim noh ponai tulung jana inoh, lobih lagiꞌ Topaꞌ yaꞌ tulung nyaꞌa deꞌ pilih-E, deꞌ bidoa singonu singalom tuduꞌ-e. Iyoh diꞌ-e kajon tui saꞌan nyawot doa nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: The little boy Jesus was developing into a mature young man, full of wisdom. God was blessing him.
translation.bj: Bilang Sowaꞌ pingoma Yesus odi keꞌ Yerusalem nyamut Onu Paskah.

translation.en: The woman came behind Jesus and touched the bottom of his coat. At that moment, her bleeding stopped.
translation.bj: Dayung inoh ngoon pingunai-e moh moꞌ obuah puꞌan. Jadi yoh moꞌ nog daang-e bigegeg yomoꞌ bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus. Yoh moꞌ silita tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa oni sobab iyoh makaꞌ Yesus; duoh takal iyoh tomaꞌ Yesus pinyakit-e lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ.

translation.en: Even if they do something wrong to you seven times in one day, but they say they are sorry each time, you should forgive them.”
translation.bj: Nyam basa-e daang niꞌ onu, juꞌ sidoh madihmuꞌ nai salah-e tuduꞌ muꞌu, yomoꞌ bilang-e nai salah-e yoh mitiaꞌ apun tuduꞌ muꞌu, apunleh iyoh.”

translation.en: Then Jesus helped the followers understand these Scriptures about him.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ tulung odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e ngiloti Kitab.

translation.en: But if we say that John’s baptism was from someone else, the people will stone us to death. They all believe that John was a prophet.”
