translation.bj: Pak-e nyam basa otoꞌ nang, ‘Soꞌ odop Yohanes,’ totu suaꞌ nyaꞌa nyokad otoꞌ pakai batuh, sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bisayaꞌ nang Yohanes inoh nabi.”

translation.en: Others said, “Elijah has come to us.” And some others said, “One of the prophets from long ago has risen from death.”
translation.bj: Ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa nang nabi Elia d deꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ idip. Duoh ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon nang in-e ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ nabi-nabi deꞌ nouh-e idip lagiꞌ.

translation.en: But they wanted him to stay. They begged him, “Stay with us. It’s almost night. There’s hardly any daylight left.” So he went in to stay with them.
translation.bj: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh odaꞌ Yesus loꞌo duoh odop-e, in-e, “Loꞌo negeh duoh koꞌih sobab onu tuong moꞌ ngalom geh.” Yomoꞌ Yesus moꞌ molot nglumon duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: When the voice stopped, only Jesus was there. Peter, John, and James said nothing. And for a long time after that, they told no one about what they had seen.
translation.bj: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa soꞌ ayua deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh nang bogan-e in-e, “Gulu! Mitiaꞌ tulung ningaꞌ onakkuꞌ itih, sobab onakkuꞌ itih jok-jok-e niꞌ geh.

translation.en: Peter and the others were asleep. But they woke up and saw the glory of Jesus. They also saw the two men who were standing with him.
translation.bj: Takal Petrus sina, ogiꞌ abun nog nutu odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ. Takal obuah nutu odaꞌ abun odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tolu.

translation.en: “That servant knew what his master wanted him to do. But he did not make himself ready or try to do what his master wanted. So that servant will be punished very much!
translation.bj: Kuli deꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ odaꞌ toke-e nai, pak-e iyoh diꞌ-e nai-e, iyoh obuah posut ulih-ulih-e.

translation.en: Some people brought their small children to Jesus so that he could lay his hands on them to bless them. But when the followers saw this, they told the people not to do this.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh nogleh kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa toban onak opot tuduꞌ Yesus, saꞌ Iyoh tomaꞌ ngin bilokat tuduꞌ-e. Takal pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus kilin-e, yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ ngalah nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: So if Satan is fighting against himself, how will his kingdom survive? You say that I use the power of Satan to force out demons.
translation.bj: Watinoh geh daang kerajaan Muot, nyam munua buꞌui tuduꞌ sitipan odop-e, totap kerajaan inoh patuab, watinoh geh diꞌ-e molot akal nyam ingan napo Okuꞌ kasig munua pakai kuasa Beelzebul.

translation.en: While he was blessing them, he was separated from them and carried into heaven.
translation.bj: Daang-E aluaꞌ bilokat odop-e munoꞌ, Yoh moꞌ tipakat-tilununk keꞌ sulga yomoꞌ bipisah duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: Zacchaeus hurried and came down. He was happy to have Jesus in his house.
translation.bj: Ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus inoh Zakheus moꞌ lasuꞌ doon kila-e, yomoꞌ lasuꞌ muun soꞌ tongon koyuh inoh yomoꞌ toban Yesus keꞌ boli-e.

Gulu-gulu agama Yahudi duoh pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh puꞌan-e nang perumpamaan Yesus inoh obuah odop-e, sobab inohleh ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ takap Yesus takal inoh geh pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tolu tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.

translation.en: I have not come to ask good people to change. I have come to ask sinners to change the way they live.”
translation.bj: Watinoh geh Okuꞌ nog nak-e mogan nyaꞌa deꞌ bonal odaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ, pak-e kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa saꞌ-e paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ.” Hal puasa

translation.en: But this will give you an opportunity to tell about me.
translation.bj: Takal onu inohleh ingan tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ.

translation.en: This Scripture must happen. It was written about me, and it is happening now.”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ togan kota duoh odi keꞌ punguꞌ Zaitun kodaꞌ deꞌ biasa-e duoh pinunaꞌ-e suaꞌ geh odi.

translation.en: Matthew,Thomas,James, the son of Alphaeus,Simon, called the Zealot,
translation.bj: Matius, Tomas, Yakobus onak Alfeus, Simon panglima soꞌ Zelot,

translation.en: Students are not better than their teacher. But when they have been fully taught, they will be like their teacher.
translation.bj: Doiꞌ ogiꞌ murid deꞌ lobih ayuh soꞌ gulu-e, asal murid inoh moꞌ mokuaꞌ bilajal ke yoh ponai jadi samah kodaꞌ gulu-e.

translation.en: These women were Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary, the mother of James, and some others. They told the apostles everything that happened.
translation.bj: Dayung-dayung deꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ moh ningaꞌ-e inoh iohleh Maria Magdalena, Yohana duoh Maria sinoꞌ Yakobus, baya dayung-dayung deꞌ bokon deꞌ suaꞌ odi duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: Jesus came near the city of Jericho. There was a blind man sitting beside the road. He was begging people for money.
translation.bj: Takal Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moh yaꞌ nog keꞌ kota Yerikho, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ guluꞌ simadi-e mitiaꞌ-mitiaꞌ deꞌ pang olan.

translation.en: When Jesus heard this, he said to the leader, “But there is still one thing you need to do. Sell everything you have and give the money to those who are poor. You will have riches in heaven. Then come and follow me.”
translation.bj: Ngojit yoh nyawot in noh Yesus moꞌ in neh, “Aluaꞌ ogiꞌ duom niꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ plelu muꞌ nai: Jualeh suaꞌ haltamuꞌ mokuaꞌ noh ngin duit-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag, yomoꞌ muꞌu soꞌon halta daang sulga, mokuaꞌ inoh odileh katiꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.”

translation.en: He came into a small town, and ten men met him there. They did not come close to him, because they all had leprosy.
translation.bj: Takal-e molot deꞌ niꞌ kupuaꞌ yomoꞌ ogiꞌ simoong naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah onam kulit deꞌ sukup palah odi tuduꞌ-E. Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mujuag muaꞌ juꞌan-e

translation.en: This is how you will know him: You will find a baby wrapped in pieces of cloth and lying in a feeding box.”
translation.bj: Itihleh tanda-e, “Ingan odi kalik Kuweꞌ deꞌ obuah molut kai kain lapin, deꞌ piguling-e deꞌ topat pinguman binatang.”

translation.en: He will be a great man for the Lord. He will never drink wine or beer. Even before he is born, he will be filled with the Holy Spirit.
translation.bj: Iyoh timogah deꞌ boton Topaꞌ, iyoh idoh diꞌ-e nuak pingunuak deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa mabuk, soꞌ daang toꞌin sinoꞌ-e geh iyoh moꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ.

translation.en: and said, “I wish you knew today what would bring you peace. But it is hidden from you now.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ ngasul kota baya soꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo daang-e, yomoꞌ niꞌ kiluang batuh idoh geh diꞌ-e yaꞌ tanah-e bisusun deꞌ tun batuh deꞌ bokon, sobab ingan diꞌ ingan puꞌan siniaꞌ totok-e Topaꞌ yaꞌ nog nyilamat ingan.” Yesus kasig nyaꞌa deꞌ bijua deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ

translation.en: Then Jesus talked to the twelve apostles alone. He said to them, “Listen, we are going to Jerusalem. Everything that God told the prophets to write about the Son of Man will happen.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ mogan ke simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E yomoꞌ sina, “Adin otoꞌ yaꞌ odi keꞌ Yerusalem, suaꞌ deꞌ nutaꞌ ayua nabi daang tulis-e suaꞌ-e yaꞌ jadi tuduꞌ Okuꞌ Onak Manusia.

translation.en: “Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ but you don’t do what I say?
translation.bj: “Doiꞌ guna-e ingan mogan Okuꞌ pimipin, pak-e diꞌ ingan nai oniꞌ deꞌ tanonkuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan!

translation.en: A large crowd came together. People came to Jesus from every town, and he told them this story:
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa bogoꞌ telus nog tuduꞌ Yesus soꞌ kudu-kudu kota, takal inoh moꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa bikuluk. Yesus moꞌ silita tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pakai perumpamaan itih in-e,

translation.en: But they all shouted, “Kill him! Let Barabbas go free!”
translation.bj: pak-e susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bikuluk danoꞌ moꞌ nang bogan-e, “Ngabos nyaꞌa inoh! Pilopas Barabas kaꞌan koꞌih!”

translation.en: I will give you the wisdom to say things that none of your enemies can answer.
translation.bj: Sobab Okuꞌ moꞌ ngin bijak tuduꞌ ingan saꞌ ingan ponai nang sina deꞌ diꞌ musoh ingan ponai nyawot-e.

translation.en: And so the little boy John grew up and became stronger in spirit. Then he lived in areas away from other people until the time when he came out to tell God’s message to the people of Israel.
translation.bj: Yohanes moꞌ mokat bujang yomoꞌ pikil-e moꞌ tuꞌuh daang Topaꞌ. Iyoh loꞌo deꞌ topat deꞌ otug-otug-e, ngan-e yaꞌ kajon onu-e yaꞌ odi nai kiloja-e deꞌ uluk bangsa Israel.

translation.en: They have plenty, and they gave only what they did not need. This woman is very poor, but she gave all she had to live on.”
translation.bj: Sobab suaꞌ nyaꞌa ngin sit soꞌ halta-e deꞌ bogoꞌ, pak-e jana itih sungu-e botak kolag iyoh ngin suaꞌ-suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ-e.” Yesus tanon nang Boli Topaꞌ yaꞌ obuah pilubuh

translation.en: Your heart will be where your treasure is.
translation.bj: Sobab daki soꞌ haltamuꞌ, danoꞌ geh soꞌ otinmuꞌ!” Siap sidia kajon Yesus nog deꞌ Onu Kiamat

translation.en: “I’m telling you to love your enemies and do good to them. Lend to people without expecting to get anything back. If you do this, you will have a great reward. You will be children of the Most High God. Yes, because God is good even to the people who are full of sin and not thankful.
translation.bj: Maꞌ yaꞌ watnoh neh! Nyanyang nyeꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui deꞌ ingan neh, nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh tuduꞌ-e. Asal ingan ngin nyam maꞌ yaꞌ mitiaꞌ gati-e. Nyam ingan nai watnoh, pah ingan ayuh, ingan moꞌ jadi onak-onak Topaꞌ deꞌ paling Bigatung. Sobab Topaꞌ paguh geh otin-E tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ doliaꞌ bisukul duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat.

translation.en: So the men said to Jesus, “Teacher, we know that what you say and teach is true. It doesn’t matter who is listening—you teach the same to all people. You always teach the truth about God’s way.
translation.bj: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ puꞌan pikil jaꞌat odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yomoꞌ in-e,

translation.en: But he knew what they were thinking. So he said to them, “Every kingdom that fights against itself will be destroyed. And a family that fights against itself will break apart.
translation.bj: Pak-e Yesus puꞌan pikil odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Nyam basa-e niꞌ negala nyaꞌa deꞌ daang-e bimusuh totap negala inoh asul watinoh geh nyam basa daang niꞌ lawang boꞌon nyaꞌa deꞌ daang noh bimusuh deꞌ sitipan odop-e pasti lawang boꞌon inoh patuab.

translation.en: There was a man who was paralyzed, and some other men were carrying him on a mat. They tried to bring him and put him down before Jesus.
translation.bj: Takal inoh ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa nog toban niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ gilagan guling deꞌ tun amuak. Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suba toban nyaꞌa inoh keꞌ daang boli saꞌ tapod gan deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus.

translation.en: John himself will go ahead of the Lord and make people ready for his coming. He will be powerful like Elijah and will have the same spirit. He will make peace between fathers and their children. He will cause people who are not obeying God to change and start thinking the way they should.”
translation.bj: Iyoh yaꞌ nyidia nyaꞌa saꞌan tilimaꞌ Topaꞌ duoh Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngin kuasa tuduꞌ-e saꞌ-a ponai kiloja kodaꞌ nabi Elia, deꞌ ponai nai samaꞌ duoh onak bidamai, yomoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e taat iyoh toban paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ. Watinoh wat-e iyoh sidia umat kaꞌan Topaꞌ.”

translation.en: But Jesus knew that these men were trying to trick him. He said to them,
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ Kaisar ngin tuduꞌ Kaisar, pak-e oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.”

translation.en: The followers went to Jesus and woke him. They said, “Master! Master! We will drown!”Jesus got up. He gave a command to the wind and the waves. The wind stopped, and the lake became calm.
translation.bj: Takal Yesus muun keꞌ doyoh, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dali deꞌ soꞌ kota deꞌ ogiꞌ munua daang gonan-e nog tuduꞌ Yesus. Moꞌ tui yoh diꞌ kai pimakai-e duoh doliaꞌ loꞌo deꞌ boli, iyoh jok laꞌan loꞌo deꞌ kubul.

translation.en: After Jesus had finished speaking, a Pharisee asked Jesus to eat with him. So he went and took a place at the table.
translation.bj: Takal Yesus mokuaꞌ sina, niꞌ naꞌan ulang Farisi ngijaꞌ Yoh man keꞌ boli-e. Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus odi man keꞌ boli-e.

translation.en: Jesus said, “Today is the day for this family to be saved from sin. Yes, even this tax collector is one of God’s chosen people.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Daang onu itih muꞌu baya madih ayuamuꞌ obuah nyilamat sobab muꞌu tuong onak-sukun Abraham geh.

translation.en: If that is true, you should have put my money in the bank. Then, when I came back, my money would have earned some interest.’
translation.bj: Moꞌ nyam-e watinoh, oni ngan muꞌ diꞌ muꞌ nyikon duitkuꞌ inoh deꞌ beng? Saꞌ takal kuꞌ paliꞌ, okuꞌ tapod mit duit noh baya bunga-e geh.’

translation.en: Yes, God even knows how many hairs you have on your head. Don’t be afraid. You are worth much more than many birds.
translation.bj: Baya buak deꞌ bak ingan tuang obuah ngituang geh suaꞌ-suaꞌ-e, sobab inoh maꞌ tolu, ingan lobih biloga soꞌ manuk piit deꞌ bogoꞌ.

translation.en: When Jesus got out of the boat, a man from that town came to him. This man had demons inside him. For a long time he had worn no clothes. He did not live in a house but in the caves where the dead are buried.
translation.bj: Yesus sikien tuduꞌ nyaꞌa inoh, “Osi adonmuꞌ?” “Adon koꞌih Legion,” in nyaꞌa inoh nyawot-e, sobab moꞌ bogoꞌ manah munua molot nguasa gonan-e.

translation.en: Jesus said to him, “Don’t stop him. Whoever is not against you is for you.”
translation.bj: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kupuaꞌ Samaria tiꞌ-e doliaꞌ-e nyamut Yesus sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ puꞌan nang Yesus yaꞌ odi keꞌ Yerusalem.

translation.en: A man with a bad disease was there in front of him.
translation.bj: Tang-tang nogleh niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ monam, deꞌ poꞌon duoh tongan-e bokak.

translation.en: Jesus said to Peter and John, “Go and prepare the Passover meal for us to eat.”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus sina odaꞌ Petrus duoh Yohanes, “Odileh sidia pinguman Paskah kaꞌan otoꞌ.”

translation.en: One of Jesus’ twelve apostles was named Judas Iscariot. Satan entered him,
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ Muot moꞌ molot kaang Yudas deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa geh Iskariot. Iyoh niꞌ soꞌ ke simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ Yesus.
Mokuaꞌ Muot suba Yesus kai masam-masam wat-e, yoh moꞌ buu togan-E yoh moꞌ kajon onu-e deꞌ bitotok. Yesus paliꞌ keꞌ Galilea

translation.en: He went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
translation.bj: Jadi takal Yesus moꞌ kobos, Yusuf moꞌ bigaut-biguaꞌ odi tuduꞌ Pilatus saꞌan-e mitiaꞌ todang Yesus.

translation.en: Joseph registered with Mary because she was engaged to marry him. (She was now pregnant.)
translation.bj: Yusuf daftal odop-e baya Maria tunang-e deꞌ bitiiaꞌ.

translation.en: The Spirit led Simeon to the Temple. So he was there when Mary and Joseph brought the baby Jesus to do what the Jewish law said they must do.
translation.bj: Simeon molot keꞌ Boli Topaꞌ, sobab bimbingan soꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ. Takal inoh pingoma-E toban Yesus deꞌ aluaꞌ isoꞌ inoh, ngin tuduꞌ Topaꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah notu ukum agama Yahudi.

translation.en: But Jesus said to them, “The kings of the world rule over their people, and those who have authority over others want to be called ‘the great providers for the people.’
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Laja-laja bangsa deꞌ diꞌ-e piluh Topaꞌ siwat-simun-e tuduꞌ rakyat-e, pak-e sungu-e watnoh rakyat-e silalu sobot laja inoh pinulung-e.

translation.en: Jesus said, “Father, forgive them. They don’t know what they are doing.”The soldiers threw dice to divide Jesus’ clothes between them.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ lasuꞌ bidoa, “Samaꞌ, ngapunleh odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ! Odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ diꞌ puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e.” Sidadu-sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ ngundi ngan-e yaꞌ kutung bojuh Yesus.

translation.en: Jesus continued speaking: “I came to bring fire to the world. I wish it were already burning!
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ Yesus sina lagiꞌ, “Okuꞌ yaꞌ nog toban opui keꞌ bumi, pak-e Okuꞌ alap opui moꞌ biduduꞌ.

translation.en: Pilate wanted to let Jesus go free. So again Pilate told them that he would let him go.
translation.bj: Pilatus yaꞌ pilopas Yesus, sobab inoh iyoh sina lagiꞌ dolas-dolas-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: When Jesus saw her, he called to her, “Woman, you have been made free from your sickness!”
translation.bj: Pimipin boli topat simayang inoh moꞌ tiwas tuduꞌ oni deꞌ nai Yesus sobab Iyoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa mokuaꞌ daang Onu Sabat. Sobab inoh pimipin inoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, “Niꞌ minggu ogiꞌ nuam onu deꞌ soꞌon otoꞌ kiloja daꞌ-a. Nogleh daang onu-onu deꞌ munoꞌ nyam ingan laꞌan mokuaꞌ, maꞌ nog daang Onu Sabat!”

translation.en: Look at my hands and my feet. It’s really me. Touch me. You can see that I have a living body; a ghost does not have a body like this.”
translation.bj: Ningaꞌ tongan duoh poꞌonKuꞌ, Okuꞌ leh itih! Tomaꞌ duoh ningaꞌ nyeꞌ, munua doiꞌ tulang duoh isin-e kodaꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ ingan deꞌ Okuꞌ tih.”

translation.en: “Whoever tries to keep the life they have will lose it. But whoever gives up their life will save it.
translation.bj: Sobab osi deꞌ nyayang idip-e sonang deꞌ dunia itih, idip-e tibuang. Pak-e osi deꞌ togan idip sonang-e deꞌ dunia itih nog-e kobos ngan-e nunaꞌ Okuꞌ, iyoh dapod idip sitelus-e.

translation.en: This man is not even one of our people. Is he the only one who came back to give praise to God?”
translation.bj: Jok-e nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi tih sijaꞌ-e deꞌ paliꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.”

translation.en: But the judge did not want to help the woman. After a long time, the judge thought to himself, ‘I don’t care about God. And I don’t care about what people think.
translation.bj: Sukup tui hakim inoh doliaꞌ-e yaꞌ tulung jana inoh, pak-e mokuaꞌ noh hakim noh moꞌ bipikil, ‘Daang kuꞌ idip diꞌ kuꞌ nulut tuduꞌ Topaꞌ yomoꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa tuong idoh geh diꞌ kuꞌ piduli,

translation.en: A servant girl saw him sitting there. She could see because of the light from the fire. She looked closely at Peter’s face. Then she said, “This man was also with Jesus.”
translation.bj: Kila-e niꞌ jam mokuaꞌ inoh, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon lagi nokan sina-e, “Nyaꞌa inoh bih bonal pinunaꞌ Yesus, sobab yoh tuong nyaꞌa soꞌ Galilea geh!”

translation.en: But you must not be like that. The one with the most authority among you should act as if he is the least important. The one who leads should be like one who serves.
translation.bj: Pak-e ingan diꞌ ngan soꞌon watinoh! Soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ paling penting halus jadi kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ paling hina-e duoh pimipin halus leh kodaꞌ jadin pelayan.

translation.en: He said, “This poor widow gave only two small coins. But the truth is, she gave more than all those rich people.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Jana inoh suad duit-e lobih bogoꞌ soꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.

translation.en: He called, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me! Send Lazarus to me so that he can dip his finger in water and cool my tongue. I am suffering in this fire!’
translation.bj: Ogiꞌ limoh naꞌan madihkuꞌ danoꞌ, odaꞌleh Lazarus tanon gah tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e diꞌ suaꞌ molot tuduꞌ okuꞌ daang topat obuah nyiksa itih.’

translation.en: Pilate said to the leading priests and the people, “I find nothing wrong with this man.”
translation.bj: Pilatus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh duoh suaꞌ odop deꞌ munoꞌ, “Doiꞌ kuꞌ dapod oni salah nyaꞌa tih ngan kuꞌ ponai yaꞌ ngukum-e.”

translation.en: “The king said, ‘People who use what they have will get more. But those who do not use what they have will have everything taken away from them.
translation.bj: Laja inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Osi deꞌ dapod nyeꞌ bisayaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ isit tuduꞌ-e, iyoh dapod nyeꞌ bisayaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ bogoꞌ tuduꞌ-e, pak-e osi deꞌ diꞌ-e nyeꞌ dapod bisayaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ isit tuduꞌ-e oni deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ odop-e bial isit totap obuah mit suaꞌ-e.

translation.en: The priests, the teachers of the law, and the Jewish leaders all talked about this. They said to each other, “If we answer, ‘John’s baptism was from God,’ then he will say, ‘Then why did you not believe John?’
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ biloneng, “Nyam basa otoꞌ nang soꞌ Topaꞌ, totu Iyoh nang ‘Oni nai ingan diꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yohanes?’

translation.en: Then Jesus said to them, “I ask you, which is the right thing to do on the Sabbath day: to do good or to do evil? Is it right to save a life or to destroy one?”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ sikien tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, “Daang agama otoꞌ oni deꞌ soꞌon nyeꞌ nai-e daang onu Sabat, nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh atou nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat? Nyilamat nyaꞌa keh kanam nyaꞌa?”

translation.en: Mary continued to think about these things, trying to understand them.
translation.bj: Pak-e Maria nak daang kila-e, yoh moꞌ paliꞌ bipikil.

translation.en: Life is more important than food, and the body is more important than what you put on it.
translation.bj: Sobab idip lobih penting soꞌ pinguman duoh gonan lobih penting soꞌ pimakai.

translation.en: Many people were traveling with Jesus. He said to them,
translation.bj: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa ponu bibaya duoh Yesus, Yesus moꞌ kumiat duoh sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ,

translation.en: The men had no money, so they could not pay their debt. But the banker told the men that they did not have to pay him. Which one of those two men will love him more?”
translation.bj: Muꞌu diꞌ muꞌ duwan inyuaꞌ deꞌ bakKuꞌ, pak-e dayung tih moh duwan inyuaꞌ lona deꞌ poꞌonKuꞌ.

translation.en: Decide now not to worry about what you will say.
translation.bj: Maꞌ bigaduh duoh oni in sina deꞌ halus ingan nang takal ingan obuah ngadel.

translation.en: “But Abraham said, ‘My child, remember when you lived? You had all the good things in life. But Lazarus had nothing but problems. Now he is comforted here, and you are suffering.
translation.bj: Pak-e Abraham moꞌ nyawot in-e, ‘Kan-e moꞌ ogiꞌ buk-buk deꞌ nulis Musa duoh buk-buk deꞌ nulis nabi-nabi, tanahleh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngojit duoh nunaꞌ oni deꞌ nang daang buk-buk inoh.’

translation.en: He answered, “If you have two shirts, share with someone who does not have one. If you have food, share that too.”
translation.bj: Sobab pingunai Yohanes takal inoh nyaꞌa deꞌ kajon duoh bialap janyi Topaꞌ mulai bisikien, podo Yohanes inoh Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ deꞌ kajon manusia.

translation.en: Jesus told them this story: “Can a blind man lead another blind man? No. Both of them will fall into a ditch.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ in-e ngan-e yaꞌ ngin perumpamaan tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Dapod keh nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ kayak nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ? Doh diꞌ-e soꞌ duwoh odop-e labuꞌ keꞌ lubang neh?

translation.en: “So, the manager thought to himself, ‘What will I do? My master is taking my job away from me. I am not strong enough to dig ditches. I am too proud to beg.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus duit inoh moꞌ bipikil, ‘Oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai kuꞌ toke yaꞌ piloꞌo okuꞌ, yaꞌ nyakul kuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ taꞌan, yaꞌ jadi tukang mitiaꞌ-mitiaꞌ kuꞌ dasaꞌ.

translation.en: “I tell you, use the worldly things you have now to make ‘friends’ for later. Then, when those things are gone, you will be welcomed into a home that lasts forever.
translation.bj: Doiꞌ ogiꞌ kuli ponai kiloja tuduꞌ duwoh naꞌan toke. Nyam basa-e watinoh totap ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan toke deꞌ buꞌui kuli-e daꞌ-a, kuli inoh lobih nulut deꞌ toke deꞌ niꞌ soꞌ toke-e deꞌ nikan. Watinoh geh ingan, doiꞌ ogiꞌ ingan ponai kiloja kaꞌan Topaꞌ nyam basa ingan aluaꞌ kalik halta dunia.”

translation.en: This Scripture was written about him:‘Listen! I will send my messenger ahead of you.He will prepare the way for you.’ Malachi
translation.bj: Sobab Yohanes inoh deꞌ obuah sobot daang ayat Kitab, In Topaꞌ, ‘Itihleh nyaꞌa deꞌ odaꞌKuꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ Muꞌu, Saꞌ yoh bukaꞌ olan kaꞌan Muꞌu!’ In Topaꞌ.”

translation.en: Someone said to him, “Lord, how many people will be saved? Only a few?”Jesus said,
translation.bj: Duoh ingan moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Koꞌih moh man nuaꞌ bisamah duoh ingan yomoꞌ Ingan moh ngajal geh deꞌ olan-olan deꞌ kota koꞌih!’

translation.en: said, “The Lord really has risen from death! He appeared to Simon.”
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus tanon tuduꞌ duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa inoh ti-e, “Yesus tok moꞌ paliꞌ idip. Iyoh bitanga odop-e tuduꞌ Simon.”

translation.en: But the people in the kingdom hated the man. They sent a group to follow him to the other country. There they said, ‘We don’t want this man to be our king.’
translation.bj: Pak-e nyaꞌa daang negli-e noh obuaꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ iyoh, takal-e moꞌ ponu nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui daꞌ-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ pait kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa saꞌ-e tanon nang, ‘Koꞌih doliaꞌ koꞌih odaꞌ nyaꞌa itih jadin laja koꞌih.’

translation.en: Jesus said to them, “Why did you have to look for me? You should have known that I must be where my Father’s work is.”
translation.bj: Pak-e pingoma-E diꞌ-e ngiloti oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus.

translation.en: Ask God to bless the people who ask for bad things to happen to you. Pray for the people who are mean to you.
translation.bj: Mitiaꞌ Topaꞌ bilokat nyaꞌa deꞌ lika nyupah ingan, bidoa kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat tuduꞌ ingan.

translation.en: and he went and talked with the leading priests and some of the soldiers who guarded the Temple. He talked to them about a way to hand Jesus over to them.
translation.bj: Yoh odi bidapod duoh pimipin-pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh duoh pimipin-pimipin nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang jaga Boli Topaꞌ ngan-e tanon watki wat gaya-e yaꞌ ngin Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: “If you come to me but will not leave your family, you cannot be my follower. You must love me more than your father, mother, wife, children, brothers, and sisters—even more than your own life!
translation.bj: “Nyam nyaꞌa nog tuduꞌ Okuꞌ lobih nyayang sinoꞌ-e, samaꞌ-e, sowon-e, onak-onak-e madih ayua-e baya asong odop-e, yoh doh diꞌ-e dapod jadi pinunaꞌKuꞌ.

translation.en: Jesus said to them, “You make yourselves look good in front of people. But God knows what is really in your hearts. What people think is important is worth nothing to God.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ ngajal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kai perumpamaan itih, “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan sidagal ali-ali pakai pimakai deꞌ maal duoh man pinguman paguh bilang konu.

translation.en: “What shall I say about the people of this time? What can I compare them to? What are they like?
translation.bj: Ingan deꞌ diꞌ-e tilimaꞌ Okuꞌ duoh Yohanes Pembaptis samah kodaꞌ onak opot deꞌ pasal inoh. Takal Yohanes Pembaptis nog, iyoh puasa diꞌ-e nuak angul, ingan nang, ‘Munua molot daang gonan-e!’

translation.en: The master said to the servant, ‘Go out to the highways and country roads. Tell the people there to come. I want my house to be full!
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ tuan noh sina lagiꞌ, ‘Odileh keꞌ olan-olan laya duoh lolong-lolong deꞌ sopaꞌ kota duoh odaꞌleh nyaꞌa nog saꞌ-e kanuaꞌ bolikuꞌ.

translation.en: “No one lights a lamp and then covers it with a bowl or hides it under a bed. Instead, they put the lamp on a lampstand so that the people who come in will have enough light to see.
translation.bj: Sinoꞌ Yesus duoh madih-madih-E yaꞌ odi tuduꞌ-E, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ponai bitapod duoh-E sobab nyaꞌa sikia bogoꞌ.

translation.en: Jesus got into the boat that belonged to Simon. He asked Simon to push off a little from the shore. Then he sat down in the boat and taught the people on the shore.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ maꞌad keꞌ olud deꞌ kakuꞌ Simon. Yesus moꞌ odaꞌ Simon bikayuh olud-e keꞌ topat deꞌ botang juaꞌ sit soꞌ bingon donu yoh moꞌ guluꞌ ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ soꞌ daang olud.

translation.en: Then an angel from heaven came to help him.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Oni ngan ingan boꞌos? Mokatleh duoh bidoa saꞌ ingan diꞌ ngan obuah pingisuba.” Yesus obuah takap

translation.en: Joining them at the supper table, Jesus took some bread and gave thanks. Then he broke some off and gave it to them.
translation.bj: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ guluꞌ man, Yesus moꞌ mit kueh deꞌ ayuh kiping-e yomoꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, mokuaꞌ inoh Yoh piliaꞌ-piliaꞌ kueh inoh kaꞌan-e ngin tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: Jesus said to them, “Go tell that fox, ‘Today and tomorrow I am forcing demons out of people and finishing my work of healing. Then, the next day, the work will be finished.’
translation.bj: Sobab inoh ngan Topaꞌ diꞌ-e tiaꞌ lagiꞌ loꞌo bisamah duoh ingan. Soꞌ adin ingan diꞌ-e tiaꞌ yaꞌ ningaꞌ Okuꞌ lagiꞌ nog ingan sina, ‘Obuah bilokatleh nyaꞌa deꞌ nog daang adon Topaꞌ!’”

translation.en: Now where are my enemies? Where are the people who did not want me to be king? Bring my enemies here and kill them. I will watch them die.’”
translation.bj: Pak-e adin tobanleh katiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ okuꞌ, deꞌ doliaꞌ-e odaꞌ okuꞌ jadin laja saꞌan odop-e. Mokuaꞌ inoh ngabos leh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ sulung jowinkuꞌ!’ ” Deꞌ Yerusalem Yesus obuah nyamut kodaꞌ Laja
Muot moꞌ in-e, “Suaꞌ kuasa kerajaan duoh halta inoh okuꞌ yaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Muꞌu, sobab suaꞌ-e itih moꞌ obuah ngin tuduꞌ okuꞌ, yomoꞌ okuꞌ soꞌon ngin suat simun-e tuduꞌ osi sijaꞌ-a deꞌ kuꞌ suka.

translation.en: Now, listen! You will not be able to talk until the day when these things happen. You will lose your speech because you did not believe what I told you. But everything I said will really happen.”
translation.bj: Oniꞌ deꞌ nang kuꞌ itih totap jadi takal onu-e, pak-e sobab muꞌu diꞌ muꞌ bisayaꞌ, muꞌu bebeꞌ nog suaꞌ-suaꞌ sinakuꞌ itih tok-tok jadi.”

Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ konyat ngakal jana-jana yomoꞌ mit halta-e. Ngan-e nutu pingunai-e inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bidoa omu-omu-e, pak-e inoh pibulaꞌ jaꞌ-e. Sobab inohleh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ totap yaꞌ obuah ngukum lobih baat lagiꞌ!”

translation.en: The man immediately stood up in front of everyone. He picked up his mat and walked home, praising God.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa inoh lasuꞌ ganguk mun-e mokat deꞌ jowin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yoh moꞌ tunuk amuak-e, duoh paliꞌ simadi mudi Topaꞌ.

translation.en: Then Jesus noticed that some of the guests were choosing the best places to sit. So he told this story:
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ ningaꞌ tamu-tamu deꞌ pilih topat-topat deꞌ paguh sobab inohleh Yoh ngin ajal itih tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ,

translation.en: “On that day if a man is on his roof, he will not have time to go inside and get his things. If a man is in the field, he cannot go back home.
translation.bj: Takal onu inoh nyaꞌa deꞌ awah, maꞌ molot lagiꞌ yaꞌ mit balang daang boli. Watinoh geh nyaꞌa deꞌ motak keꞌ umoh, maꞌ moliꞌ keꞌ kupuaꞌ.

translation.en: Some Sadducees came to Jesus. (Sadducees believe that people will not rise from death.) They asked him,
translation.bj: Ogiꞌ juꞌ naꞌan sikiaꞌ sudiꞌ. Deꞌ pinuan kawin, pak-e aluaꞌ doiꞌ onak-e iyoh moꞌ kobos.

translation.en: People went out to see what had happened. They came to Jesus and found the man sitting there at the feet of Jesus. The man had clothes on and was in his right mind again; the demons were gone. This made the people afraid.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ munua inoh mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus saꞌ yoh suwaꞌ duoh-E. Pak-e Yesus odaꞌ yoh paliꞌ in-e,

translation.en: They got up and forced Jesus to go out of town. Their town was built on a hill. They took Jesus to the edge of the hill to throw him off.
translation.bj: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ halus odi tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh deꞌ kota-kota deꞌ bokon, tanon oni wat-e Topaꞌ yaꞌ militah jadin Laja, sobab inohleh Okuꞌ keꞌ dunia.”

translation.en: (At the top of the cross these words were written: “this is the king of the jews.”)
translation.bj: Deꞌ bung bak Yesus, ogiꞌ tulis deꞌ in-e: “Itihleh Laja ulang Yahudi.”

translation.en: Your friend inside the house answers, ‘Go away! Don’t bother me! The door is already locked. My children and I are in bed. I cannot get up and give you the bread now.’
translation.bj: Nyam basa dingan deꞌ muꞌu odi keꞌ boli-e inoh ti-e nyawot in-e soꞌ daang boli-e, ‘Maꞌ nyusah okuꞌ! Tiban moꞌ ngobot duoh okuꞌ baya onak-onakkuꞌ moꞌ boꞌos. Okuꞌ diꞌ dapod mokat duoh ngin oni-oni tuduꞌ muꞌu.’”

translation.en: The woman was the last to die.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot sina odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ idip daang dunia suaꞌ-e kawin.

translation.en: So think carefully about what you are hearing. The people who have some understanding will receive more. But those who do not have understanding will lose even what they think they have.”
translation.bj: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ duoh nai-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ leh sinoꞌ duoh madih ayuaKuꞌ.” Sobak libut loꞌo

translation.en: Jonah was a sign for those who lived in Nineveh. It is the same with the Son of Man. He will be a sign for the people of this time.
translation.bj: Oni deꞌ jadi tuduꞌ nabi Yunus iyohleh keajaiban kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ kota Niniwe, watinoh geh Onak Manusia yaꞌ jadi keajaiban kaꞌan ingan nyaꞌa joman itih.

translation.en: He answered, “The foxes have holes to live in. The birds have nests. But the Son of Man has no place where he can rest his head.”
translation.bj: Ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon sina in-e, “Okuꞌ yaꞌ nunaꞌ Ingan, pak-e okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ dioꞌ tanon tuduꞌ madih ayuakuꞌ nang okuꞌ yaꞌ nunaꞌ Ingan.”

translation.en: But Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, I am ready to go to jail with you. I will even die with you!”
translation.bj: Petrus nyawot-e, “Gulu okuꞌ sangup molot jel duoh kobos duoh Ingan!”

translation.en: th year of the rule of Tiberius Caesar. These men were under Caesar:Pontius Pilate, the governor of Judea;Herod, the ruler of Galilee;Philip, Herod’s brother, the ruler of Iturea and Trachonitis;Lysanias, the ruler of Abilene.
translation.bj: Takal sowaꞌ inoh geh Hanas duoh Kayafas jadi pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ paling ayuh-e, duoh Topaꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yohanes, onak Zakharia. Takal inoh Yohanes ogiꞌ deꞌ padang pasil deꞌ sukup ayuh-e.

translation.en: But all the guests said they could not come. Each one made an excuse. The first one said, ‘I have just bought a field, so I must go look at it. Please excuse me.’
translation.bj: Pak-e masim-masim odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ masam idaꞌ in alasan-e, yoh ngan-e diꞌ-e dapod odi, nyaꞌa deꞌ keꞌ niꞌ-e nang, ‘Okuꞌ ogiꞌ milih tanaꞌ yomoꞌ okuꞌ halus odi ningaꞌ-e, maꞌap yoh.’

translation.en: People will say to you, ‘Look, there it is!’ or ‘Look, here it is!’ Stay where you are; don’t go away and search.
translation.bj: Tiaꞌ sodiꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa tanon tuduꞌ muꞌu, ‘Ningaꞌ danih soꞌo neh, ningaꞌ datiꞌ soꞌo neh!’ Pak-e maꞌ ingan yaꞌ luah kalik-e.

translation.en: When it was time for Elizabeth to give birth, she had a boy.
translation.bj: Takal-e moꞌ nog onu Elisabet yaꞌ milaꞌ. Iyoh moꞌ milaꞌ onak dali.

translation.en: Then he began to explain everything that had been written about himself in the Scriptures. He started with the books of Moses and then he talked about what the prophets had said about him.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh oni deꞌ obuah nulis daang susuaꞌ Kitab tentang odop-E, soꞌ takal buk-buk Musa duoh buk nabi-nabi.

translation.en: Then Jesus said to the apostles, “Remember when I sent you out without money, a bag, or sandals? Did you need anything?”The apostles said, “No.”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Nouh-e takal Okuꞌ odaꞌ ingan odi dusah toban lopet beg duoh kasut podo ingan ogiꞌ kulang oni-oni-e?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot, “Doiꞌ.”

translation.en: “A farmer went out to sow seed. While he was scattering the seed, some of it fell beside the road. People walked on the seed, and the birds ate it all.
translation.bj: “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa bilumoh, yoh dabul biniaꞌ deꞌ umoh-e. Takal-e nabul, ogiꞌ biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ keꞌ olan. Biniaꞌ-e inoh obuah ngunyak odaꞌ nyaꞌa duoh obuah man odaꞌ manuk nog obuaꞌ-e.

translation.en: He said, “Go into the town you can see there. When you enter the town, you will find a young donkey tied there that no one has ever ridden. Untie it, and bring it here to me.
translation.bj: in-E, “Odileh keꞌ kupuaꞌ inoh. Takal ingan moꞌ nog deꞌ kupuaꞌ noh, ingan yaꞌ dapod niꞌ polong keledai deꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ onu-e nyaꞌa muat daꞌ-e deꞌ obuah mokos sinok boli nyaꞌa. Pilopasleh bokos-e inoh soꞌ tiang tobanleh katiꞌ.

translation.en: But Jesus said to him, “Who said I should be your judge or decide how to divide your father’s things between you two?”
translation.bj: Pak-e in Yesus nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ idoh diꞌ-e hakim atou nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang kutung halta saꞌan muꞌu!”

translation.en: Jesus said to him, “Why do you call me good? Only God is good.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in neh, “Oni ngan muꞌ nang Okuꞌ deꞌ paguh? Doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ lobih paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ neh.

translation.en: I fast twice a week, and I give a tenth of everything I get!’
translation.bj: Okuꞌ puasa duwoh sidoh daang niꞌ minggu, simoong-bigien soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ soꞌon kuꞌ, kuꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Ingan.’

translation.en: “What do you want me to do for you?”He said, “Lord, I want to see again.”
translation.bj: “Oni deꞌ laꞌan muꞌu odaꞌ Okuꞌ nai?” Nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Gulu odaꞌleh okuꞌ ponai ningaꞌ.”

translation.en: Then Jesus said to them, “Nations will fight against other nations. Kingdoms will fight against other kingdoms.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ nyamung sina-e in-e, “Yaꞌ ogiꞌ polang, suku deꞌ niꞌ lawan suku deꞌ bokon duoh negala deꞌ niꞌ lawan negala deꞌ bokon,

translation.en: The only source of light for the body is the eye. When you look at people and want to help them, you are full of light. But when you look at people in a selfish way, you are full of darkness.
translation.bj: Boton iyohleh lapu kadis kaꞌan gonan. Nyam botonmuꞌ paguh, suaꞌ gonanmuꞌ telang-binelang. Pak-e nyam botonmuꞌ jaꞌat, suaꞌ gonanmuꞌ jadi mopung-pipiat.

translation.en: steps away from them. He knelt down and prayed,
translation.bj: Yesus sukup nyam jolaꞌ daang otin-e inoh ngan yoh bidoa bonal-bonal nog das-e kodaꞌ doyaꞌ natiag deꞌ tanaꞌ.

translation.en: And here’s something else: Your relative Elizabeth is pregnant. She is very old, but she is going to have a son. Everyone thought she could not have a baby, but she has been pregnant now for six months.
translation.bj: Puꞌan muꞌ kedoh, Elisabet, madihmuꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nyoma, deꞌ diꞌ-e ponai bitiiaꞌ nouh-e sobab yoh manang, adin moꞌ bitiiaꞌ nuam bulan.

translation.en: Great blessings belong to you who are hungry now.You will be filled.Great blessings belong to you who are crying now.You will be happy and laughing.
translation.bj: Sonangleh ingan deꞌ pilai adin sobab tiaꞌ ijoꞌ inganleh deꞌ busuah! Sonangleh ingan deꞌ siꞌian adin sobab tiaꞌ ijoꞌ inganleh deꞌ towoh!

translation.en: (There were about
translation.bj: Sobab danoꞌ ogiꞌ kila-kila-e limoh libu naꞌan dali. Yomoꞌ Yesus moꞌ sina in-e duoh pinunaꞌ-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ guluꞌ bikuluk, kila-kila limoh puluꞌ naꞌan daang niꞌ uluk.”

translation.en: But this woman is bothering me. If I give her what she wants, then she will leave me alone. But if I don’t give her what she wants, she will bother me until I am sick.’”
translation.bj: pak-e ngan jana noh kaꞌ-kaꞌ odi bikidok okuꞌ, paguh kuꞌ tulung-e negeh, saꞌ diꞌ-e tiaꞌ nog nusah okuꞌ.’”

translation.en: Some of the Pharisees said to Jesus, “Teacher, tell your followers not to say these things.”
translation.bj: Takal Yesus moꞌ yaꞌ nog keꞌ kota Yerusalem, Iyoh ningaꞌ kota inoh, Iyoh moꞌ siꞌien ningaꞌ-e.

translation.en: While Jesus and his followers were traveling, he went into a town, and a woman named Martha let him stay at her house.
translation.bj: Pak-e takal inoh Marta sikia bogoꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ boli-e. Iyoh moꞌ odi tuduꞌ Yesus yomoꞌ sina in-e, “Gulu, idoh keh diꞌ Ingan masiꞌ ningaꞌ okuꞌ itih, nai oniꞌ sadiꞌ-sadiꞌkuꞌ? Suba odaꞌ Maria tulung okuꞌ.”

translation.en: Then Jesus said to the two men, “You are foolish and slow to realize what is true. You should believe everything the prophets said.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Tok budua ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ neh! Sikia lamat ingan yaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon nabi-nabi!

translation.en: When the Lord saw the woman, he felt very sorry for her and said, “Don’t cry.”
translation.bj: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ sinoꞌ nyaꞌa noh, Yoh moꞌ masiꞌ tuduꞌ-e Yoh moꞌ nang, “Maꞌ siꞌian!”

translation.en: They were all traveling along the road. Someone said to Jesus, “I will follow you anywhere you go.”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Tanah saꞌ nyaꞌah deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ ngubul nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos. Pak-e muꞌu, ponu odi kaki sijaꞌ-e tanon gah nang Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.”

translation.en: Jesus went with them to Nazareth and obeyed them. His mother was still thinking about all these things.
translation.bj: Yesus bitamah ayuh, bitamah bijak duoh nyonang Topaꞌ baya manusia.

translation.en: Later, it was time for the grapes to be picked. So the man sent a servant to those farmers so that they would give him his share of the grapes. But they beat the servant and sent him away with nothing.
translation.bj: Takal moꞌ nog onu-e ngutuam angul, nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh moꞌ pait kuli-e, daꞌ odi mit duman yoh soꞌ ayua deꞌ soꞌ-e sewa kobon-e. Pak-e ayua deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ makung pijolaꞌ kuli inoh yomoꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ boloh-boloh-e.

translation.en: (When the people heard this, they all agreed that God’s teaching was good. Even the tax collectors agreed. These were the people who were baptized by John.
translation.bj: Yesus sina lagiꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ baning nyaꞌa joman itih kodaꞌ oni?

translation.en: The priests were very happy about this. They promised to give Judas money for doing this.
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ lasuꞌ sonang manah kila-e yomoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bijanyi yaꞌ ngin duit tuduꞌ Yudas.

translation.en: They covered his eyes so that he could not see them. Then they hit him and said, “Be a prophet and tell us who hit you!”
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Tanon tuduꞌ koꞌih, podo muꞌu tih Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Daang kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan tuang idoh geh ingan bisayaꞌ-e.

translation.en: If you don’t do that, you might begin the work, but you would not be able to finish. And if you could not finish it, everyone would laugh at you.
translation.bj: Sobab nyam basa yoh diꞌ-e dapod pijadi-e paduhal pondasi-e moh obuah nai suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ningaꞌ pingunai noh pasti towoh.

translation.en: Mary got up and went quickly to a town in the hill country of Judea.
translation.bj: Kudu-kudu onu mokuaꞌ inoh, Maria moꞌ bigaut-biguaꞌ odi keꞌ kota deꞌ sinok dolod-dolod deꞌ propinsi Yudea.

translation.en: People will come from the east, west, north, and south. They will sit down at the table in God’s kingdom.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Odi tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat duoh diꞌ-e biguna inoh, ‘Duom kudu-kudu onu sijaꞌ-a Kuꞌ dapod nai kilojaKuꞌ kasig munua duoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e, pak-e yaꞌ nog onu-e okuꞌ yaꞌ mokuaꞌ nai kilojaKuꞌ’ inoh.

translation.en: “With the loving mercy of our God, a new day from heaven will shine on us.
translation.bj: Topaꞌ otoꞌ paguh otin-e baya pinyayang; Iyoh nog nyilamat otoꞌ kodaꞌ boton onu deꞌ mokat deꞌ siliꞌ jawaꞌ,

translation.en: When the baby was eight days old, they came to circumcise him. They wanted to name him Zechariah because this was his father’s name.
translation.bj: Takal onak kueꞌ inoh moih onu umul-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nog yaꞌ bisunat-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ biladon-e Zakharia kodaꞌ adon samaꞌ-a,

translation.en: But the news about Jesus spread more and more. Many people came to hear him and to be healed of their sicknesses.
translation.bj: Pak-e nyaꞌa moꞌ klingah gah Yesus katiꞌ-kanih, sobab inohleh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ nog ngojit duoh mitiaꞌ saꞌ-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e.

translation.en: but they did not find him. So they went back to Jerusalem to look for him there.
translation.bj: Moꞌ taluh onu pingoma-e kalik Yesus, pingoma-E moꞌ dapod-E deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ. Yesus guluꞌ, ngojit simadi-e sikien tuduꞌ gulu agama Yahudi.

translation.en: Then Jesus said to the Pharisees, “The Son of Man is Lord over the Sabbath day.”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sina lagiꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ Onak Manusia deꞌ bikuasa kaꞌan notu oni deꞌ soꞌon duoh deꞌ diꞌ soꞌon nyaꞌa nai daang onu Sabat.” Yesus odaꞌ nyaꞌa mokuaꞌ takal Onu Sabat

translation.en: Everyone saw this. They began to complain, “Look at the kind of man Jesus is staying with. Zacchaeus is a sinner!”
translation.bj: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ningaꞌ hal inoh lasuꞌ bigonom, “Bah Nyaꞌa itih oni nai-e odi ngilumon keꞌ boli nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa inoh neh.”

translation.en: They saw that the heavy stone that covered the entrance had been rolled away.
translation.bj: Takal-e nog keꞌ kubul inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ batuh deꞌ pakai-e kuab kubul inoh moꞌ tiligian soꞌ lubang kubul.

translation.en: Then Jesus said to the people, “When you see clouds growing bigger in the west, you say, ‘A rainstorm is coming.’ And soon it begins to rain.
translation.bj: Yesus sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, “Nyam ingan kilin longit mopung, lasuꞌ ingan nang, ‘Onu itih yaꞌ ijan’. Yomoꞌ tok-tok-e ijan.

translation.en: The women left the tomb and went to the eleven apostles and the other followers. They told them everything that happened at the tomb.
translation.bj: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ soꞌ kubul inoh, dayung-dayung deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ lasuꞌ tanon suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ ke simoong niꞌ naꞌan rasul duoh pinunaꞌ deꞌ bokon.

translation.en: The Scriptures say,‘God will command his angelsto take care of you.’ Psalm
translation.bj: Yesus ngajal deꞌ boli-boli topat simayang, yomoꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa mudi-E. Yesus diꞌ-e obuah tilimaꞌ deꞌ Nazaret

translation.en: Jesus and his followers sailed on across the lake. They sailed to the area where the Gerasene people live, across from Galilee.
translation.bj: Yoh sina in noh sobab Yesus odaꞌ munua inoh luah soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munua molot daang gonan-e. Moꞌ silalu manah munua nguasa gonan-e, duoh takal tongan poꞌon-e obuah ngilate duoh nyaꞌa jaga yoh bonal-bonal, pak-e yoh dapod motod late soꞌ tongan poꞌon-e; yomoꞌ munua toban buꞌu keꞌ topat deꞌ otug-otug-e.

translation.en: Change your hearts! And show by your lives that you have changed. I know what you are about to say—‘but Abraham is our father!’ That means nothing. I tell you that God can make children for Abraham from these rocks!
translation.bj: Pinagih-pinagih suke tuang nog tuduꞌ Yohanes saꞌ-a baptis odop-e, yomoꞌ sikien tuduꞌ-e, “Gulu, koꞌih halus nai oni?”

translation.en: But Jesus looked into their eyes and said, “Then what does this verse mean:‘The stone that the builders refused to acceptbecame the cornerstone’? Psalm
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ ningaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ simadi-e sikien, “Oni mei loti ayat daang Kitab deꞌ in neh: ‘Batuh deꞌ nang tukang-tukang boli moꞌ doiꞌ guna-e iyohleh batuh deꞌ jadin batuh deꞌ sukup biguna-e kaꞌan kajuag boli.’”

translation.en: While Jesus was speaking, a crowd came up. It was led by Judas, one of the twelve apostles. He came over to Jesus to kiss him.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ lasuꞌ nyopaꞌ kojit toꞌuh kuli pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh noh nog-e potod.

translation.en: But Peter said this was not true. He said, “Lady, I don’t know him.”
translation.bj: Pak-e Petrus moꞌ nyawot nang, “Oni bih deꞌ nang muꞌ neh, doiꞌ kuꞌ ngiloti-e!” Daang Petrus aluaꞌ sina siuak moꞌ bitadu.

translation.en: It is also written,‘Their hands will catch youso that you will not hit your foot on a rock.’” Psalm
translation.bj: “Iyang Topaꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ Okuꞌ, sobab Yoh moꞌ pilih Okuꞌ, odaꞌ tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag. Yoh moꞌ ngutus Okuꞌ kaꞌan tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah tawan yaꞌ obuah pilopas, nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ ponai ningaꞌ duoh kaꞌan pilopas nyaꞌa soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bongis.

translation.en: Jesus said to them, “It is written that the Messiah would be killed and rise from death on the third day.
translation.bj: Iyoh sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Daang Kitab moꞌ obuaꞌ nulis nang, Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ inoh halus susah jolaꞌ duoh yaꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ kobos-e daang onu ke taluh.

translation.en: Remember what happened to Lot’s wife!
translation.bj: Natong nyeꞌ oni deꞌ obuah sowon Lot!

translation.en: God said he would show mercy to our fathers,and he remembered his holy agreement.
translation.bj: Ngan-e bitanga nyayang-E tuduꞌ sumuk babai otoꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ nai samah kodaꞌ janyi-E deꞌ kudus.

translation.en: The fishermen were all amazed at the many fish they caught. When Simon Peter saw this, he bowed down before Jesus and said, “Go away from me, Lord. I am a sinful man!”
translation.bj: Simon duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ olud inoh moꞌ ilan ningaꞌ bogoꞌ ikian deꞌ soꞌon-e.

translation.en: Jesus finished saying all these things to the people. Then he went into Capernaum.
translation.bj: Takal Yesus mokuaꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, Yoh moꞌ odi keꞌ Kapernaum.
Yomoꞌ Yesus odi keꞌ kota Kapernaum deꞌ Galilea, danoꞌ Yoh ngajal nyaꞌa daang Onu Sabat.

translation.en: Jesus’ mother and brothers came to visit him. But they could not get close to him, because there were so many people.
translation.bj: Niꞌ onu takal inoh Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E maꞌad keꞌ olud. Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ, “Jaꞌ otoꞌ odi keꞌ polad donu.” Lasuꞌ odop deꞌ munoꞌ ponu.

translation.en: a promise to free us from the power of our enemies,so that we could serve him without fear
translation.bj: Sobab Iyoh moꞌ bijanyi duoh bisupah tuduꞌ Abraham sumuk babai otoꞌ, yomoꞌ bijanyi pilopas otoꞌ soꞌ musoh toꞌ, saꞌ otoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ tolu tiaꞌ takal toꞌ simayang tuduꞌ-E,

translation.en: Then Jesus turned to his followers. They were there alone with him. He said, “It is a great blessing for you to see what you now see!
translation.bj: Niꞌ onu takal inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan gulu agama Yahudi mujuag ngan-e yaꞌ suba Yesus. Yoh moꞌ sikien tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Gulu, oni deꞌ nai kuꞌ saꞌ kuꞌ ponai tapod Idip sitelus-e duoh Topaꞌ?”

translation.en: Jesus stopped there and said, “Bring that man to me!” When he came close, Jesus asked him,
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ loꞌo yoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ toban nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh tuduꞌ odop-E. Takal-e moꞌ nog sinok, Yesus moꞌ sikien-e,

translation.en: He asked him many questions, but Jesus said nothing.
translation.bj: Sobab inoh Herodes sikien bogoꞌ tuduꞌ-E, pak-e Yesus doiꞌ manah nyawot sina-e.

translation.en: The devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, tell this rock to become bread.”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Daang Kitab moꞌ obuah nulis, ‘Manusia nak-e idip soꞌ pinguman sijaꞌ-a.’”

translation.en: “You will see armies all around Jerusalem. Then you will know that the time for its destruction has come.
translation.bj: “Nyam ingan ningaꞌ Yerusalem obuah kapung odaꞌ sidadu, ingan moꞌ puꞌan nang patuab lubuh-e moh sinok,

translation.en: Jesus told this story: “A man had a fig tree. He planted it in his garden. He came looking for some fruit on it, but he found none.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ sina duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌ kobon-e, ‘Ningaꞌ, moꞌ taluh sowaꞌ tiaꞌ kuꞌ odi kalik buaꞌ tongon koyuh itih pak-e niꞌ buaꞌ doiꞌ geh kuꞌ soꞌon-e. Nobong negeh tongon koyuh noh neh! Sobab doiꞌ manah guna-e iyoh idip!’

translation.en: When the festival was over, they went home, but Jesus stayed in Jerusalem. His parents did not know about it.
translation.bj: Pingoma-E baꞌ-a nang Yesus ponu bibaya duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ ponu duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ. Takal moꞌ niꞌ onu-onu pimonu-e, pingoma-e moꞌ kalik Yesus deꞌ uluk madih ayua-e, deꞌ uluk dingan-dingan-e deꞌ ponu bibaya duoh odop-e.

translation.en: jars of olive oil.’ The manager said to him, ‘Here is your bill. Hurry! Sit down and make the bill less. Write
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ noh yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ke duwoh-e, ‘Timuꞌ kudu tang muꞌ?’ Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Silatus kalung gandum.’ Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus duit inoh sina tuduꞌ-e, ‘Itih sulat tang muꞌ nulis moih puluꞌ kalung negeh.’

translation.en: He told them, “Don’t take more taxes from people than you have been ordered to collect.”
translation.bj: Deꞌ tongan-E ogiꞌ tapan kaꞌan napan suaꞌ podi-E nog-e bisig. Podi Yoh nguluk-E deꞌ daang basal, pak-e suaꞌ oping-e Yoh nyouh-e deꞌ opui deꞌ diꞌ-e ponai pulaꞌ!”

translation.en: They wanted Barabbas to go free—the one who was in jail for starting a riot and for murder. Pilate let Barabbas go free. And he handed Jesus over to be killed. This is what the people wanted.
translation.bj: Yoh moꞌ pilopas Barabas kodaꞌ deꞌ mitiaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, deꞌ obuah jel sobab bogoꞌ salah-e duoh ngabos nyaꞌa. Pilatus moꞌ ngin Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ daꞌ nai siwat-simun deꞌ laꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ-E. Yesus yaꞌ obuah nyalip
Watinoh geh duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌ umoh, niꞌ naꞌan obuah toban buu, niꞌ naꞌan obuah supiah.”

translation.en: Then Herod and his soldiers laughed at him. They made fun of him by dressing him in clothes like kings wear. Then Herod sent him back to Pilate.
translation.bj: Herodes duoh sidadu-sidadu-e moꞌ ngatiaꞌ duoh ngine Yesus, yomoꞌ odaꞌ sidadu-e soꞌ jubah-e tuduꞌ Yesus, jubah deꞌ tok-tok mun sangon-e, mokuaꞌ inoh Herodes moꞌ daꞌ sidadu-e paliꞌ toban Yesus tuduꞌ Pilatus.
Yomoꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Gulu ningaꞌ katiꞌ ogiꞌ duoh podang.” “Mohleh,” in Yesus. Yesus bidoa deꞌ punguꞌ Zaitun

translation.en: In the book of Psalms, David himself says,‘The Lord God said to my Lord:Sit by me at my right side,
translation.bj: Jadi, Daud nang Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ inohleh Tuan-e. Watki wat-e Iyoh ponai soꞌ onak-sukun Daud?” Yesus odaꞌ nyaꞌa bijaga-jaga

translation.en: Zechariah said to the angel, “How can I know that what you say is true? I am an old man, and my wife is also old.”
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ in Zakharia tuduꞌ malaikat inoh, “Oniwat kuꞌ yaꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ nang ingan inoh yaꞌ bonal jadi? Oni tanda-e? Sobab okuꞌ duoh sowonkuꞌ moꞌ nyoma.”

translation.en: They all ate until they were full. And there was a lot of food left. Twelve baskets were filled with the pieces of food that were not eaten.
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nang Yohanes Pembaptis; ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa nang Elia; duoh ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nang nabi-nabi deꞌ nouh-e deꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ idip.”

translation.en: He loves our people and he built the synagogue for us.”
translation.bj: sobab iyoh nyayang bangsa otoꞌ, yoh moꞌ nai boli topat simayang kaꞌan koꞌih.”

translation.en: The followers were amazed and very, very happy to see that Jesus was alive. They still could not believe what they saw. He said to them, “Do you have any food here?”
translation.bj: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ, sobab sikia munuas duoh ilan, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dapod bisayaꞌ Yesus moꞌ sikien tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Podo ogiꞌ pinguman ingan?”

translation.en: I tell you, you will not get out of there until you have paid every cent you owe.”
translation.bj: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Idoh ingan ponai luah soꞌ kanoꞌ, nyam basa aluaꞌ diꞌ ingan bayal dena ingan nog obuaꞌ-e.”

translation.en: Jesus said to them, “Remember when I was with you before? I said that everything written about me must happen—everything written in the Law of Moses, the books of the prophets, and the Psalms.”
translation.bj: Yesus sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Itihleh deꞌ tanonKuꞌ deꞌ ingan takalKuꞌ aluaꞌ duoh ingan. Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis tentang Okuꞌ daang buk-buk deꞌ nulis Musa duoh buk nabi-nabi, duoh Mazmur halus jadi.”

translation.en: And if you cannot be trusted with the things that belong to someone else, you will not be given anything of your own.
translation.bj: Buk-buk deꞌ nulis Musa duoh buk-buk deꞌ nulis nabi-nabi deꞌ bokon, ingan nunaꞌ buaꞌ ajal-e nog joman Yohanes Pembaptis. Soꞌ joman iyohleh, Gah deꞌ Paguh oniꞌ wat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja obuah tanon. Duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa bonal-bonal suba ngan-e yaꞌ jadin umat Topaꞌ.

translation.en: Simon answered, “Master, we worked hard all night trying to catch fish and caught nothing. But you say I should put the nets into the water, so I will.”
translation.bj: Simon moꞌ nyawot-e, “Gulu, koꞌih moh kiloja lolah posah niꞌ ngalom-ngalom, pak-e doiꞌ manah ikian deꞌ soꞌon koꞌih, nyam-e Ingan deꞌ odaꞌ, okuꞌ nai-e, okuꞌ suba lagiꞌ ngijala.”

translation.en: Jesus answered, “The Scriptures say,‘You must worship the Lord your God.Serve only him.’” Deuteronomy
translation.bj: Malaikat deꞌ munoꞌ Nyamut Muꞌu kai tongan-e saꞌ poꞌon Muꞌu diꞌ-e obuah batuh.’”

translation.en: Don’t be ashamed of me and my teaching. If that happens, I will be ashamed of you when I come with my divine greatness and that of the Father and the holy angels.
translation.bj: Kila-kila moih onu takal Yesus mokuaꞌ ngajal, Iyoh moꞌ ngijaꞌ Petrus, Yohanes duoh Yakobus maꞌad keꞌ bung dolod; sobab Yesus yaꞌ bidoa.

translation.en: Do for others what you want them to do for you.
translation.bj: Naileh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa oniꞌ deꞌ suka muꞌu yaꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa nai tuduꞌ odopmuꞌ.

translation.en: “Look what the Lord has done for me! He decided to help me. Now people will stop thinking there is something wrong with me.”
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ sina in-e, “Sobab Topaꞌ moꞌ tulung okuꞌ, okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ tiaꞌ dasaꞌ deꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ.” Malaikat tanon nang Yesus yaꞌ obuah milaꞌ

translation.en: When he saw the angel, Zechariah was upset and very afraid.
translation.bj: Takal Zakharia ningaꞌ malaikat inoh, iyoh moꞌ gogoh simadi-e tolu.

translation.en: You will make his people understand that they will be savedby having their sins forgiven.
translation.bj: kaꞌan tanon tuduꞌ umat-E, nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ obuah nyilamat sobab Topaꞌ moꞌ ngapun dosa-e.

translation.en: They said to him, “Where do you want us to prepare the meal?”He said to them,
translation.bj: Odop-e duwoh inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Daki ingan odaꞌ koꞌih nyidia-e?”

translation.en: “When men bring you into the synagogues before the leaders and other important men, don’t worry about what you will say.
translation.bj: Nyam nyaꞌa toban ingan kaꞌan obuah ngadel keꞌ boli topat simayang atou deꞌ jowin plitah, maꞌ ingan bigaduh oni deꞌ yaꞌ nang ingan ngan ingan yaꞌ bela odop ingan.

translation.en: Then you will say, ‘We ate and drank with you. You taught in the streets of our town.’
translation.bj: Takal joman inoh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ nog soꞌ suaꞌ topat deꞌ bumi, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suaꞌ doꞌon.

translation.en: So be ready all the time. Pray that you will be able to get through all these things that will happen and stand safe before the Son of Man.”
translation.bj: Natong nyeꞌ! Duoh silaluleh bidoa saꞌ ingan taꞌan ngadap suaꞌ-e inoh duoh saꞌ ingan diꞌ-e dasaꞌ duoh munuas takal ingan nyamut Okuꞌ Onak Manusia.”

translation.en: “My Father has given me all things. No one knows who the Son is—only the Father knows. And only the Son knows who the Father is. The only people who will know about the Father are those the Son chooses to tell.”
translation.bj: Sobab bogoꞌ nabi duoh laja deꞌ noꞌuh yaꞌ ningaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ ingan, pak-e diꞌ-e ningaꞌ-e duoh yaꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngojit ingan, pak-e diꞌ-e ngojit-e.” Silita ulang Samaria deꞌ paguh

translation.en: Jesus called his twelve apostles together. He gave them power to heal sicknesses and power to force demons out of people.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ mogan ke simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ-e, Iyoh moꞌ ngin kuasa deꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ pibuu munua duoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e.

translation.en: “The men said to the king, ‘But sir, that servant already has ten bags of money.’
translation.bj: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Tung iyoh kan moꞌ ogiꞌ simoong kiping.’

translation.en: But the servant answered, ‘Master, let the tree have one more year to produce fruit. Let me dig up the dirt around it and fertilize it.
translation.bj: osi puꞌan sowaꞌ baꞌuh podo-e bibuaꞌ. Pak-e nyam idoh, ke nyeꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ nobong-e.’” Yesus odaꞌ mokuaꞌ dayung deꞌ mudug daang Onu Sabat

translation.en: Then Jesus said to his followers, “The time will come when you will want very much to see one of the days of the Son of Man, but you will not be able to.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Yaꞌ nog onu-e ingan ngati Okuꞌ Onak Manusia, yaꞌ militah jadin Laja pak-e ingan diꞌ ngan ponai kilin-e.

translation.en: Jesus closed the book, gave it back to the helper, and sat down. As everyone in the synagogue watched him closely,
translation.bj: “Yesus ulang Nazaret, oni Ingan nog yaꞌ kaso koꞌih? Podo Ingan nog yaꞌ ngukum koꞌih? Puꞌan kuꞌ osi Ingan neh Ingan utusan deꞌ kudus soꞌ Topaꞌ.”

translation.en: So what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, John is a prophet. But I tell you, he is more than that.
translation.bj: Ingan itih luah yaꞌ odi ningaꞌ nabi. Bonal deꞌ ningaꞌ ingan! Pak-e sibonal-e nyaꞌa itih lobih ayuh lagiꞌ soꞌ nabi.

translation.en: Then Mary said,“I praise the Lord with all my heart.
translation.bj: Maria moꞌ sina in-e, “Otinkuꞌ mudi Topaꞌ,

translation.en: And they shouted all kinds of insults at him.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ nyam Kuꞌ sikien tuduꞌ ingan tuang idoh geh diꞌ ingan laꞌan nyawot-e.

translation.en: You did not honor me with oil for my head, but she rubbed my feet with her sweet-smelling oil.
translation.bj: Pak-e Yesus sina duꞌ dayung noh, “Ngan muꞌu moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, muꞌu obuah nyilamat. Paliꞌleh toban otin deꞌ sonang.”

translation.en: None of you can add any time to your life by worrying about it.
translation.bj: Maꞌ bigaduh, sobab sit doiꞌ geh umul nyaꞌa ponai bitamah takal iyoh bigaduh.

translation.en: The followers answered, “The Master needs it.”
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ duwoh inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Gulu plelu-e.”

translation.en: But if you stand before others and say you do not believe in me, then I will say that you do not belong to me. I will say this in the presence of God’s angels.
translation.bj: Pak-e osi deꞌ diꞌ-e ngakuꞌ odop-e jadi pinunaꞌKuꞌ deꞌ sulung jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, iyoh tuang idoh diꞌ-e obuah ngakuꞌ jadi pinunaꞌKuꞌ deꞌ sulung jowin malaikat-malaikat Topaꞌ.

translation.en: And if you are sitting in the most important seat, they will come to you and say, ‘Give this man your seat!’ Then you will have to move down to the last place and be embarrassed.
translation.bj: yomoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli deꞌ ngunang muꞌu inoh odi tuduꞌ muꞌu yomoꞌ sina, ‘Topat itih moꞌ obuah sidia kaꞌan nyaꞌa inoh,’ daang kolaꞌ muꞌ odi guluꞌ deꞌ topat deꞌ bokon deꞌ punuaꞌ.

translation.en: Then a huge army of angels from heaven joined the first angel, and they were all praising God, saying,
translation.bj: Tang-tang malaikat inoh baya bogoꞌ sidadu malaikat deꞌ bokon, mudi Topaꞌ in-e,

translation.en: “The older son had been out in the field. When he came near the house, he heard the sound of music and dancing.
translation.bj: Onak deꞌ pinuan inoh moꞌ malah nyam kila-e, yomoꞌ doliaꞌ-e molot kaang boli-e. Samaꞌ-a inoh moꞌ luah odi tuduꞌ-e tanon odaꞌ molot kaang boli-e.

translation.en: On a Sabbath day, Jesus went to the home of a leading Pharisee to eat with him. The people there were all watching him very closely.
translation.bj: Takal Onu Sabat Yesus odi man deꞌ boli niꞌ naꞌan pimipin ulang Farisi, danoꞌ ogiꞌ ulang Farisi deꞌ bokon duoh gulu-gulu agama tiluti Yesus ngan-e yaꞌ kalik salah-E.

translation.en: Everyone traveled to their own hometowns to have their name put on the list.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ paliꞌ takal inoh, suaꞌ-a paliꞌ keꞌ kupuaꞌ sumuk babai-e ngan-e yaꞌ daftal odop-e masim-masim.

translation.en: Jesus said, “Be careful! Don’t be fooled. Many people will come using my name. They will say, ‘I am the Messiah’ and ‘The right time has come!’ But don’t follow them.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Tauꞌ-tauꞌ nyeꞌ, maꞌ ingan obuah mogo. Sobab bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nog pakai adon Okuꞌ duoh nang: ‘Okuꞌ leh odop-E neh’ duoh ‘Moꞌ yaꞌ nog onu-e tiyaꞌ.’ Pak-e maꞌleh ingan nunaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: The truth is, you must accept God’s kingdom like a little child accepts things, or you will never enter it.”
translation.bj: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Nyaꞌa deꞌ nulut pilitah Topaꞌ daang idip-e samah kodaꞌ onak opot deꞌ sipunuaꞌ-e nulut pilitah pingoma-e, yohleh sijaꞌ deꞌ dapod jadin ayua umat Topaꞌ.” Nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya lolah posah jadin ayua umat Topaꞌ

translation.en: So the farmers threw the son out of the vineyard and killed him.“What will the owner of the vineyard do?
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ matak onak nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh toban keꞌ sopaꞌ kobon yomoꞌ ngabos-e.” Yesus moꞌ sikien tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Moꞌ nyam-e watinoh, oni deꞌ nai nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh tuduꞌ ayua deꞌ munoꞌ?

translation.en: “One time there was a Pharisee and a tax collector. One day they both went to the Temple to pray.
translation.bj: “Ogiꞌ duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa odi bidoa keꞌ Boli Topaꞌ. Niꞌ naꞌan noh ulang Farisi yoh moꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nikan-e lagiꞌ pinagih suke.

translation.en: “Show me a silver coin. Whose name and picture are on it?”They said, “Caesar’s.”
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ diꞌ-e ponai kalik salah Yesus deꞌ jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ loꞌo bidongo simadi-e ilan oni deꞌ nang Yesus. Pinyikian nyaꞌa deꞌ paliꞌ idip

translation.en: He said the Son of Man must be handed over to the control of sinful men, be killed on a cross, and rise from death on the third day.”
translation.bj: Takal Yesus nang, ‘Okuꞌ Onak Manusia halus yaꞌ obuah nyelah keꞌ tongan nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa duoh Okuꞌ halus obuah nyalip, pak-e Okuꞌ paliꞌ idip baꞌuh lagiꞌ daang onu ke taluh-e.’”

translation.en: So the followers brought the donkey to Jesus. They put their coats on its back. Then they put Jesus on the donkey.
translation.bj: Pinunaꞌ Yesus inoh ti-e moꞌ toban keledai inoh tuduꞌ Yesus, yomoꞌ nopas dug keledai inoh pakai jubah-e yomoꞌ tulung paꞌad Yesus keꞌ tun-e.

translation.en: Then Jesus said to the man, “Stand up! You can go. You were healed because you believed.”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Mokat mei nyeꞌ moꞌ buu. Sobab muꞌu bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ muꞌu mokuaꞌ.” Topaꞌ yaꞌ nog jadin Laja

translation.en: Jesus looked at his followers and said,“Great blessings belong to you who are poor.God’s kingdom belongs to you.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ ngiduang pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, Yoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Sonangleh ingan deꞌ botak kolag sobab Topaꞌ leh deꞌ jadi Laja ingan.

translation.en: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter God’s kingdom.”
translation.bj: Sonang dooꞌ niꞌ polong unta molot kaang lubang tuos soꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ biduit yaꞌ jadin umat Topaꞌ.”

translation.en: In response, Jesus said to the Pharisee, “Simon, I have something to say to you.”Simon said, “Let me hear it, Teacher.”
translation.bj: Soꞌ duwoh odop-e diꞌ-e taan bayal tang-e noh, yomoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ duit noh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ odaꞌ bayal-e. Osi leh deꞌ soꞌ duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa inoh deꞌ lobih nyayang nyaꞌa deꞌ nyam duit tuduꞌ-e noh?”

translation.en: This woman that I healed is a true descendant of Abraham. But Satan has held her for
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sikien in-e, “Oniwat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja? Yomoꞌ samah kodaꞌ oni Okuꞌ yaꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan?

translation.en: A religious leader asked Jesus, “Good Teacher, what must I do to get eternal life?”
translation.bj: Ogiꞌ pimipin Yahudi sikien tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu deꞌ paguh, oni deꞌ patut kuꞌ nai saꞌ kuꞌ soꞌon idip deꞌ sitelus-e?”

translation.en: As Jesus was saying these things, a woman with the people there called out to him, “Blessings from God belong to the woman who gave birth to you and fed you!”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ Yesus sina watinoh tiꞌ-e, niꞌ naꞌan dayung soꞌ odop-e deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Obuah bilokatleh sinoꞌ deꞌ milaꞌ Ingan!”

translation.en: After Jesus said these things, he continued traveling toward Jerusalem.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ takal-e mokuaꞌ nang sina-E, Yesus moꞌ nyamung pimonu-e keꞌ Yerusalem.

translation.en: One of the men in the crowd said to Jesus, “Teacher, our father just died and left some things for us. Tell my brother to share them with me.”
translation.bj: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, sina tuduꞌ madihku saꞌ-e kutung halta deꞌ supiah pingoma koꞌih.”

translation.en: The group that was sent to Jesus went back to the house. There they found that the servant was healed.
translation.bj: Takal pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ obuah odaꞌ panglima inoh odi tuduꞌ Yesus inoh paliꞌ keꞌ boli, yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ kuli inoh moh mokuaꞌ. Yesus paliꞌ kidip onak bujang deꞌ Nain

translation.en: A time is coming when your enemies will build a wall around you and hold you in on all sides.
translation.bj: Takal Yesus molot deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ yoh moꞌ kasig nyaꞌa deꞌ bijua danoꞌ.

translation.en: When he heard the people coming down the road, he asked, “What is happening?”
translation.bj: Takal inoh bogoꞌ nyaꞌa ngilusuꞌ olan inoh, yoh moꞌ sikien tuduꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ, “Oni deꞌ in inoh neh?”

translation.en: If anyone asks you why you are taking the donkey, you should say, ‘The Master needs it.’”
translation.bj: Nyam basa ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sikien tuduꞌ ingan, ‘Oniꞌ ngan ingan pilopas tolin keledai inoh soꞌ tiang-e neh?’ Tanon daꞌ-e nang Gulu pilelu-e.”

translation.en: Maybe the tree will have fruit on it next year. If it still does not produce, then you can cut it down.’”
translation.bj: Takal Onu Sabat, Yesus ngajal daang boli topat simayang.

translation.en: Jesus told them this story: “No one takes cloth off a new coat to cover a hole in an old coat. That would ruin the new coat, and the cloth from the new coat would not be the same as the old cloth.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus silita tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ perumpamaan itih, “Doiꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nopung bojuh oma-e kai kain bojuh baꞌuh. Sobab nyam yoh nai watnoh bojuh baꞌuh inoh totap totak. Duoh kain bojuh deꞌ baꞌuh inoh geh idoh diꞌ-e bitotok duoh bojuh deꞌ oma.

translation.en: Jesus said, “I want to heal you. Be healed!” Then he touched the man, and immediately the leprosy disappeared.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ tomaꞌ-e semadiꞌ-e sina, “Laꞌan Kuꞌ mokuaꞌ leh.” Takal inoh geh onam-e lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ.

translation.en: When the
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Noꞌuh-e Okuꞌ kilin Muot, Laja munua, labuꞌ kodaꞌ kijat soꞌ longit.

translation.en: It was about noon, but it turned dark throughout the land until three o’clock in the afternoon,
translation.bj: Kila-kila pukul simoong duwoh uun onu, susuaꞌ pulow inoh bilubah jadi mopung kodaꞌ onu ngalom nog pukul taluh ngumi.

translation.en: “It happened that a Jewish priest was going down that road. When he saw the man, he did not stop to help him. He walked away.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh moꞌ ogiꞌ lagiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa soꞌ Samariae daang pimonu-e ngilusuꞌ olan inoh geh, takal-e ningaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh, masiꞌ nyam-e tuduꞌ-e.

translation.en: “When the Son of Man comes again, it will be the same as it was when Noah lived.
translation.bj: Samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip deꞌ joman nabi Nuh noꞌuh-e, watinoh geh deꞌ yaꞌ jadi takal Okuꞌ yaꞌ nog.

translation.en: Then he turned to the woman and said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? When I came into your house, you gave me no water for my feet. But she washed my feet with her tears and dried my feet with her hair.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sina duꞌ dayung noh, “Dosa-dosamuꞌ moꞌ obuah ngapun.”
Deꞌ boli topat simayang ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munua molot daang gonan-e, yoh moꞌ nang bogan-e,

translation.en: So be careful!“If your brother or sister in God’s family does something wrong, warn them. If they are sorry for what they did, forgive them.
translation.bj: Jadin, tauꞌ-tauꞌ saꞌ ingan diꞌ-e nai oniꞌ deꞌ kodaꞌ inoh! Moꞌ nyam ogiꞌ madihmuꞌ deꞌ nai dosa, ngalah nyeꞌ. Nyam basa iyoh moꞌ jook-e, ngin apun tuduꞌ-e.

translation.en: Jesus said to him, “A man gave a big dinner. He invited many people.
translation.bj: Pak-e Yesus sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa inoh, “Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa biluman yomoꞌ ngijaꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa nog man.

translation.en: silver coins.
translation.bj: Muꞌu diꞌ muꞌ nyamut Okuꞌ kai sium, pak-e dayung itih diꞌ-e mokuaꞌ-mokuaꞌ sium poꞌonKuꞌ, soꞌ ngan Kuꞌ nog katiꞌ.

translation.en: Jesus said, “There were two men. Both men owed money to the same banker. One man owed him
translation.bj: Simon moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ kila nyaꞌa deꞌ paling bogoꞌ tang-e inoh.” Yesus moꞌ nang, “Bonal oni deꞌ nang muꞌu noh.”

translation.en: Later, Zechariah’s wife Elizabeth became pregnant. So she did not go out of her house for five months. She said,
translation.bj: Diꞌ-e tui soꞌ inoh, Elisabet moꞌ bitiiaꞌ. Limoh bulan iyoh diꞌ-e luah soꞌ boli-e.

translation.en: You can be happy then and jump for joy, because you have a great reward in heaven. The ancestors of those people did the same things to the prophets.
translation.bj: Sonangleh ingan deꞌ obuah nai watinoh geh odaꞌ nyaꞌa, sobab ayuh pah deꞌ moh sidia daang sulga. Natong nyeꞌ nabi-nabi joman nouh-e obuah nyusah geh odaꞌ sumuk babai nyaꞌa Yahudi.

translation.en: The men who were caring for the pigs ran away and told the story in the fields and in the town.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ daerah Gerasa duoh kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ deꞌ sinok inoh mitiaꞌ saꞌ Yesus buu soꞌ kanoꞌ, sobab susuaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sukup-sukup tolu-e. Yomoꞌ Yesus maꞌad keꞌ olud yaꞌ buu.

translation.en: “But the people who hear my words and do not obey are like a man who builds a house without preparing a foundation. When the floods come, the house falls down easily and is completely destroyed.”
translation.bj: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit pingunangkuꞌ, yoh moꞌ idoh diꞌ-e nai kodaꞌ oni deꞌ nang kuꞌ, yoh noh kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kajuag boli-e deꞌ tanaꞌ pak-e lubang deꞌ nai-e ladas diꞌ-e nog batuh. Nyam ubaꞌ nog, boli-e inoh lasuꞌ patuab lubuh, sobab boli-e inoh goyua.”

translation.en: “When anyone listens to you my followers, they are really listening to me. But when anyone refuses to accept you, they are really refusing to accept me. And when anyone refuses to accept me, they are refusing to accept the one who sent me.”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh juꞌ puluꞌ pinunaꞌ Yesus inoh paliꞌ soꞌ pimonu-e daang toban otin-e deꞌ sonang yomoꞌ tanon nang, “Gulu, bogoꞌ munua nulut geh deꞌ koꞌih sobab pakai adon Ingan.”

translation.en: But none of these things can really harm you.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ ponai ngabos polong ingan pak-e sibonal-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ponai yaꞌ nai oni-oni-e tuduꞌ ingan. Niꞌ kiluang geh buak deꞌ bak ingan diꞌ-e moyap!

translation.en: He said to his followers, “Where is your faith?”They were afraid and amazed. They said to each other, “What kind of man is this? He commands the wind and the water, and they obey him.”
translation.bj: Takal-e ningaꞌ Yesus, iyoh nang bogan-e lasuꞌ bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus duoh sina, “Oni ulusan Ingan duoh okuꞌ Yesus Onak Topaꞌ deꞌ paling Bigatung-e! Okuꞌ mitiaꞌ tulung duꞌ Ingan saꞌ Ingan maꞌ nyiksa okuꞌ.”

translation.en: They said to each other, “When he talked to us on the road, it felt like a fire burning in us. How exciting it was when he explained to us the true meaning of the Scriptures!”
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ duwoh noh moꞌ lasuꞌ nang, “Takal Iyoh sina simadi-e tanon isiꞌ Kitab tuduꞌ koꞌih deꞌ olan, otin koꞌih kan-e sukup nyam sonang-e.”

translation.en: When it was time to eat, he sent his servant to tell the guests, ‘Come. The food is ready.’
translation.bj: Takal yaꞌ mulai pesta nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ odaꞌ kuli odi tuduꞌ tamu duoh sina, ‘Jaꞌ mei suaꞌ-e moꞌ siap.’

translation.en: Jesus was full of pain; he struggled hard in prayer. Sweat dripped from his face like drops of blood falling to the ground.
translation.bj: Takal Yesus aluaꞌ sina, nogleh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ deꞌ obuah mipin odaꞌ Yudas, pinunaꞌ odop Yesus. Mokuaꞌ inoh Yudas moꞌ odi sinoꞌ Yesus yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ sium-E.

translation.en: On that hill there was a big herd of pigs eating. The demons begged Jesus to allow them to go into the pigs. So he allowed them to do this.
translation.bj: Lasuꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ ngumaꞌ ningaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ moh. Odop deꞌ munoꞌ nog tuduꞌ Yesus, danoꞌ geh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ munua guluꞌ sinoꞌ poꞌon Yesus, daang yoh moꞌ ogiꞌ pimakai-e duoh pimikil-e moh paguh. Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ tolu.

translation.en: “A few days later the younger son gathered up all that he had and left. He traveled far away to another country, and there he wasted his money living like a fool.
translation.bj: Sobab iyoh moꞌ sukup pilai-e, yoh moꞌ yaꞌ man nyak oyuaꞌ ngan-e ngisiꞌ toꞌin-e. Sungu-e sukup pilai-e, doiꞌ geh nyaꞌa ngin pinguman tuduꞌ-e.

translation.en: “It will be the same as during the time of Lot, when God destroyed Sodom. Those people were eating, drinking, buying, selling, planting, and building houses for themselves.
translation.bj: Samah geh kodaꞌ joman Lot noꞌuh-e nyaꞌa bidu man nuak, bidu bijua, bidu bilumoh yomoꞌ nai boli-e.

translation.en: So pay attention to what is inside. Give to the people who need help. Then you will be fully clean.
translation.bj: Mulah otinleh ngin halta ingan tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag, ke ingan samah kodaꞌ pingian deꞌ bisig bait nuwaꞌ sopaꞌ duoh aang-e deꞌ boton Topaꞌ.

translation.en: He laid his hands on her, and immediately she was able to stand up straight. She began praising God.
translation.bj: Topaꞌ Yesus moꞌ sina, “Pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ sijaꞌ ingan itih! Sobab daang Onu Sabat ingan pilopas binatang deꞌ kidip ingan soꞌ topat-e ngan-e ingan toban luah saꞌ-e man nuak.

translation.en: But the other criminal stopped him. He said, “You should fear God. All of us will die soon.
translation.bj: Pak-e niꞌ naꞌan ulang jaꞌat deꞌ nuwaꞌ kawa-e ngalah dingan-e, in-e, “Maꞌ nang inoh! Sipatut-e muꞌu tolu tuduꞌ Topaꞌ sobab muꞌu ulang jaꞌat tilimaꞌ ukum deꞌ samah duoh Iyoh.

translation.en: They traveled for a whole day thinking that Jesus was with them in the group. They began looking for him among their family and close friends,
translation.bj: Pak-e diꞌ-e dapod-e, pingoma-e moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem kalik Yesus.

translation.en: Jesus knew what they were thinking, so he took a little child and stood the child beside him.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ in-E, “Maꞌ jaman-e, sobab moꞌ nyam basa nyaꞌa inoh diꞌ lawan ingan loti-e iyoh nuwaꞌ ingan.” Nyaꞌa soꞌ kupuaꞌ deꞌ Samaria diꞌ-e nyamut Yesus

translation.en: If you cannot be trusted with worldly riches, you will not be trusted with the true riches.
translation.bj: Pak-e in Yesus sina tuduꞌ ulang Farisi deꞌ munoꞌ, “Inganleh nyaꞌa deꞌ liga pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ bonal deꞌ sulung jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ pak-e Topaꞌ puꞌan isiꞌ otin ingan sobab oniꞌ deꞌ obuah mudi odaꞌ manusia inohleh deꞌ buꞌui Topaꞌ daꞌ-a.

translation.en: We were hoping that he would be the one to free Israel. But then all this happened.“And now something else: It has been three days since he was killed,
translation.bj: Pak-e koꞌih bialap nang Iyoh deꞌ yaꞌ pilopas bangsa Israel. Duoh onu tih iyohleh onu ke taluh-e soꞌ takal suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jadi.

translation.en: They began to accuse Jesus and said to Pilate, “We caught this man trying to change the thinking of our people. He says we should not pay taxes to Caesar. He calls himself the Messiah, a king.”
translation.bj: Danoꞌ susuaꞌ odop deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ napo Yesus, odop deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Koꞌih dapod Nyaꞌa tih lawan pilitah Roma, Iyoh tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bangsa koꞌih, saꞌ-e jaman bayal suke tuduꞌ Kaisar duoh Yoh nang odop-e Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ, Laja ulang Yahudi.”

translation.en: Then Zechariah could talk again, and he began praising God.
translation.bj: Takal inoh geh Zakharia moꞌ lasuꞌ ponai paliꞌ sina yoh moꞌ mudi Topaꞌ.

translation.en: When Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting, the unborn baby inside her jumped, and she was filled with the Holy Spirit.
translation.bj: Takal Elisabet ngojit salam soꞌ Maria, onak daang toꞌin-e moꞌ kimilit, yomoꞌ Elisabet punuaꞌ daang Iyang Topaꞌ.

translation.en: But there were so many people that they could not find a way to Jesus. So they went up on the roof and lowered the crippled man down through a hole in the ceiling. They lowered the mat into the room so that the crippled man was lying before Jesus.
translation.bj: Pak-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ponai toban molot. Inohleh ngan-e odop-e munoꞌ paꞌad nyaꞌa deꞌ gilagan inoh keꞌ tun bungan boli deꞌ ilow-e lata. Yomoꞌ odop-e munoꞌ bukaꞌ ilow-e duoh pimuun nyaꞌa inoh baya amuak-e deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus deꞌ uun nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh.

translation.en: Joseph and Mary finished doing all the things that the law of the Lord commanded. Then they went home to Nazareth, their own town in Galilee.
translation.bj: Onak inoh moꞌ bitamah ayuh, dolas. Yoh bijak, Yoh moꞌ obuah nyayang odaꞌ Topaꞌ. Takal umul Yesus simoong duwoh sowaꞌ deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ
