translation.en: Some people there with Jesus at that time told him about what had happened to some worshipers from Galilee. Pilate had them killed. Their blood was mixed with the blood of the animals they had brought for sacrificing.
translation.bj: Takal Yesus aluaꞌ ngajal ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tanon gah deꞌ Yesus nang, “Kudu-kudu onu takal inoh ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa soꞌ Galilea deꞌ obuah ngabos odaꞌ Pilatus, takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngin kulban tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.”
Yesus odi keꞌ topat boꞌos tua Simon. Yoh odaꞌ modud-e mokuaꞌ. Yomoꞌ tua Simon lasuꞌ mokat nai pinguman kaꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: She gave birth to her first son. She wrapped him up well and laid him in a box where cattle are fed. She put him there because the guest room was full.
translation.bj: Maria milaꞌ onak pinuan-e deꞌ dali. Yoh moꞌ molut-e pakai kain lapin, yomoꞌ piguling onak-e noh deꞌ daang dulang binatangc deꞌ topas-e pakai duh sai-e boli-boli soꞌo yaꞌ ngilumon obuaꞌ punuaꞌ. Gah soꞌ malaikat

translation.en: They were talking about everything that had happened.
translation.bj: Daang-e ponu odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh kilakal suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi.

translation.en: The apostles tried to understand this, but they could not; the meaning was hidden from them.
translation.bj: Pak-e pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus idoh diꞌ-e ngiloti oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus inoh sobab loti-e obuah suꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ inohleh sobab yoh diꞌ puꞌan loti-e. Yesus odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ mokuaꞌ

translation.en: “Think about how the wildflowers grow. They don’t work or make clothes for themselves. But I tell you that even Solomon, the great and rich king, was not dressed as beautifully as one of these flowers.
translation.bj: Suba ningaꞌ bunga deꞌ tumuꞌ deꞌ tolun deꞌ diꞌ-e ponai nyiꞌit ngan-e nai pimakai-e. Pak-e Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Laja Salomo deꞌ bonal-bonal kaya doiꞌ geh iyoh kai pimakai deꞌ lobih sangon soꞌ bunga-bunga inoh!

translation.en: While they were sailing, Jesus slept. A big storm blew across the lake, and the boat began to fill with water. They were in danger.
translation.bj: Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E nyamung bilayal nog keꞌ daerah nyaꞌa Gerasa deꞌ polad Donu Galilea.

translation.en: Then Jesus said to him, “I promise you, today you will be with me in paradise.”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ muꞌu: Soꞌ onu itih muꞌu moꞌ bisamah-samah duoh Okuꞌ deꞌ sulga.” Yesus Kobos

translation.en: When you hear about wars and riots, don’t be afraid. These things must happen first. Then the end will come later.”
translation.bj: Asal ingan ngojit nyaꞌa bogoꞌ bipolang yomoꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa blawan, maꞌ ingan gogoh sobab suaꞌ inoh totap yaꞌ dioꞌ jadi, pak-e takal inoh idoh diꞌ-e lasuꞌ Onu Kiamat.”

translation.en: That same day two of Jesus’ followers were going to a town named Emmaus. It is about seven miles from Jerusalem.
translation.bj: Daang onu inoh geh, duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ Yesus ponu keꞌ kupuaꞌ Emaus deꞌ sikital simoong niꞌ kilometer soꞌ Yerusalem.

translation.en: While they were talking, discussing these things, Jesus himself came near and walked with them.
translation.bj: Takal odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh kilakal, Yesus moꞌ nog ponu bibaya duoh-e.

translation.en: “If you love only those who love you, should you get any special praise for doing that? No, even sinners love those who love them!
translation.bj: Nyam ingan nyayang nyaꞌa deꞌ nyayang ingan sijaꞌ-e, patut keh ingan obuah mudi? Nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa nyayang geh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ nyayang odop-e!

translation.en: If God makes what grows in the field so beautiful, what do you think he will do for you? That’s just grass—one day it’s alive, and the next day someone throws it into a fire. But God cares enough to make it beautiful. Surely he will do much more for you. Your faith is so small!
translation.bj: Jadi nyam basa bunga deꞌ tolun onu itih ogiꞌ, tiaꞌ pagi obuah nyouh, pak-e Topaꞌ nai bunga inoh lobih paguh. Watinoh geh ingan totu Topaꞌ ngin pimakai deꞌ ingan! Oni nai ingan idoh bisayaꞌ?

translation.en: Then the demons came out of the man and went into the pigs. The herd of pigs ran down the hill into the lake, and all were drowned.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga oyuaꞌ inoh ti-e ningaꞌ hal inoh yoh kilakal oni wat-e ngan odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ molot munua inoh ponai mokuaꞌ.

translation.en: Another man said, ‘I have just bought five pairs of work animals; I must go and try them out. Please excuse me.’
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ nikan-e nang, ‘Okuꞌ baꞌuh geh moꞌ milih limoh pasang klobow dali duoh okuꞌ yaꞌ odi ningaꞌ-e podo klobow inoh ponai kiloja.’

translation.en: When he finished praying, he went to his followers. He found them asleep, worn out from their grieving.
translation.bj: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Yudas, Podo pakai salam sium muꞌu yaꞌ ngin Okuꞌ Onak Manusia?”

translation.en: I know this because I am a man under the authority of other men. And I have soldiers under my authority. I tell one soldier, ‘Go,’ and he goes. And I tell another soldier, ‘Come,’ and he comes. And I say to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and my servant obeys me.”
translation.bj: Samah kodaꞌ okuꞌ. Okuꞌ nunaꞌ geh tuduꞌ plitah nyaꞌa deꞌ somu, duoh deꞌ douꞌ okuꞌ, sidadu-sidadu totu yoh lasuꞌ nunaꞌ plitahkuꞌ. Nyam okuꞌ sobot odaꞌ, ‘Buu,’ yoh buu geh duoh nyam okuꞌ sobot tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, ‘Got katiꞌ,’ yoh nog geh, duoh nyam kuꞌ sobot tuduꞌ kuli okuꞌ, ‘Nai itih,’ yoh moꞌ nai-e.”

translation.en: Every morning all the people got up early to go listen to Jesus at the Temple.
translation.bj: Suam-suam pagi bogoꞌ nyaꞌa nog Boli Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngojit pingunang-E.

translation.en: I begged your followers to make the evil spirit leave my son, but they could not do it.”
translation.bj: Takal onak opot inoh sinok Yesus, munua inoh moꞌ paꞌan-e deꞌ tanaꞌ yoh moꞌ guyang gusuaꞌ-e pak-e Yesus kasig munua inoh, onak opot inoh mokuaꞌ Yesus paliꞌ onak pot inoh deꞌ samaꞌ-e. 43a Ningaꞌ hal inoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa obuaꞌ ilan ngan-e ningaꞌ kuasa Topaꞌ. Keduwoh sidoh Yesus tanon nang odop-E yaꞌ obuah ngabos 43b Takal suaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh aluaꞌ ilan oni deꞌ nai Yesus, Iyoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E,

translation.en: In the same way, I tell you, heaven is a happy place when one sinner decides to change. There is more joy for that one sinner than for
translation.bj: Takal iyoh dapod-e, yomoꞌ mogan madih ayua-e duoh dingan-dingan-e, yomoꞌ sina in-e, ‘Doon mei duoh okuꞌ sobab niꞌ kiping pilak duitkuꞌ deꞌ moyap moꞌ dapodkuꞌ.’

translation.en: Jesus saw how much faith they had and said to the sick man, “Friend, your sins are forgiven.”
translation.bj: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ lobih bisayaꞌ, Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah onam palah inoh, “Dosamuꞌ moh obuah ngapun madihKuꞌ.”

translation.en: When the baby was eight days old, he was circumcised, and he was named Jesus. This name was given by the angel before the baby began to grow inside Mary.
translation.bj: Takal umul kuweꞌ Maria moꞌ moih onu, yoh moꞌ odi bisunat-E. Pingoma-E moꞌ biladon kuweꞌ-e inoh Yesus, sobab adon inoh deꞌ tanon malaikat tuduꞌ sinoꞌ-E takal aluaꞌ diꞌ bitiiaꞌ-a. Yesus obuah katod tuduꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ

translation.en: Then the master will come when the servant is not ready, at a time when the servant is not expecting him. Then the master will punish that servant and send him away to be with the other people who don’t obey.
translation.bj: nyam toke-e nog daang onu deꞌ diꞌ-e sakaꞌ-a, kuli inoh obuah ngabos, nasib-e samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e setia tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

translation.en: Jesus said to his followers, “Once there was a rich man. He hired a manager to take care of his business. Later, he learned that his manager was cheating him.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan sidagal. Iyoh ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ-e odaꞌ ngulus halta-e. Sidagal inoh ngojit nang nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ-e daꞌ-e saꞌat sayou duit-e.

translation.en: But he said to his father, ‘Look, for all these years I have worked like a slave for you. I have always done what you told me to do, and you never gave me even a young goat for a party with my friends.
translation.bj: Pak-e otoꞌ patut doon duoh munuas, sobab sudiꞌmuꞌ itih samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos, deꞌ moh paliꞌ idip, samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moyap, deꞌ moh paliꞌ lagiꞌ.’ ”

translation.en: From now on, a family of five will be divided, three against two, and two against three.
translation.bj: Sobab soꞌ adin ogiꞌ limoh naꞌan bikaꞌi-bikalah daang niꞌ lawang boꞌon. Taluh lawan duwoh, duwoh lawan taluh.

translation.en: One of the experts in the law said to Jesus, “Teacher, when you say these things about the Pharisees, you are criticizing our group too.”
translation.bj: Niꞌ soꞌ gulu agama Yahudi sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, daang pingunang Ingan inoh tiꞌ-e Ingan nguyat koꞌih geh.”

translation.en: Jesus answered them, “My mother and my brothers are those who listen to God’s teaching and obey it.”
translation.bj: Lasuꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E odi guyang Yesus. In nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, “Gulu, Gulu! Yaꞌ kobos otoꞌ neh!” Yesus mokat yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ sina dolas-dolas-e, “Loꞌo!” Sobak duoh gilumang inoh lasuꞌ loꞌo takal inoh geh.

translation.en: When you feel the wind begin to blow from the south, you say, ‘It will be a hot day.’ And you are right.
translation.bj: Nyam ingan ngoon sobak, ingan nang, ‘Onu itih yaꞌ putiak’, yomoꞌ tok-tok-e putiak.

translation.en: Then the evil spirit goes out and brings back seven other spirits more evil than itself. They all go and live there, and that person has even more trouble than before.”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ noh yomoꞌ odi duoh toban juꞌ munua deꞌ bokon deꞌ lobih jaꞌat soꞌ iyoh. Yomoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ molot keꞌ aang gonan nyaꞌa inoh yoh moꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ. Duoh piobuaꞌ-e nyaꞌa inoh jadi lobih jolaꞌ idip soꞌ deꞌ sibungas-e.” Sonang deꞌ sibonal-bonal-e

translation.en: Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken. If that stone falls on you, it will crush you!”
translation.bj: Jadin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngite. Odop deꞌ munoꞌ pait nyaꞌa deꞌ pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ paguh ngan-e ngite-e yomoꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh bogoꞌ sikien oniꞌ deꞌ Yesus ngan kalik salah-e saꞌ-e ponai takap duoh toban tuduꞌ gubenul.

translation.en: Then you will have great blessings, because these people cannot pay you back. They have nothing. But God will reward you at the time when all godly people rise from death.”
translation.bj: Muꞌu totu obuah bilokat sobab nyaꞌa inoh tiꞌ-e diꞌ-e dapod balas pingunai paguhmuꞌ. Pingunai paguhmuꞌ inoh Topaꞌ deꞌ balas, takal nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ ajal Topaꞌ paliꞌ idip.” Perumpamaan biluman ayuh

translation.en: In Jericho there was a man named Zacchaeus. He was a wealthy, very important tax collector.
translation.bj: Deꞌ kota inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan pimipin pinagih suke deꞌ kaya. Adon-e Zakheus.

translation.en: When they saw the baby, they told what the angels said about this child.
translation.bj: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ Kuweꞌ inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ silita Kuweꞌ Yusuf duoh Maria tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ nang malaikat tuduꞌ-e.

translation.en: “No one takes a light and puts it under a bowl or hides it. Instead, they put it on a lampstand so that the people who come in can see.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sina, “Doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kidip lapu kadis yomoꞌ suan atou kuab kai bona. Totu yoh gan lapuc inoh deꞌ topat deꞌ dapod nyaꞌa ningaꞌ jawaꞌ-e.
Nyam yoh puꞌan nang odop-e diꞌ-e taan, totu takal musoh-e aluaꞌ juaꞌ iyoh moꞌ pait kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa saꞌan bidamai.”
Buaꞌ ajal duoh sina Yesus punuaꞌ daꞌ kuasa, inoh ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bidongo ngojit-e.

translation.en: “Be ready! Be fully dressed and have your lights shining.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Silaluleh odaꞌ odop ingan sidia saꞌan melayani Topaꞌ.

translation.en: So, after I punish him a little, I will let him go free.”
translation.bj: Sobab inohleh okuꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa mosut pijolaꞌ-e mokuaꞌ inoh pilopas-e.”

translation.en: Everyone was hoping for the Messiah to come, and they wondered about John. They thought, “Maybe he is the Messiah.”
translation.bj: Yohanes ngalah geh laja Herodes, sai-e mit Herodias, sowon madih-e jadi sowon-e duoh suaꞌ pingunai-e deꞌ bokon deꞌ jaꞌat.

translation.en: But if I use Satan’s power to force out demons, then what power do your people use when they force out demons? So your own people will prove that you are wrong.
translation.bj: Sobab Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ deꞌ kasig munua pakai kuasa Topaꞌ, Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ leh deꞌ tanon nang ingan salah sobab ingan napo Okuꞌ kasig munua pakai kuasa Beelzebul.

translation.en: and the Holy Spirit came down on him. The Spirit looked like a real dove. Then a voice came from heaven and said, “You are my Son, the one I love. I am very pleased with you.”
translation.bj: onak Maat, onak Matica, onak Simei, onak Yosekh, onak Yoda,

translation.en: The prophets said the Messiah must suffer these things before he begins his time of glory.”
translation.bj: Laja Pinyilamat halus susah jolaꞌ dioꞌ ke Yoh obuah pakat jadin Laja deꞌ tun suaꞌ oniꞌ.”

translation.en: “I assure you that all these things will happen while some of the people of this time are still living.
translation.bj: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip joman itih aluaꞌ diꞌ-e kobos takal suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ tok-tok yaꞌ jadi.” Bijaga-jaga

translation.en: The angels left the shepherds and went back to heaven. The shepherds said to each other, “Let’s go to Bethlehem and see this great event the Lord has told us about.”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh malaikat deꞌ munoꞌ buꞌu togan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ sulga. Kudu-kudu naꞌan gembala deꞌ nguan domba sina siodop-e, “Jaꞌ otoꞌ keꞌ Betlehem ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ danih, deꞌ moꞌ tanon Topaꞌ tuduꞌ otoꞌ.”

translation.en: But they shouted again, “Kill him! Kill him on a cross!”
translation.bj: Pak-e makin dolas geh nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ nang bogan-e, “Nyalip yoh noh! Nyalip yoh Noh!”
Sobab bilang Onu Paskah, Pilatus halus pilopas niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ,
Munua deꞌ munoꞌ bonal-bonal mitiaꞌ saꞌ Yesus diꞌ-e kasig odop deꞌ munoꞌ molot daang Jurang Maut.a

translation.en: So Joseph left Nazareth, a town in Galilee, and went to the town of Bethlehem in Judea. It was known as the town of David. Joseph went there because he was from the family of David.
translation.bj: Yusuf tuang watinoh geh odi soꞌ Nazaret deꞌ Galilea keꞌ Betlehem deꞌ Yudea, topat laja Daud obuah milaꞌ, sobab Yusuf onak-sukun Daud.

translation.en: “And there were many people with leprosy living in Israel during the time of the prophet Elisha. But none of them were healed; the only one was Naaman. And he was from the country of Syria, not Israel.”
translation.bj: Munua moꞌ luah soꞌ gonan nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, simadi-e nang bogan-e, “Inganleh Onak Topaꞌ!” Pak-e Yesus jaman munua deꞌ munoꞌ sina, sobab munua puꞌan nang Yesus Iyohleh Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ. Yesus tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh deꞌ kota-kota deꞌ bokon

translation.en: Some people will be worthy to be raised from death and live again after this life. In that life they will not marry.
translation.bj: Odop Musa deꞌ tanon nang nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos paliꞌ idip baꞌuh, daang silita Musa opui biduduꞌ daang totaꞌ duh, iyoh sobot nang Topaꞌ iyohleh Topaꞌ deꞌ obuah nyomah odaꞌ Abraham, Ishak duoh Yakub,

translation.en: So some of our group went to the tomb too. It was just as the women said. They saw the tomb, but they did not see Jesus.”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh kudu-kudu naꞌan dingan koꞌih moꞌ odi keꞌ kubul. Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ nang suaꞌ oniꞌ samah kodaꞌ deꞌ tanon dayung deꞌ munoꞌ, pak-e Yesus doiꞌ yoh kilin-e neh.”

translation.en: “Now you, little boy, will be called a prophet of the Most High God.You will go first before the Lord to prepare the way for him.
translation.bj: Zakharia moꞌ sina tuduꞌ onak-e, “Onakkuꞌ, muꞌu yaꞌ obuah sobot nyaꞌa nang nabi Topaꞌ deꞌ Paling Bigatung deꞌ yaꞌ dioꞌ nog soꞌ Topaꞌ saꞌ sidia olan kaꞌan Topaꞌ,

translation.en: This was the first counting of all the people while Quirinius was governor of Syria.
translation.bj: Inohleh ituang nyaꞌa deꞌ sibungas-e deꞌ nai Kirenius takal-e jadi gubenul deꞌ Siria.b

translation.en: Judas, the son of James,Judas Iscariot (the one who turned against Jesus).
translation.bj: Yudas onak Yakobus, yomoꞌ Yudas Iskariot deꞌ ngin Yesus deꞌ musoh-E. Yesus ngajal duoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ mokuaꞌ

translation.en: Then Jesus said to them, “Be careful and guard against all kinds of greed. People do not get life from the many things they own.”
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ in Yesus lagiꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Tauꞌ-tauꞌ jaꞌ muꞌu jadi nyaꞌa deꞌ pinganguak, sobab idip manusia idoh diꞌ-e jok-e soꞌ halta sijaꞌ-e.”

translation.en: Pilate decided to give them what they wanted.
translation.bj: Lasuꞌ Pilatus ngin hukum ngabos deꞌ Yesus nunaꞌ oni in deꞌ nang nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: He bowed down at Jesus’ feet and thanked him. (He was a Samaritan.)
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh deꞌ jowin Yesus iyoh bikunyug ngan-e bisukul tuduꞌ-E. Nyaꞌa inoh ulang Samaria.

translation.en: “When you go into the city, you will see a man carrying a jar of water. Follow him. He will go into a house.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Takal ingan molot daang kota Yerusalem danih ingan yaꞌ bidapod duoh dali deꞌ toban piꞌin daang bona. Nunaꞌ negeh iyoh keꞌ boli soꞌ-e molot,

translation.en: The Pharisees and the teachers of the law got so mad they couldn’t think straight. They talked to each other about what they could do to Jesus.
translation.bj: Pak-e gulu agama Yahudi duoh ulang Farisi deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sukup tiwas, yoh moꞌ biloneng sitipan odop-e, oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai-e tuduꞌ Yesus. Yesus pilih simoong duwoh rasul

translation.en: When Jesus heard this, he was amazed. He turned to the people following him and said, “I tell you, this is the most faith I have seen anywhere, even in Israel.”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ ilan ngojit-e. Yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ nunaꞌ Iyoh, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Bisaya deꞌ sukup ayuh deꞌ kakuꞌ panglima itih aluaꞌ doiꞌ geh Kuꞌ tapod deꞌ ulang Israel!”

translation.en: Jesus said again, “What can I compare God’s kingdom with?
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sikien tuduꞌ-e, “Gulu, podo sit-e geh keh nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ koꞌih tih deꞌ yaꞌ obuah nyilamat?”

translation.en: Right then Jesus healed many people of their sicknesses and diseases. He healed those who had evil spirits and made many who were blind able to see again.
translation.bj: Pas takal inoh geh, Yesus odaꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e, duoh pibuu munua Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ ponai ningaꞌ.

translation.en: The people asked John, “What should we do?”
translation.bj: Ogiꞌ geh sidadu sikien tuduꞌ Yohanes, “Oniwat koꞌih neh? Oni deꞌ halus koꞌih nai?” Yohanes moꞌ in-e, “Maꞌ yaꞌ mitiaꞌ kai paksa duoh ngegap saꞌ nyaꞌa ngin duit duꞌ ingan duoh napo nyaꞌa nang nai kiloja diꞌ bonal, pak-e sukupleh duoh pah ingan.”

translation.en: Then the king said to the men who were watching, ‘Take the bag of money away from this servant and give it to the servant who earned ten bags of money.’
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh laja inoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mujuag sinok-e, ‘Mit niꞌ kiping duit maskuꞌ soꞌ kuli deꞌ jaꞌat inoh, nyeꞌ moꞌ ngin tuduꞌ kuli deꞌ soꞌon simoong kiping inoh.’

translation.en: Other seed fell on rock. It began to grow but then died because it had no water.
translation.bj: Ogiꞌ geh deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ tanaꞌ bibatuh-batuh. Takal tuang-e yaꞌ tumuꞌ, yomoꞌ layuꞌ sobab tanaꞌ-e bodoh.

translation.en: So Herod added another bad thing to all his other wrongs: He put John in jail.
translation.bj: onak Matat, onak Lewi, onak Malkhi, onak Yanai, onak Yusuf,

translation.en: So I give you authority to rule with me in the kingdom the Father has given me.
translation.bj: Sobab inohleh Okuꞌ yaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ ingan hak kaꞌan militah keꞌ tun suaꞌ nyaꞌa, kodaꞌ SamaꞌKuꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Okuꞌ hak kaꞌan militah.
Duoh tanon nang moꞌ nog onu-e Topaꞌ nai oni deꞌ paguh kaꞌan umat-e.”

translation.en: Then Jesus said, “The Son of Man must suffer many things. He will be rejected by the older Jewish leaders, the leading priests, and teachers of the law. And he will be killed. But after three days he will be raised from death.”
translation.bj: Sobab osi deꞌ nyayang idip-e sonang deꞌ dunia itih, iyoh idoh diꞌ-e idip sitelus-e. Pak-e osi deꞌ togan idip sonang-e deꞌ dunia itih nog-e kobos ngan-e nunaꞌ Okuꞌ, iyoh yaꞌ idip sitelus-e.

translation.en: Jesus answered, “I will ask you a question too. Tell me:
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ tuong ogiꞌ geh oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ sikien Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, suba tanon tuduꞌ Okuꞌ:

translation.en: Listen! You will become pregnant and have a baby boy. You will name him Jesus.
translation.bj: Ngojit nyeꞌ! Muꞌu totap yaꞌ bitiiaꞌ, mokuaꞌ inoh milaꞌ onak dali deꞌ halus muꞌ biladon Yesus.

translation.en: So Jesus went with them. He was coming near the officer’s house when the officer sent friends to say, “Lord, you don’t need to do anything special for me. I am not good enough for you to come into my house.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus odi bisamah-samah duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ. Takal Yesus moꞌ sinok-e yaꞌ nog boli panglima inoh, panglima inoh odaꞌ dingan-dingan-e odi tanon deꞌ Yesus, “Dusah nak lolah posah odi keꞌ bolikuꞌ. Okuꞌ diꞌ patut tlimaꞌ Ingan deꞌ boli okuꞌ.

translation.en: But the people learned where Jesus went and followed him. He welcomed them and talked with them about God’s kingdom. He healed the people who were sick.
translation.bj: Pak-e nyaꞌa bogoꞌ puꞌan topat soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi, nyaꞌa bogoꞌ inoh moꞌ nusud Yesus. Takal nyaꞌa bogoꞌ nog Iyoh moꞌ tilimaꞌ-e sijaꞌ. Iyoh moꞌ silita oniwat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja; duoh nai odaꞌ nyaꞌa monam mokuaꞌ.

translation.en: People will not say, ‘Look, God’s kingdom is here!’ or ‘There it is!’ No, God’s kingdom is here with you.”
translation.bj: Jadi doiꞌ guna-e, nyaꞌa nang, ‘Jaꞌ otoꞌ odi ningaꞌ-e, itih odop-e atou ningaꞌ nih odop-e!’ Sobab Topaꞌ moh moꞌ militah jadin laja deꞌ uluk ingan deꞌ dunia itih.”

translation.en: Even the soldiers laughed at Jesus and made fun of him. They came and offered him some sour wine.
translation.bj: Sidadu-sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ ngatiaꞌ ngine Yesus. Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nog ngin angul deꞌ masuam tuduꞌ-E

translation.en: Then he said, “Jesus, remember me when you begin ruling as king!”
translation.bj: Yoh moꞌ nyamung sina-e, “Yesus, natongleh okuꞌ, takal Ingan nog jadin Laja!”

translation.en: Her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord was very good to her, and they were happy for her.
translation.bj: Madih ayua-e baya dingan-e moꞌ suwaꞌ sonang kila-e, takal-e moh klingah gah Topaꞌ sukup paguh otin tuduꞌ Elisabet.

translation.en: Jesus went back to Galilee with the power of the Spirit. Stories about him spread all over the area around Galilee.
translation.bj: Inohleh ngan Yesus in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Totap ingan yaꞌ nguyat Okuꞌ nang, ‘Doktol, odaꞌleh odop Ingan mokuaꞌ! Naileh datiꞌ geh deꞌ topat soꞌ muꞌ obuah milaꞌ, kodaꞌ suaꞌ deꞌ ngojit koꞌih deꞌ nai Ingan deꞌ Kapernaum!’ ”

translation.en: Jesus said to them, “I know you will tell me the old saying: ‘Doctor, heal yourself.’ You want to say, ‘We heard about the things you did in Capernaum. Do those same things here in your own hometown!’”
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ Gah oni deꞌ nai Yesus katiꞌ-kanih nyaꞌa ngojit-e deꞌ suaꞌ topat deꞌ sinok-sinok inoh. Yesus odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam

translation.en: In that same town there was a woman whose husband had died. She came many times to this judge and said, ‘There is a man who is doing bad things to me. Give me my rights!’
translation.bj: Deꞌ kota inoh ogiꞌ geh niꞌ naꞌan jana deꞌ odi telus tuduꞌ hakim noh yomoꞌ in neh, ‘Suba tulungleh nuwaꞌ okuꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ pilugi okuꞌ inoh.’

translation.en: The followers asked Jesus, “Where will this be, Lord?”Jesus answered, “It’s like looking for a dead body—you will find it where the vultures are gathering above.”
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus sikien tuduꞌ-E, “Daki soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ jadi neh Gulu?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Daki soꞌ ogiꞌ todang, danoꞌ soꞌ ogiꞌ manuk deꞌ man todang.”

translation.en: When Jesus said this, all those who were criticizing him felt ashamed of themselves. And all the people were happy for the wonderful things he was doing.
translation.bj: Niꞌ sidoh lagiꞌ Yesus sikien in-e, “Oniwat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja? Yomoꞌ samah kodaꞌ oni, Okuꞌ yaꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan?

translation.en: “Then he said, ‘I know what I will do. I will tear down my barns and build bigger barns! I will put all my wheat and good things together in my new barns.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ in-e, ‘Itih deꞌ yaꞌ nai kuꞌ neh, okuꞌ yaꞌ pilubuh basal-basalkuꞌ mokuaꞌ inoh okuꞌ yaꞌ nai lobih ayuh soꞌ kuꞌ yaꞌ nyikon gandum duoh balang-balangkuꞌ.

translation.en: “Don’t fear, little flock. Your Father wants to share his kingdom with you.
translation.bj: “Maꞌ tolu ingan uluk deꞌ isit, sobab Samaꞌ ingan iyohleh Laja deꞌ sonang blokat ingan.

translation.en: You saw these things happen—you are witnesses. You must go and tell people that they must change and turn to God, which will bring them his forgiveness. You must start from Jerusalem and tell this message in my name to the people of all nations.
translation.bj: Inganleh saksi soꞌ suaꞌ-e itih.

translation.en: They were not. But I tell you if you don’t decide now to change your lives, you will all be destroyed too!”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan itih, “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ tongon koyuh deꞌ biasa-e bibuaꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ puluah-a deꞌ kobon angul-e, niꞌ onu takal-e odi kalik buaꞌ-e, niꞌ buaꞌ doiꞌ geh yoh soꞌon-e.

translation.en: I tell you, maybe friendship is not enough to make him get up to give you the bread. But he will surely get up to give you what you need if you continue to ask.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyamung sina in-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Sajaꞌ ingan inoh dingan-e, iyoh diꞌ-e laꞌan mokat duoh ngin oniꞌ tuduꞌ ingan. Pak-e sobab ingan inoh diꞌ ngan puꞌan dasaꞌ kaꞌan mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ-e telus, yoh moꞌ mokat geh duoh ngin oni deꞌ plelu ingan.

translation.en: Even the tax collectors came to John. They wanted to be baptized. They said to him, “Teacher, what should we do?”
translation.bj: Inohleh sobab-e Yohanes sina tuduꞌ suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, “Okuꞌ baptis ingan pakai piꞌin, pak-e ogiꞌ lagiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nog deꞌ lobih ayuh soꞌ okuꞌ. Bukaꞌ tolin kasut-E sijaꞌ-e diꞌ kuꞌ layak. Yoh yaꞌ baptis ingan pakai Iyang Topaꞌ duoh opui.

translation.en: Great blessings are yours because you believed what the Lord said to you! You believed this would happen.”
translation.bj: Doonleh muꞌu Maria, sobab muꞌu bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Topaꞌ inoh tok yaꞌ jadi.” Maria bisukul

translation.en: The next morning, the older leaders of the people, the leading priests, and the teachers of the law came together. They led Jesus away to their high council.
translation.bj: Pak-e soꞌ adin, Onak Manusia yaꞌ guluꞌ nuwaꞌ toꞌuh sinok Topaꞌ deꞌ Paling Bikuasa-E.”

translation.en: When Jesus came near the town gate, he saw some people carrying a dead body. It was the only son of a woman who was a widow. Walking with her were many other people from the town.
translation.bj: Takal Yesus moꞌ nog sinok tiban gerbang kota, nyaꞌa katod todang deꞌ sopaꞌ kota. Deꞌ kobos inoh onak dali, onak tomoꞌ sinoꞌ jana, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kota inoh nunaꞌ sinoꞌ nyaꞌa noh.

translation.en: “Praise God in heaven,and on earth let there be peace to the people who please him.”
translation.bj: “Mudileh Topaꞌ deꞌ topat deꞌ paling bigatung! Baya deꞌ tun tanaꞌ, sonangleh idip manusia deꞌ nyonang otin Topaꞌ!”

translation.en: Jesus said, “But here on this table is the hand of the one who will hand me over to my enemies.
translation.bj: Pak-e maꞌ ingan gogoh takal Kuꞌ nang nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin Okuꞌ deꞌ musohKuꞌ ogiꞌ datiꞌ,

translation.en: In that life people are like angels and cannot die. They are children of God, because they have been raised from death.
translation.bj: sobab idoh diꞌ-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos deꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ idip deꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ, sobab kaꞌan Topaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ suaꞌ-e idip.”

translation.en: Jesus left the city and went to the Mount of Olives. His followers went with him. (He went there often.) He said to his followers, “Pray for strength against temptation.”
translation.bj: in-e, “Samaꞌ daang sulga nyam ponai maꞌleh odaꞌ Okuꞌ obuah susah jolaꞌ itih. Pak-e maꞌleh nunaꞌ oni deꞌ laꞌan okuꞌ pak-e jadileh kodaꞌ oni deꞌ laꞌan Ingan.”

translation.en: The Day of Unleavened Bread came. This was the day when the Jews always killed the lambs for the Passover.
translation.bj: Takal onu keꞌ niꞌ Paskah moꞌ nog suaꞌ nyaꞌa moꞌ halus simoliah domba Paskah.

translation.en: You are foolish! The same one who made what is outside also made what is inside.
translation.bj: Ingan budua! Topaꞌ deꞌ nai nuwaꞌ sopaꞌ-e baya nai nuwaꞌ aang-e!

translation.en: The ax is now ready to cut down the trees. Every tree that does not produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.”
translation.bj: Yohanes moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Maꞌ ingan nagih sikia bogoꞌ soꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah notap plitah.”

translation.en: The Lord answered, “You people are hypocrites! All of you untie your work animals and lead them to drink water every day—even on the Sabbath day.
translation.bj: Pingunang Yesus inoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e suka daꞌ-E jadi dasaꞌ, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon sonang ningaꞌ oni deꞌ nai Yesus maꞌ mun konaꞌ-e. Perumpamaan luang deꞌ alus

translation.en: Tell the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher asks that you please show us the room where he and his followers can eat the Passover meal.’
translation.bj: nyeꞌ moꞌ sikien tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli daki soꞌ topat kaꞌan Gulu duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e yaꞌ man Paskah.

translation.en: “Any man who divorces his wife and marries another woman is guilty of adultery. And the man who marries a divorced woman is also guilty of adultery.”
translation.bj: Lazarus moꞌ kobos, mokuaꞌ inoh malaikat toban tuduꞌ Abrahama deꞌ topat deꞌ paling paguh. Sidagal inoh tuang kobos geh yomoꞌ obuah ngubul.

translation.en: He said to them, “Then give to Caesar what belongs to Caesar, and give to God what belongs to God.”
translation.bj: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Saduki odi tuduꞌ Yesus. (Uluk ulang Saduki iyohleh nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ nang nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos idoh tiaꞌ diꞌ-e ponai paliꞌ idip.) Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikien tuduꞌ Yesus,
Dayung inoh moꞌ odi sinok Yesus soꞌ dug-e, mokuaꞌ noh yoh moꞌ makaꞌ jubah-e. Takal inoh geh onam bubuꞌ dayung noh moꞌ lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ.

translation.en: The people stood there watching everything. The Jewish leaders laughed at Jesus. They said, “If he is God’s Chosen One, the Messiah, then let him save himself. He saved others, didn’t he?”
translation.bj: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jadin danoꞌ. Pak-e ayua pimipin agama Yahudi sina ngine Yesus in-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon Yoh nyilamat-e: tanah saꞌ-e nyilamat odop-e, nyam yoh inoh tok Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ.”

translation.en: Jesus traveled to Nazareth, the town where he grew up. On the Sabbath day he went to the synagogue as he always did. He stood up to read.
translation.bj: Pak-e ngojitleh joman nabi Elia, takal logaꞌ taluh sowaꞌ nuam bulan, deꞌ suaꞌ negli doiꞌ pinguman nyaꞌa obuaꞌ pilai miliap. Takal inoh bogoꞌ jana-jana deꞌ Israel.

translation.en: So he called the manager in and said to him, ‘I have heard bad things about you. Give me a report of what you have done with my money. You can’t be my manager anymore.’
translation.bj: Yoh moꞌ mogan nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ-e daꞌ-e inoh, yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, ‘Okuꞌ moh ngojit silita oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ nai muꞌu sobab inoh muꞌu yaꞌ obuah piloꞌo soꞌ kilojamuꞌ, pak-e muꞌu halus lapol suaꞌ haltakuꞌ deꞌ ngulus muꞌ.’

translation.en: “How bad it is when everyone says nothing but good about you. Just look at the false prophets. Their ancestors always said good things about them.
translation.bj: Binasaleh ingan deꞌ obuah mudi suaꞌ nyaꞌa sobab watinoh geh sumuk babai odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mudi nabi-nabi palsu joman nouh-e.” Nyayangleh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui deꞌ ingan

translation.en: David went into God’s house. He took the bread that was offered to God and ate it. And he gave some of the bread to the people with him. This was against the Law of Moses, which says that only the priests can eat that bread.”
translation.bj: Yoh molot kaang Boli Topaꞌ, yoh moꞌ mit pinguman deꞌ moꞌ ngin nyaꞌa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ yoh moꞌ man-e. Mokuaꞌ noh yoh moꞌ ngin geh pinguman inoh tuduꞌ ayua deꞌ nunaꞌ odop-e odaꞌ man-e, nak-e diꞌ-e puꞌan nang ukum daang agama otoꞌ pimipin agama Yahudi sijaꞌ-a deꞌ soꞌon man pinguman inoh.”

translation.en: “Amazing things will happen to the sun, moon, and stars. And people all over the earth will be upset and confused by the noise of the sea and its crashing waves.
translation.bj: “Tiaꞌ sodiꞌ ogiꞌ tanda deꞌ saluh-saluh wat-e yaꞌ tonga deꞌ boton onu, bitang duoh bulan. Suaꞌ nyaꞌa daang dunia yaꞌ tolu duoh ilan ngojit doong duoh gilumang laut deꞌ dolas

translation.en: “But I say to you people who are listening to me, love your enemies. Do good to those who hate you.
translation.bj: “Pak-e tuduꞌ ingan deꞌ ngojit Okuꞌ adin Okuꞌ ngin sibaya itih: Nyayangleh nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui deꞌ ingan, naileh oniꞌ deꞌ paguh tuduꞌ-e.

translation.en: But he walked through the middle of the crowd and went away.
translation.bj: Sobab inoh Yesus tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh deꞌ daang boli topat simayang deꞌ suaꞌ kota deꞌ Yudea.

translation.en: Eli was the son of Matthat.Matthat was the son of Levi.Levi was the son of Melchi.Melchi was the son of Jannai.Jannai was the son of Joseph.
translation.bj: onak Yesua, onak Eliezer, onak Yorim, onak Matat, onak Lewi,

translation.en: Next, a Levite came near. He saw the hurt man, but he went around him. He would not stop to help him either. He just walked away.
translation.bj: Yoh moꞌ odi sinok nyaꞌa noh, yoh moꞌ lap kinaman-e kai angul,f mokuaꞌ noh yoh moꞌ buwah inyuaꞌg deꞌ kinaman-e, ke yoh moꞌ molut kinaman-kinaman-e. Yoh moꞌ tunuk paꞌad keꞌ tun keledai-e yoh moꞌ toban keꞌ boli topat nyaꞌa ngilumon, yoh moꞌ bina-e.

translation.en: The man he had healed begged to go with him. But Jesus sent him away, saying,
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ nog niꞌ naꞌan pimipin boli topat simayang deꞌ adon-e Yairus. Iyoh bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus duoh mitiaꞌ saꞌ Yesus odi keꞌ boli-e,

translation.en: The people in Judea at that time should run away to the mountains. The people in Jerusalem must leave quickly. If you are near the city, don’t go in!
translation.bj: Takal inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ propinsi Yudea totap lasuꞌ bikoduh buꞌu keꞌ dolod. Nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kota halus buꞌu luah soꞌ kota, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kupuaꞌ maꞌ molot daang kota.

translation.en: The Holy Spirit will teach you at that time what you should say.”
translation.bj: Sobab takal inoh Iyang Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngajal ingan oni in oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nang ingan.” Sidagal deꞌ budua

translation.en: I tell you, when this man finished his prayer and went home, he was right with God. But the Pharisee, who felt that he was better than others, was not right with God. People who make themselves important will be made humble. But those who make themselves humble will be made important.”
translation.bj: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Takal pinagih suke itih paliꞌ keꞌ boli-e yohleh deꞌ obuah tlimaꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ nak-e ulang Farisi inoh. Sobab nyaꞌa deꞌ lika kakat odop-e yoh obuah pimuun pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ pimuun odop-e yoh obuah pakat daꞌ bigatung.” Yesus bilokat onak opot
Jadi odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-e, “Jadi oni mei deꞌ halus koꞌih nai neh?”

translation.en: He has given us a powerful Saviorfrom the family of his servant David.
translation.bj: Iyoh moh ngin pinyilamat deꞌ bikuasa tuduꞌ otoꞌ soꞌ onak-sukun laja Daud, kuli-E.

translation.en: The men were amazed at his wise answer. They could say nothing. They were not able to trick Jesus there in front of the people. He said nothing they could use against him.
translation.bj: “Gulu, Musa nulis plitah saꞌan otoꞌ in tih in-e neh, ‘Moꞌ nyam ogiꞌ sowon nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos bonon-e yoh moꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ onak-e, madih soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos inoh halus mit dayung inoh jadin sowon-e saꞌ-e ogiꞌ onak-sukun soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos inoh ti-e.’

translation.en: Some people are like the seed that fell beside the path. They hear God’s teaching, but then the devil comes and causes them to stop thinking about it. This keeps them from believing it and being saved.
translation.bj: Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ tanaꞌ deꞌ paguh inoh kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ, yoh moꞌ nyikon daang otin-e deꞌ sukup paguh nog bibuaꞌ.” Perumpamaan lapu kadis

translation.en: Then the two men told what had happened on the road. They talked about how they recognized Jesus when he shared the bread with them.
translation.bj: Soꞌ duwoh pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ tuang-e nog noh moꞌ lasuꞌ silita oni deꞌ jadi deꞌ odop-e daang olan-e takal yaꞌ odi keꞌ kota Emaus duoh watki wat-e paliꞌ piluh Yesus, takal Yesus piliaꞌ kueh. Yesus bitanga odop-e tuduꞌ ke simoong niꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E

translation.en: “What about the seed that fell among the thorny weeds? That is like the people who hear God’s teaching, but they let the worries, riches, and pleasures of this life stop them from growing. So they never produce a crop.
translation.bj: Sobab suaꞌ-suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ obuah suan totap yaꞌ obuah tanon, duoh oni deꞌ diꞌ-e tonga adin yaꞌ obuah kilin.

translation.en: When John’s followers left, Jesus began talking to the people about John: “What did you people go out into the desert to see? Someone who is weak, like a stem of grass blowing in the wind?
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ noh pinunaꞌ Yohanes moꞌ buu, Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ in-e, “Nouh-e ingan odi keꞌ padang pasil idoh diꞌ-e kaꞌan ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sasou kila-e kodaꞌ duh deꞌ obuah yup sobak.

translation.en: Then Jesus said to the Pharisee who had invited him, “When you give a lunch or a dinner, don’t invite only your friends, brothers, relatives, and rich neighbors. At another time they will pay you back by inviting you to eat with them.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngunang Odop-E, “Simoꞌo muꞌu yaꞌ biluman, maꞌ muꞌ yaꞌ jok muꞌ ngunang dingan-dingan, sikiaꞌ sudiꞌ, madih ayuamuꞌ atou nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya deꞌ sinok bolimuꞌ, sobab nyam odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ biluman odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dapod paliꞌ ngunang muꞌu.

translation.en: The angel answered him, “I am Gabriel, the one who always stands ready before God. He sent me to talk to you and to tell you this good news.
translation.bj: Malaikat inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ itih Gabriel. Okuꞌ itih utusan Topaꞌ kaꞌan tanon gah deꞌ paguh itih tuduꞌ muꞌu.

translation.en: The fishermen put their nets into the water. Their nets were filled with so many fish that they began to break.
translation.bj: Jadi odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nai oni deꞌ nang Yesus yomoꞌ bogoꞌ ikian deꞌ obuah jala-e nog jala-e yaꞌ totak.

translation.en: Jesus said to them, “But now if you have money or a bag, carry that with you. If you don’t have a sword, sell your coat and buy one.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ: “Pak-e adin osi deꞌ ogiꞌ lopet duoh beg halus yoh toban-e, duoh osi deꞌ doiꞌ podang-e yoh halus jua jubah-e kai-e milih podang.

translation.en: Give to others, and you will receive. You will be given much. It will be poured into your hands—more than you can hold. You will be given so much that it will spill into your lap. The way you give to others is the way God will give to you.”
translation.bj: Ngin oniꞌ deꞌ plelu nyaꞌa saꞌ Topaꞌ ngin geh tuduꞌ ingan, Topaꞌ ngin deꞌ sukup-sukup bogoꞌ-e, obuaꞌ punuaꞌ mipil deꞌ moꞌ obuah nginyon kaꞌan muꞌu sobab oni kiang muꞌ ngin tuduꞌ nyaꞌa, kiang inoh geh Topaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ muꞌu.”

translation.en: Don’t carry any money, a bag, or sandals. Don’t stop to talk with people on the road.
translation.bj: Nyam basa ingan molot keꞌ boli nyaꞌa sobotleh dioꞌ, ‘Topaꞌ bilokat ingan daang boli itih.’

translation.en: You and I are guilty. We deserve to die because we did wrong. But this man has done nothing wrong.”
translation.bj: Otoꞌ duwoh tih deꞌ patut obuah ngukum odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai toꞌ, pak-e Yoh diꞌ-e patut obuah ukum sobab Yoh doiꞌ salah-E.”

translation.en: David was the son of Jesse.Jesse was the son of Obed.Obed was the son of Boaz.Boaz was the son of Salmon.Salmon was the son of Nahshon.
translation.bj: onak Metusalah, onak Henokh, onak Yared, onak Mahalaleel, onak Kenan,

translation.en: The first servant came and said, ‘Sir, I earned ten bags of money with the one bag you gave me.’
translation.bj: Kuli-e deꞌ ke niꞌ-e moꞌ in-e, ‘Laja niꞌ kiping duit mas deꞌ ngin ingan tuduꞌ okuꞌ inoh moh moꞌ bitamah jadin simoong kiping.’

translation.en: Jesus is not here. He has risen from death. Do you remember what he said in Galilee?
translation.bj: Yesus doiꞌ datiꞌ. Iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ idip! Natong ingan kedoh oni deꞌ moꞌ tanon-e deꞌ ingan takal-e aluaꞌ deꞌ Galilea?

translation.en: Then the apostles asked each other, “Which one of us would do that?”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ sikien sitipan odop-e osi nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nai hal inoh. Bikalah tentang osi deꞌ penting
Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e in-e, “Daang Kitab deꞌ moꞌ nulis Musa, ‘Maꞌ yaꞌ suba Topaꞌmuꞌ!’”

translation.en: Jesus’ followers began to have an argument about which one of them was the greatest.
translation.bj: Yohanes moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Gulu, koꞌih ningaꞌ nyaꞌa kasig munua pakai adon Ingan, yomoꞌ koꞌih moꞌ jaman-e, sobab iyoh diꞌ-e nuwaꞌ otoꞌ.”

translation.en: “Praise to the Lord God of Israel.He has come to help his peopleand has given them freedom.
translation.bj: Iyoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Jaꞌ otoꞌ mudi Topaꞌ, Topaꞌ bangsa Israel! Sobab Iyoh moꞌ nog tulung duoh pilopas umat-E.

translation.en: The leading priests and teachers of the law were standing there shouting things against Jesus.
translation.bj: Takal inoh geh pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi masam-masam in-e napo Yesus.

translation.en: The soldiers asked him, “What about us? What should we do?”He said to them, “Don’t use force or lies to make people give you money. Be happy with the pay you get.”
translation.bj: Watinoh geh Yohanes ngin bogoꞌ buaꞌ ajal deꞌ bokon takal yoh tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ.

translation.en: The Holy Spirit told him that he would not die before he saw the Messiah from the Lord.
translation.bj: Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ Simeon, nang Simeon diꞌ-e dioꞌ kobos ngan-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e ningaꞌ Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ.

translation.en: Mary said, “I am the Lord’s servant. Let this thing you have said happen to me!” Then the angel went away.
translation.bj: Maria moꞌ sina in-e, “Okuꞌ itih kuli Topaꞌ tanahleh saꞌ-e jadi tuduꞌ okuꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ nang ingan noh.” Mokuaꞌ noh malaikat moꞌ buu togan Maria. Maria duoh Elisabet

translation.en: “Don’t forget what I will tell you now: The Son of Man will soon be handed over to the control of other men.”
translation.bj: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ puꞌan pikil odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, sobab inohleh Iyoh moꞌ mit onak opot gan deꞌ sinok odop-E.

translation.en: The crowd grew larger and larger. Jesus said, “The people who live today are evil. They ask for a miracle as a sign from God. But no miracle will be done to prove anything to them. The only sign will be the miracle that happened to Jonah.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa bogoꞌ bitodod-todod sinok Yesus, Iyoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Ingan nyaꞌa deꞌ idip joman itih iyohleh nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat. Ingan mitiaꞌ niꞌ keajaiban soꞌ Topaꞌ saꞌ ingan dapod bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, pak-e ingan diꞌ-e kan obuah ngin keajaiban inoh, jok-e mukjizat soꞌ Topaꞌ tuduꞌ nabi Yunus b sijaꞌ-a.

translation.en: “Why do you notice the small piece of dust that is in your friend’s eye, but you don’t see the big piece of wood that is in your own eye?
translation.bj: Oni ingan ponai ningaꞌ lonas daang boton madih ingan pak-e botang koyuh daang boton odop ingan diꞌ ingan ngoon-e?

translation.en: Just then the men were allowed to recognize him. But when they saw who he was, he disappeared.
translation.bj: Takal inoh nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngoon-e nang inoh Yesus, pak-e Yesus moꞌ musuap soꞌ jowin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: Then they left to prepare some sweet-smelling spices to put on the body.On the Sabbath day they rested, as commanded in the Law of Moses.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh dayung-dayung deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem kaꞌan-e nyidia inyuaꞌ lona kaꞌan nginyuaꞌ todang Yesus. Daang Onu Sabat, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ loꞌo soꞌ kiloja-e saꞌan-e taat tuduꞌ ukum agama-e.

translation.en: When the Pharisee who asked Jesus to come to his house saw this, he thought to himself, “If this man were a prophet, he would know that the woman who is touching him is a sinner!”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan itih, “Ogiꞌ duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bilutang tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin nyam duit-e. Nyaꞌa deꞌ niꞌ tang-e limoh latus duit pilak, nyaꞌa deꞌ nikan-e lagiꞌ tang-e limoh puluꞌ duit pilak.

translation.en: Stay in the peace-loving house. Eat and drink what the people there give you. A worker should be given his pay. Don’t leave that house to stay in another house.
translation.bj: Moꞌ nyam ingan molot daang kupuaꞌ, duoh nyam nyaꞌa moꞌ tilimaꞌ ingan danoꞌ, man oni sijaꞌ-e pinguman deꞌ nguliaꞌ nyaꞌa tuduꞌ ingan.

translation.en: Jesus said, “Your answer is right. Do this and you will have eternal life.”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot pakai perumpamaan, “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dali soꞌ Yahudi ponu soꞌ kota Yerusalem muun keꞌ kota Yerikho. Daang pimonu-e yoh moꞌ obuah lapok, tolah kan-e suaꞌ-suaꞌ obuah mit, yoh moꞌ obuah pijolaꞌ geh, sape yoh nog obuaꞌ yaꞌ doiꞌ asong-e. Yoh moꞌ tanah-e polong-polong-e deꞌ pang olan.

translation.en: The next day Jesus and his followers went to a town called Nain. A big crowd was traveling with them.
translation.bj: Diꞌ-e tuwi soꞌ inoh, Yesus odi keꞌ kota Nain. Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E duoh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ odi bisamah-samah duoh-E.

translation.en: Then he said to the followers, “Whoever accepts a little child like this in my name is accepting me. And anyone who accepts me is also accepting the one who sent me. The one among you who is the most humble—this is the one who is great.”
translation.bj: Takal moꞌ yaꞌ sinok onu-e Yesus yaꞌ maꞌad keꞌ sulga, Yoh moꞌ daang otin-e totap yaꞌ ponu odi keꞌ Yerusalem.

translation.en: people who died when the tower of Siloam fell on them? Do you think they were more sinful than everyone else in Jerusalem?
translation.bj: Idoh! Kuꞌ tanon baꞌuh tuduꞌ ingan natong nyeꞌ suaꞌ ingan tuang kobos geh nyam suaꞌ ingan diꞌ ingan paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ.” Perumpamaan tongon koyuh deꞌ diꞌ-e bibuaꞌ doiꞌ guna-e

translation.en: Zechariah was serving as a priest before God for his group. It was his group’s time to serve.
translation.bj: Takal nog onu-e uluk Abia soꞌon tugas, watinoh geh Zakharia nai kiloja-e daang Boli Topaꞌ.

translation.en: The men brought their boats to the shore. They left everything and followed Jesus.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Simon duoh dingan-dingan-e nalik olud-e keꞌ bingon donu yomoꞌ togan suaꞌ kiloja-e, yomoꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus. Yesus odaꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah onam kulit mokuaꞌ

translation.en: Of course not! You would say to your servant, ‘Prepare something for me to eat. Then get ready and serve me. When I finish eating and drinking, then you can eat.’
translation.bj: Totu idoh! Totap ingan odaꞌ iyoh gati pimakai-e mokuaꞌ inoh ingan odaꞌ iyoh nai pinguman kaꞌan ingan duoh nguan ingan nog mokuaꞌ man, keꞌ ingan odaꞌ yoh man.

translation.en: I did this so that you can be sure that what you have been taught is true.
translation.bj: Saꞌ ingan puꞌan, oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ obuah tanon duoh deꞌ obuah ngajal suaꞌ-e inoh tok-tok bonal jadi. Malaikat tanon nang Yohanes Pembaptis obuah milaꞌ

translation.en: When Jesus saw that the man was sad, he said, “It will be very hard for rich people to enter God’s kingdom.
translation.bj: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ pimipin Yahudi inoh susah otin-e, Yesus moꞌ lasuꞌ in, “Lolah posah saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ biduit yaꞌ jadin ayua umat Topaꞌ!

translation.en: It will be bad for you, because you build tombs for the prophets. But these are the same prophets your ancestors killed!
translation.bj: Binasaleh ingan! Ingan nai kubul deꞌ paguh-paguh kaꞌan nabi-nabi, pak-e sumuk babai odop ingan geh deꞌ ngabos nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ noꞌuh-e.

translation.en: Jesus led his followers out of Jerusalem almost to Bethany. He raised his hands and blessed his followers.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus toban odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ keꞌ sopaꞌ kota Yerusalem keꞌ kupuaꞌ Betania. Danoꞌ iyoh moꞌ kakat tongan-e yomoꞌ bilokat odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: Jesus answered, “The Scriptures say,‘It is not just bread that keeps people alive.’” Deuteronomy
translation.bj: Muot moꞌ toban Yesus keꞌ topat deꞌ bigatung, mun oni deꞌ diep sijaꞌ Muot moꞌ bitanga suaꞌ daerah kerajaan deꞌ dunia.

translation.en: God can do anything!”
translation.bj: Sobab doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ Topaꞌ dapod nai-e.”

translation.en: Joseph was the son of Mattathias.Mattathias was the son of Amos.Amos was the son of Nahum.Nahum was the son of Esli.Esli was the son of Naggai.
translation.bj: onak Simeon, onak Yehuda, onak Yusuf, onak Yonam, onak Elyakim,

translation.en: She stood at Jesus’ feet, crying. Then she began to wash his feet with her tears. She dried his feet with her hair. She kissed his feet many times and rubbed them with the perfume.
translation.bj: Yesus sina duꞌ Simon, “Simon ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ tanonkuꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu!” “Iyoh Gulu, tanon sijaꞌ-a,” in Simon.

translation.en: And when she finds it, she will call her friends and neighbors and say to them, ‘Be happy with me because I have found the coin that I lost!’
translation.bj: Onak-e deꞌ sibusuꞌ moꞌ sina in-e, ‘Maꞌ, ngin duman halta tuduꞌ okuꞌ soꞌ halta deꞌ kakuꞌ ingan.’ Yomoꞌ samaꞌ-e inoh moꞌ kutung binuoh kaꞌan onak-e deꞌ duwoh inoh.

translation.en: There was a large crowd outside praying at the time the incense was offered.
translation.bj: Takal-e nyouh kinamai, nyaꞌa bogoꞌ bidoa deꞌ sopaꞌ.

translation.en: The priests always chose one priest to offer the incense, and Zechariah was the one chosen this time. So he went into the Temple of the Lord to offer the incense.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ takal-e nguni kodaꞌ deꞌ biasa pimipin agama Yahudi nai-e Zakharia deꞌ soꞌon, yoh deꞌ nyouh kinamai daang Boli Topaꞌ.

translation.en: When Jesus finished speaking, he said to Simon, “Take the boat into the deep water. If all of you will put your nets into the water, you will catch some fish.”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ ngajal Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Simon, “Bikayuhleh oludmuꞌ keꞌ topat deꞌ tuluap suba lagiꞌ ngijala ikian.”

translation.en: A father and son will be divided:The son will turn against his father.The father will turn against his son.A mother and her daughter will be divided:The daughter will turn against her mother.The mother will turn against her daughter.A mother-in-law and her daughter-in-law will be divided:The daughter-in-law will turn against her mother-in-law.The mother-in-law will turn against her daughter-in-law.”
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bikaꞌi-bikalah, samaꞌ bikaꞌi duoh onak-e deꞌ dali, yomoꞌ sinoꞌ bikaꞌi duoh onak deꞌ dayung, iban deꞌ dayung bikaꞌi duoh tua deꞌ dayung.” Sowaꞌ moꞌ bilubah

translation.en: They would say, ‘This man began to build, but he was not able to finish.’
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sina, ‘Adia nyaꞌa itih moꞌ kajuag pak-e diꞌ-e dapod pijadi-e.’

translation.en: No one was brave enough to ask him another question.
translation.bj: Sobab odop Daud deꞌ sina daang buk Mazmur nang, ‘Topaꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Tuankuꞌ: Guluꞌ leh deꞌ nuwaꞌ touh-Ku

translation.en: Whoever can be trusted with small things can also be trusted with big things. Whoever is dishonest in little things will be dishonest in big things too.
translation.bj: Ulang Farisi moꞌ ngojit suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus, yomoꞌ towoh-e, sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bakoꞌ duit.

translation.en: A man named Joseph was there from the Jewish town of Arimathea. He was a good man, who lived the way God wanted. He was waiting for God’s kingdom to come. Joseph was a member of the Jewish council. But he did not agree when the other Jewish leaders decided to kill Jesus.
translation.bj: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Yusuf deꞌ soꞌ kota Arimatea deꞌ propinsi Yudea, iyoh inoh nyaꞌa deꞌ paguh duoh deꞌ aluaꞌ kajon nog onu-e Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja deꞌ dunia. Iyoh inoh anggota daang Pengadilan Agama Yahudi, pak-e yoh diꞌ-e situju duoh oniꞌ deꞌ nai nyaꞌa munoꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.

translation.en: And now you show all people that you agree with what your ancestors did. They killed the prophets, and you build tombs for the prophets!
translation.bj: Ngan-e watinoh, odop ingan deꞌ ngakuꞌ nang ingan nyokong oni deꞌ nai sumuk babai ingan. Sobab sumuk babai ingan deꞌ ngabos nabi-nabi deꞌ munoꞌ nouh-e neh, duoh adin ingan nai kubul deꞌ paguh-paguh saꞌan kuab dosa sumuk babai ingan deꞌ nouh-e.

translation.en: Also, there is a big pit between you and us. No one can cross over to help you, and no one can come here from there.’
translation.bj: Pak-e sidagal inoh nyawot-e, ‘Inoh jaꞌa idoh diꞌ-e sukup neh, pak-e moꞌ nyam-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos paliꞌ idip baꞌuh duoh nog tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ keꞌ yoh laꞌan bitobat.’

translation.en: After he spent everything he had, there was a terrible famine throughout the country. He was hungry and needed money.
translation.bj: Iyoh moꞌ bigoꞌon tiaꞌ, yomoꞌ sina in-e, ‘Nyaꞌa deꞌ bikuli duoh samaꞌkuꞌ bitugung pinguman-e, pak-e okuꞌ datiꞌ yaꞌ miliap!’

translation.en: Who is more important: the one serving or the one sitting at the table being served? Everyone thinks it’s the one being served, right? But I have been with you as the one who serves.
translation.bj: Osi leh deꞌ lobih penting, nyaꞌa deꞌ guluꞌ man deꞌ mija keh nyaꞌa deꞌ layan inoh keh? Totu nyaꞌa deꞌ guluꞌ! Pak-e Okuꞌ ogiꞌ datiꞌ sinok ingan jadi pelayan.

translation.en: Some others there wanted to test Jesus. They asked him to do a miracle as a sign from God.
translation.bj: Ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ mitiaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus nai mukjizat podo Yoh inoh tok nog soꞌ Topaꞌ.

translation.en: They also looked bright and glorious. They were talking with Jesus about his death that would happen in Jerusalem.
translation.bj: Takal Musa duoh Elia yaꞌ buu togan Yesus, Petrus moꞌ sina in-e, “Gulu, paguh manah nyam-e ngan otoꞌ datiꞌ neh, koꞌih yaꞌ nai taluh galang. Niꞌ kaꞌan Ingan, niꞌ kaꞌan Musa, niꞌ kaꞌan Elia.” Pak-e Petrus diꞌ-e pikil dioꞌ oni deꞌ nang-e takal yoh sina.

translation.en: Then the Lord turned and looked into Peter’s eyes. And Peter remembered what the Lord had said, “Before the rooster crows in the morning, you will say three times that you don’t know me.”
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ nutu boton-e pakai kain yomoꞌ sikien tuduꞌ-E, “Suba tanon, puꞌan Muꞌ kedoh keh nyaꞌa deꞌ mupuꞌ mosut Muꞌu?”

translation.en: Everything that is hidden will be shown, and everything that is secret will be made known.
translation.bj: Oni deꞌ obuah nutu adin yaꞌ tibukaꞌ, duoh oniꞌ deꞌ obuah suan totap nyaꞌa yaꞌ puꞌan.

translation.en: When Jesus went back to Galilee, the people welcomed him. Everyone was waiting for him.
translation.bj: Deꞌ uluk odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dayung deꞌ moꞌ simoong duwoh sowaꞌ obuah onam bubuꞌ. Yoh moꞌ kabuaꞌ susuaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ odop-e kaꞌan bilubat tuduꞌ doktol, pak-e doiꞌ deꞌ dapod odaꞌ mokuaꞌ.

translation.en: Jesus answered, “Do you think this happened to those people because they were more sinful than all other people from Galilee?
translation.bj: Ngojit gah inoh, Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ, “Ngan ulang Galilea obuah ngabos watinoh, podo ingan moꞌ pikil odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ lobih bidosa soꞌ nyaꞌa Galilea deꞌ bokon?

translation.en: “A good tree does not produce bad fruit. And a bad tree does not produce good fruit.
translation.bj: “Tongon jojak deꞌ paguh idoh diꞌ-e bibuaꞌ buaꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat. Watnoh geh tongon jojak deꞌ jaꞌat diꞌ-e bibuaꞌ buaꞌ deꞌ paguh.

translation.en: “But the man was made king. When he came home, he said, ‘Call those servants who have my money. I want to know how much more money they earned with it.’
translation.bj: Pak-e iyoh totap obuah pakat jadin laja. Mokuaꞌ inoh iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ negli-e. Iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ mogan kuli-e deꞌ simoong inoh ngan-e yaꞌ puꞌan utung soꞌ duit deꞌ moꞌ ngin-e tuduꞌ kuli-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

translation.en: Then I can say to myself, I have many good things stored. I have saved enough for many years. Rest, eat, drink, and enjoy life!’
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh okuꞌ sina tuduꞌ odopkuꞌ: Utung manah okuꞌ bogoꞌ balang, bitugung-tugung kaꞌan bisowaꞌ-sowaꞌ. Jadi okuꞌ loꞌo tiaꞌ, man, nuak duoh bisonang-sonang sijaꞌ-e.’

translation.en: He sent some men ahead of him. They went into a town in Samaria to make everything ready for him.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ kumiat, Yoh moꞌ ngalah pinunaꞌ-E inoh.

translation.en: So the Jewish leaders waited for the right time to get Jesus. They sent some men to him, who pretended to be sincere. They wanted to find something wrong with what Jesus said. (If they found something wrong, then they could hand him over to the governor, who had the authority to arrest him.)
translation.bj: Jadi, suba Ingan tanon tuduꞌ koꞌih, podo daang agama otoꞌ soꞌon kedoh keh otoꞌ bayal suke tuduꞌ Kaisar?”

translation.en: The next day, the Samaritan took out two silver coins and gave them to the man who worked at the inn. He said, ‘Take care of this hurt man. If you spend more money on him, I will pay it back to you when I come again.’”
translation.bj: Gulu agama Yahudi inoh moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ masiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah lapok noh tiꞌ-e leh.” Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Bonal, odileh nai kodaꞌ watinoh geh!” Maria duoh Marta

translation.en: So he said, “A very important man was preparing to go to a country far away to be made a king. Then he planned to return home and rule his people.
translation.bj: “Ogiꞌ onak-sukun laja deꞌ odi keꞌ pulow deꞌ juaꞌ saꞌ-e obuah pakat jadi laja deꞌ pulow-e odop-e. Mokuaꞌ tilimaꞌ pakat-e inoh ke iyoh paliꞌ.

translation.en: The people laughed at him, because they knew that the girl was dead.
translation.bj: Pingoma onak opot noh moꞌ ilan-e. Pak-e Yesus jaman odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.

translation.en: One of the Pharisees asked Jesus to eat with him. Jesus went into the Pharisee’s house and took a place at the table.
translation.bj: Yoh mujuag deꞌ punuaꞌ Yesus sinok poꞌon-E, daang-e siꞌian deꞌ poꞌon Yesus bisaꞌ sijaꞌ-a odaꞌ piꞌin boton-e. Mokuaꞌ noh yoh ngisuꞌ poꞌon Yesus pakai buak-e yomoꞌ sium-e, yoh moꞌ duwan inyuaꞌ lona inoh daꞌ-e.

Jadi bitanga leh pakai pingunai pingidipmuꞌ deꞌ paguh, saꞌ-e jadi bukti muꞌu moꞌ bonal-bonal paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ! Maꞌ ingan bipikil nang ingan diꞌ-e obuah ukum sai Abraham sumuk babai ingan! Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, Topaꞌ ponai nai onak-sukun kaꞌan Abraham soꞌ batuh-batuh itih!

translation.en: Then Jesus told the people this story: “A man planted a vineyard. He leased the land to some farmers. Then he went away for a long time.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan In-e, “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ kobon angul-e iyoh moꞌ sewa kobon-e inoh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa, odop-e moꞌ odi loꞌo sukup tui-e keꞌ pulow deꞌ bokon.

translation.en: When Jesus began to teach, he was about
translation.bj: onak Yohanan, onak Resa, onak Zerubabel, onak Sealtiel, onak Neri,

translation.en: If this can happen to someone who is good, what will happen to those who are guilty?”
translation.bj: Sobab nyam adin nyaꞌa ponai nai wat itih tuduꞌ tongon koyuh deꞌ idip, nyaꞌa yaꞌ nai lobih lagiꞌ soꞌ itih tuduꞌ tongon koyuh deꞌ kobos.”

translation.en: Then the devil took Jesus and in a moment of time showed him all the kingdoms of the world.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e in-e, “Daang Kitab moꞌ obuah nulis, ‘Jok-e Topaꞌ patut nyeꞌ nyomah-a, layanleh Yoh sijaꞌ-a.’”

translation.en: Then he took some bread and thanked God for it. He broke off some pieces, gave them to the apostles and said, “This bread is my body that I am giving for you. Eat this to remember me.”
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ mit kueh duoh bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, yomoꞌ nyipiek kueh inoh yomoꞌ kutung tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E duoh sina, “Itihleh gonanKuꞌ deꞌ ngin Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan. Naileh wat itih Saꞌ ingan natong Okuꞌ.”

translation.en: But Jesus said, “Someone touched me. I felt power go out from me.”
translation.bj: Ngan Yesus aluaꞌ sina, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa nog soꞌ boli Yairus. Yoh sina tuduꞌ Yairus, “Onak ingan moh moꞌ doiꞌ, maꞌ tiyaꞌ nyusah gulu.”

translation.en: During the day Jesus taught the people in the Temple area. At night he went out of the city and stayed all night on the Mount of Olives.
translation.bj: Bilang konu-e daang minggu inoh Yesus ngajal deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ, yomoꞌ onu ngalom-e iyoh odi ngilumon deꞌ punguꞌ Zaitun.

translation.en: He brought down rulers from their thronesand raised up the humble people.
translation.bj: Topaꞌ plabuk laja-laja deꞌ militah, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ hina, Iyoh kakat-e.

translation.en: A woman was there who had been bleeding for twelve years. She had spent all her money on doctors, but no doctor was able to heal her.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Pak-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tomaꞌ Okuꞌ. Okuꞌ puꞌan inoh, sobab ogiꞌ kuasa deꞌ luah soꞌ Okuꞌ.”

translation.en: Jesus and the apostles came down from the mountain. Jesus stood on a flat place. A large crowd of his followers was there. Also, there were many people from all around Judea, Jerusalem, and the seacoast cities of Tyre and Sidon.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ muun soꞌ punguꞌ inoh bibaya duoh ayua rasul-rasul, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ loꞌo mujuag deꞌ topat deꞌ lata. Danoꞌ bogoꞌ geh pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ bokon, bogoꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nog soꞌ kota Yerusalem, duoh bogoꞌ geh soꞌ topat deꞌ bokon, ogiꞌ deꞌ soꞌ propinsi Yudea, kota-kota Tirus, Sidon deꞌ bingon laut.

translation.en: years. Surely it is not wrong for her to be made free from her sickness on a Sabbath day!”
translation.bj: Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja samah kodaꞌ luang deꞌ alus deꞌ obuah mit odaꞌ niꞌ naꞌan yomoꞌ puluah deꞌ umoh-e, luang inoh tumuꞌ jadi tongon koyuh yomoꞌ manuk nai solin-e deꞌ sokap-sokap-e.” Perumpamaan ragi

translation.en: The younger son said to his father, ‘Give me now the part of your property that I am supposed to receive someday.’ So the father divided his wealth between his two sons.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ iyoh odi kiloja tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pulow inoh, nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ odaꞌ iyoh jaga oyuaꞌ deꞌ umoh-e.

translation.en: So the man sent another servant. They beat this servant too and showed no respect for him. They sent the servant away with nothing.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh, moꞌ pait lagiꞌ kuli-e deꞌ bokon, pak-e kuli inoh obuah pakung pijolaꞌ geh, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ manguk-nyupah-e yomoꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ boloh-boloh-e.

translation.en: The time came for Mary and Joseph to do the things the Law of Moses taught about being made pure. They brought Jesus to Jerusalem so that they could present him to the Lord.
translation.bj: Nog onu-e Yusuf duoh Maria nai upacara kibisige kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ milaꞌ kodaꞌ plitah Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa. Takal inoh geh Yusuf duoh Maria toban onak-E keꞌ Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem kaꞌan ngin tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

translation.en: And bring our best calf and kill it so that we can celebrate with plenty to eat.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ mogan niꞌ naꞌan kuli-e, yomoꞌ sikien tuduꞌ-e, ‘Oni deꞌ nai nyaꞌa deꞌ in inoh?’

translation.en: While the boy was coming, the demon threw the boy to the ground. The boy lost control of himself. But Jesus gave a strong command to the evil spirit. Then the boy was healed, and Jesus gave him back to his father.
translation.bj: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ngiloti oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus, sobab Topaꞌ sukan loti-e saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tolu geh sikien loti-e tuduꞌ Yesus. Osi pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ paling ayuh

translation.en: Jesus continued to say to all of them, “Any of you who want to be my follower must stop thinking about yourself and what you want. You must be willing to carry the cross that is given to you every day for following me.
translation.bj: Doiꞌ guna-e nyaꞌa kakuꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ daang dunia itih pak-e odop-e diꞌ-e idip sitelus-e duoh pilugi odop-e!

translation.en: It is written in the law of the Lord: “When a mother’s first baby is a boy, he shall be called ‘special for the Lord.’”
translation.bj: Sobab deꞌ daang plitah Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa in-e, “Tibilang onak pinuan nyaꞌa deꞌ dali halus nyeꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.”

translation.en: “Then the king said to him, ‘What a bad servant you are! I will use your own words to condemn you. You said that I am a hard man. You said that I even take money that I didn’t earn and gather food that I didn’t grow.
translation.bj: Laja inoh moꞌ in-e, ‘Muꞌu kuli deꞌ jaꞌat. Kuꞌ yaꞌ ngukum muꞌu samah kodaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang odopmuꞌ. Muꞌu moꞌ puꞌan okuꞌ kolas, deꞌ mit oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e kakuꞌ okuꞌ mokuaꞌ inoh ngutuam oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ puluah-e.

translation.en: When Jesus went out, the teachers of the law and the Pharisees began to give him much trouble. They tried to make him answer questions about many things.
translation.bj: Takal Yesus yaꞌ buu soꞌ topat inoh, gulu-gulu agama Yahudi duoh ulang Farisi inoh malah tuduꞌ Yesus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngasang Yesus saꞌ-e laꞌan sina bogoꞌ.

translation.en: What they have written agrees with what we learned from the people who saw those events from the beginning. They also served God by telling people his message.
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nulis silita inoh samah kodaꞌ oni deꞌ tanon nyaꞌa deꞌ tok-tok ogiꞌ kilin duoh magah oni deꞌ soꞌ sibungas-e oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ jadi.

translation.en: So you also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at a time when you don’t expect him!”
translation.bj: Sobab inoh muꞌu tuang siap sidia geh, sobab Okuꞌ Onak Manusia yaꞌ nog daang onu deꞌ diꞌ muꞌu sakaꞌ-a.” Kuli deꞌ setia duoh kuli deꞌ diꞌ-e setia

translation.en: The Son of Man will do what God has planned. But it will be very bad for the one who hands over the Son of Man to be killed.”
translation.bj: Onak Manusia totap yaꞌ kobos samah kodaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ notap Topaꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin Okuꞌ inoh, tok-tok yaꞌ obuah ngukum.”

translation.en: I will never eat another Passover meal until it is given its full meaning in God’s kingdom.”
translation.bj: Sobab inoh, Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tiaꞌ man itih lagiꞌ nog loti paskah itih jadi takal Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.”

translation.en: But Jesus called the little children to him and said to his followers, “Let the little children come to me. Don’t stop them, because God’s kingdom belongs to people who are like these little children.
translation.bj: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ mogan onak opot deꞌ munoꞌ yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Tanah saꞌ onak opot deꞌ munoꞌ odi tuduꞌ Okuꞌ! Maꞌ ingan yaꞌ jaman-e neh, sobab nyaꞌa deꞌ kodaꞌ onak opot deꞌ munoꞌ leh deꞌ yaꞌ jadin ayua umat Topaꞌ.

translation.en: Jesus answered, “It will be bad for you, you experts in the law! You make strict rules that are very hard for people to obey. You try to force others to obey your rules. But you yourselves don’t even try to follow any of those rules.
translation.bj: Yesus nyawot, “Binasa geh, ingan gulu-gulu agama Yahudi! Ingan gan pelatulan deꞌ lolah duoh baat, pak-e odop ingan sit doh geh laꞌan tulung nyaꞌa nai-e.

translation.en: Most Honorable Theophilus:Many others have tried to give a report of the things that happened among us to complete God’s plan.
translation.bj: Tuduꞌ ingan Teofilius, Nouh-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ suba nulis silita pingidip Yesus, nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi daang uluk otoꞌ.

translation.en: In the same way, when you see all these things happening, you will know that God’s kingdom is very near.
translation.bj: Watinoh geh moꞌ nyam ingan moꞌ kilin suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanonKuꞌ inoh ti-e jadi, ingan moꞌ puꞌan nang onu-e Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja moꞌ sinok.

translation.en: He answered, ‘I owe him
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Silatus bona inyuaꞌ zaitun.’ Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus duit inoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, ‘Itih sulat tang muꞌ, guluꞌ mei nulis limoh puluꞌ bona.’

translation.en: The blind man was excited and said, “Jesus, Son of David, please help me!”
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh moꞌ nang bogan-e in-e, “Yesus onak-sukun laja Daud masiꞌleh tuduꞌ okuꞌ!”

translation.en: before he died and left her alone. She was now
translation.bj: Iyoh onak Fanuel soꞌ suku Asyer. Moꞌ juꞌ sowaꞌ bonon-e doiꞌ, Hana jadin jana. Hana diꞌ-e buu soꞌ Boli Topaꞌ, pak-e bilang konu singonu singalom simayang, bidoa, baya puasa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

translation.en: Jesus was traveling to Jerusalem. He went from Galilee to Samaria.
translation.bj: Daang pimonu-e keꞌ kota Yerusalem, Yesus ngilusuꞌ baꞌat propinsi Samaria duoh propinsi Galilea.

translation.en: (But the two men were not allowed to recognize Jesus.)
translation.bj: Soꞌ duwoh odop-e kilin Yesus pak-e ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ daꞌ odop-e duwoh inoh diꞌ-e piluh-e.

translation.en: But our leaders and the leading priests handed him over to be judged and killed. They nailed him to a cross.
translation.bj: Pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh pimipin bangsa toꞌ nyelah yoh saꞌ-e obuah ngukum ngabos, yomoꞌ nyalip-E.

translation.en: When the master comes and finds him doing the work he gave him, it will be a day of blessing for that servant!
translation.bj: Obuah bilokat kuli-e takal toke-e nog ningaꞌ kuli-e nai kiloja-e!

translation.en: John answered, “Master, we saw someone using your name to force demons out of people. We told him to stop because he does not belong to our group.”
translation.bj: Takal inoh Yesus moꞌ odaꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa ponu dioꞌ soꞌ Odop-E. Nyaꞌa munoꞌ moꞌ odi, yomoꞌ nog kupuaꞌ deꞌ daerah Samariag saꞌ-a nyidia suaꞌ oniꞌ kaꞌan Yesus.

translation.en: He said, “The Scriptures say, ‘My Temple will be a house of prayer.’ But you have changed it into a ‘hiding place for thieves.’”
translation.bj: pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan oniwat gaya-e, sobab nyaꞌa bogoꞌ sonang yaꞌ ngojit oni deꞌ nang Yesus.

translation.en: “Don’t judge others, and God will not judge you. Don’t condemn others, and you will not be condemned. Forgive others, and you will be forgiven.
translation.bj: “Maꞌ sibalang nyalah nyaꞌa saꞌ odop ingan diꞌ ngan obuah nyalah odaꞌ Topaꞌ. Maꞌ lika ngukum nyaꞌa, saꞌ Topaꞌ diꞌ-e ngukum ingan. Ngin apun tuduꞌ nyaꞌa saꞌ Topaꞌ ngin apun tuduꞌ ingan.

translation.en: The followers of Jesus were standing there too. They saw what was happening and said to Jesus, “Lord, should we use our swords?”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh, sidadu-sidadu deꞌ jaga Boli Topaꞌ duoh pimipin-pimipin Yahudi deꞌ suaꞌ odi kanoꞌ yaꞌ takap Odop-e, “Ulang jaꞌat keh Okuꞌ tih ngan ingan nog toban podang duoh pakung saꞌan takap Okuꞌ?

translation.en: While Peter was saying these things, a cloud came all around them. Peter, John, and James were afraid when the cloud covered them.
translation.bj: Takal sina inoh ti-e moꞌ aam in-e doiꞌ, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus tiep sadiꞌ-sadiꞌ-e. Tui pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ munoꞌ idoh diꞌ-e kilakal tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon suaꞌ oni deꞌ ningaꞌ-e danoꞌ. Yesus kasig munua soꞌ onak opot deꞌ monam

translation.en: The devil said to him, “I will make you king over all these places. You will have power over them, and you will get all the glory. It has all been given to me. I can give it to anyone I want.
translation.bj: Muot moꞌ toban Yesus keꞌ Yerusalem duoh keꞌ tun bungan Boli Topaꞌ. Muot moꞌ in-e, “Muꞌu tih kan Onak Topaꞌ, bitabumleh soꞌ itih!

translation.en: They were trying to find a way to catch Jesus saying something wrong.
translation.bj: Takal inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tluti bonal-bonal sina-E, ngan-e yaꞌ kalik pingunang Yesus deꞌ salah.

translation.en: You will be punished for the killing of Abel. And you will be punished for the killing of Zechariah, who was killed between the altar and the Temple. Yes, I tell you that you people will be punished for them all.
translation.bj: Soꞌ Habel nog Zakharia, Zakharia inoh deꞌ obuah ngabos deꞌ osah Mezbah duoh Boli Topaꞌ. Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Nyaꞌa deꞌ idip joman adin yaꞌ obuah ukum sobab, sumuk babai ingan moꞌ ngabos suaꞌ nabi inoh.

translation.en: The rest of the seed fell on good ground. This seed grew and made
translation.bj: Pak-e ogiꞌ biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ tanaꞌ deꞌ paguh, biniaꞌ noh moꞌ tumuꞌ duoh bibuaꞌ silatus kali lipat.” Mokuaꞌ ngin perumpamaan inoh, Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Ngojit nyeꞌ bonal-bonal-e, oni deꞌ nang Kuꞌ itih.”

translation.en: Sell the things you have and give that money to those who need it. This is the only way you can keep your riches from being lost. You will be storing treasure in heaven that lasts forever. Thieves can’t steal that treasure, and moths can’t destroy it.
translation.bj: Jualeh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ ingan, duoh nginleh duit-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag jadi nyam-e watinoh ingan moꞌ nyikon halta ingan deꞌ sulga, inohleh topat halta deꞌ diꞌ ponai lusak sitian-tian-e. Halta inoh diꞌ ponai moyap sobab pinoku diꞌ-e ponai mit-e duoh gilogot diꞌ-e dapod pilusak-e.

translation.en: “People will hate you because you belong to the Son of Man. They will make you leave their group. They will insult you. They will think it is wrong even to say your name. When these things happen, know that great blessings belong to you.
translation.bj: Sonangleh ingan simoꞌo nyaꞌa buꞌui deꞌ ingan, nyaꞌa doliaꞌ bisapul duoh ingan, obuah nguyat odaꞌ nyaꞌa, obuah pijaꞌat odaꞌ nyaꞌa sobab ingan nunaꞌ Okuꞌ Onak Manusia!

translation.en: Then he saw a poor widow put two small copper coins into the box.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ geh niꞌ naꞌan jana deꞌ botak kolag kibalot duwoh kiping duit tibaga.

translation.en: So be careful! Don’t let the light in you become darkness.
translation.bj: Sobab inoh, tauꞌ-tauꞌ, maꞌ sape telang deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ muꞌu inoh jadi mopung.

translation.en: After this Jesus went out and saw a tax collector sitting at his place for collecting taxes. His name was Levi. Jesus said to him, “Follow me!”
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus luah Yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ niꞌ naꞌan pinagih suke deꞌ, adon-e Lewi, deꞌ guluꞌ deꞌ boli suke. Yesus sina tuduꞌ-e, “Jaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.”

translation.en: It is like yeast that a woman mixes into a big bowl of flour to make bread. The yeast makes all the dough rise.”
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Natong nyeꞌ! Ingan halus kagaꞌ odop ingan molot soꞌ tiban deꞌ koꞌot sobab bogoꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ kagaꞌ odop-e molot pak-e diꞌ-e dapod!

translation.en: Neri was the son of Melchi.Melchi was the son of Addi.Addi was the son of Cosam.Cosam was the son of Elmadam.Elmadam was the son of Er.
translation.bj: onak Aminadab, onak Admin, onak Arni, onak Hezron, onak Peres, onak Yehuda,

translation.en: “Once there was a judge in a town. He did not care about God. He also did not care what people thought about him.
translation.bj: In Yesus, “Daang niꞌ kota ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan hakim idip deꞌ diꞌ-e nulut tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, nyaꞌa tuong idoh geh yoh piduli-e.

translation.en: So he went and got a job with one of the people who lived there. The man sent him into the fields to feed pigs.
translation.bj: Okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ samaꞌkuꞌ, yomoꞌ okuꞌ yaꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, ‘Samaꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ bidosa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ baya ingan.
Duoh deꞌ daang adon Laja Pinyilamat inoh, ingan yaꞌ tanon gah silamat tuduꞌ susuaꞌ bangsa mulai soꞌ Yerusalem nang nyam basa nyaꞌa bitobat Topaꞌ ngapun dosa-e.

translation.en: Then Jesus told them this story:
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ Yesus ngin perumpamaan tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ,

translation.en: Everyone who heard him was amazed at his understanding and wise answers.
translation.bj: Pingoma-E tuang ilan-e geh ningaꞌ Yesus, sinoꞌ-e moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-E, “Oni ngan muꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ wat itih tuduꞌ koꞌih neh? Koꞌih bigaduh kalik Muꞌu!”

translation.en: To answer this question, Jesus said, “A man was going down the road from Jerusalem to Jericho. Some robbers surrounded him, tore off his clothes, and beat him. Then they left him lying there on the ground almost dead.
translation.bj: Watinoh geh ogiꞌ lagiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa soꞌ suku Lewid ngilusuꞌ olan inoh yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ-a, pak-e nonan-e soꞌ pang olan.

translation.en: and I will put your enemies under your power.’ Psalm
translation.bj: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ danoꞌ ngojit Yesus sina, Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E,

translation.en: They told him, “Jesus, the one from Nazareth, is coming here.”
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa danoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ogiꞌ Yesus soꞌ Nazaret ngilusuꞌ katiꞌ.”

translation.en: But they did not understand the meaning of what he said to them.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ duoh pingoma-e keꞌ Nazaret. Yoh silalu nulut pingunang pingoma-E. Suaꞌ hal inoh sinoꞌ-E nyikon daang kila-e.

translation.en: He took the body down from the cross and wrapped it in cloth. Then he put it in a tomb that was dug in a wall of rock. This tomb had never been used before.
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ pimuun todang Yesus soꞌ koyuh salib, yoh moꞌ molut todang-e kai kain mopuꞌ. Mokuaꞌ inoh iyoh piguling todang Yesus deꞌ kubul deꞌ obuah nai daang dolod batuh. Kubul inoh aluaꞌ tiboon duoh aluaꞌ doiꞌ manah obuah pakai.

translation.en: in a way that is holy and right for as long as we live.
translation.bj: duoh saꞌ otoꞌ idip bonal duoh nyonang otin-E niꞌ umul idip toꞌ.”

translation.en: Yes, whoever continues to ask will receive. Whoever continues to look will find. And whoever continues to knock will have the door opened for them.
translation.bj: Sobab nyaꞌa deꞌ mitiaꞌ iyoh tilimaꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ kalik totap soꞌon, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ netek tiban obuah bukaꞌ.

translation.en: Lazarus wanted only to eat the scraps of food left on the floor under the rich man’s table. And the dogs came and licked his sores.
translation.bj: Abraham moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Onakkuꞌ natong nyeꞌ muꞌu moꞌ puas tlimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ paguh takal muꞌ aluaꞌ idip, pak-e Lazarus mala sijaꞌ-e tlimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat, iyoh ngan-e adin yoh lagi deꞌ kiꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ paguh muꞌu lagiꞌ deꞌ kiꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ jolaꞌ.

translation.en: Then they made signs to his father, “What would you like to name him?”
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngin tanda tuduꞌ Zakharia ngan-e yaꞌ sikien adon onak-e.

translation.en: After Jesus told them this, he showed them his hands and his feet.
translation.bj: Yesus sina inoh simadi-E bitanga tongan duoh poꞌon-E tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
Yomoꞌ Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ labuꞌ keꞌ tun batuh inoh totap iyoh asul, duoh osi deꞌ obuah nyonug odaꞌ batuh inoh totap iyoh asul lumuk.” Pinyikian bayal suke

translation.en: “Whoever says something against the Son of Man can be forgiven. But whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
translation.bj: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pijaꞌat Onak Manusia, iyoh obuah ngapun, pak-e osi deꞌ nguyat Iyang Topaꞌ, iyoh diꞌ-e obuah ngapun.

translation.en: home, go to your friends and neighbors and say to them, ‘Be happy with me because I found my lost sheep!’
translation.bj: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina lagiꞌ in neh, “Samah geh kodaꞌ nyam basa ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dayung deꞌ kakuꞌ duit simoong kiping pilak yomoꞌ moyap niꞌ kiping pilak. Totu iyoh kidip lapu yomoꞌ mipis boli-e daang kalik-e nog iyoh dapod duit inoh.

translation.en: And what about those
translation.bj: Idoh keh diꞌ ingan natong-e, takal simoong moih naꞌan nyaꞌa kobos obuah nyonug boli deꞌ bigatung deꞌ Siloam? Podo ingan bipikil nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ lobih bidosa soꞌ ulang Yerusalem deꞌ bokon?

translation.en: Everyone was trying to touch him, because power was coming out from him. Jesus healed them all.
translation.bj: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ tomaꞌ Yesus sobab ogiꞌ kuasa deꞌ luah so-E deꞌ ponai odaꞌ onam tiboꞌi nyaꞌa mokuaꞌ. Sonangleh duoh binasaleh

translation.en: “The owner of the vineyard said, ‘What will I do now? I will send my son. I love my son very much. Maybe the farmers will respect my son.’
translation.bj: Nyuang-nyuang-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh moꞌ in-e, ‘Oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai kuꞌ yoh? Kuꞌ pait onak odopkuꞌ deꞌ sukupkuꞌ nyayang-e, podo odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ laꞌan tunuaꞌ tuduꞌ-e.’

translation.en: They answered, “Some people say you are John the Baptizer. Others say you are Elijah. And some people say you are one of the prophets from long ago that has come back to life.”
