translation.bj: Ngojit hal inoh Yesus moꞌ jaman pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon. Yesus tanon nang odop-E yaꞌ obuah ngabos
Takal tiiaꞌ Elisabet moꞌ nuam bulan, Topaꞌ odaꞌ malaikat deꞌ adon-e Gabriel odi keꞌ Nazaret, kota deꞌ propinsi Galilea.

translation.en: After three days they found him. Jesus was sitting in the Temple area with the religious teachers, listening and asking them questions.
translation.bj: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit sina-E moꞌ ilan-e sobab Yoh bijak, Yoh moꞌ nyawot pinyikian gulu agama suaꞌ-e bonal.

“Tauꞌ-tauꞌ maꞌ kodaꞌ gulu-gulu agama Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ. Nyaꞌa deꞌ suka ponu katiꞌ-kanih pakai jubah deꞌ omu ngan-e yaꞌ blagah odop-e, saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pasal nabiꞌ-e, duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suka guluꞌ deꞌ topat saꞌan piayuh deꞌ boli topat simayang duoh topat nyaꞌa bluman.

translation.en: “If a king is going to fight against another king, first he will sit down and plan. If he has only
translation.bj: Nyam niꞌ naꞌan laja kakuꞌ simoong libu sidadu yaꞌ bipolang duoh laja deꞌ bokon deꞌ kakuꞌ duwoh puluꞌ libu sidadu, totu laja inoh guluꞌ pikil dioꞌ podo iyoh taan kedoh yaꞌ lawan musoh-e inoh.

translation.en: “Later, the master told the dishonest manager that he had done a smart thing. Yes, worldly people are smarter in their business with each other than spiritual people are.
translation.bj: Duoh nyam basa-e balang deꞌ kakuꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon diꞌ ingan ponai jaga-e, totu Topaꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e ngin oniꞌ deꞌ patut ingan kakuꞌ.

translation.en: The next morning he called his followers. He chose twelve of them and called them apostles. These are the ones he chose:
translation.bj: Takal onu moꞌ jawaꞌ Yoh mogan pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, Yoh moꞌ pilih simoong duwoh naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ. Yesus biladon simoong duwoh nyaꞌa deꞌ pilih-E noh rasul. Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ iyohleh,

translation.en: When it turns green, you know that summer is very near.
translation.bj: asal ingan moh ningaꞌ tongon koyuh deꞌ tuang-e bisuat ingan puꞌan nang yaꞌ nog musim buaꞌ.

translation.en: He will rule over the people of Jacob forever; his kingdom will never end.”
translation.bj: Yoh deꞌ yaꞌ militah jadin Laja tun bangsa Israel deꞌ sitelus-e, diꞌ-e ponai obuaꞌ.”

translation.en: “Go back home and tell people what God did for you.”So the man went all over town telling what Jesus had done for him.
translation.bj: sobab onak tomoꞌ-e deꞌ dayung deꞌ umul-e simoong duwoh sowaꞌ yaꞌ kobos. Takal Yesus ponu yaꞌ odi keꞌ boli Yairus, nyaꞌa bogoꞌ bitodod-todod kililing Yesus.

translation.en: The women were very afraid. They bowed down with their faces to the ground. The men said to them, “Why are you looking for a living person here? This is a place for dead people.
translation.bj: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ obuaꞌ tolu daang-e bikunyug keꞌ tanaꞌ. Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Dusah negeh ingan kalik nyaꞌa deꞌ idip daang uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos!

translation.en: During the time when Herod ruled Judea, there was a priest named Zechariah. He belonged to Abijah’s group. His wife came from the family of Aaron. Her name was Elizabeth.
translation.bj: Takal Herodes jadi laja deꞌ propinsi Yudea, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ adon-e Zakharia soꞌ uluk Abia.a Sowon-e onak-sukun Harunb deꞌ adon-e Elisabet.

translation.en: A man in the group shouted to him, “Teacher, please come and look at my son. He is the only child I have.
translation.bj: Okuꞌ moꞌ mitiaꞌ tulung tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ ingan odaꞌ kasig munua inoh pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e dapod kasig-e.”

translation.en: When Jesus came to where Zacchaeus was, he looked up and saw him in the tree. Jesus said, “Zacchaeus, hurry! Come down! I must stay at your house today.”
translation.bj: Takal Yesus moꞌ nog deꞌ libuaꞌ tongon koyuh inoh, Iyoh moꞌ bigalong keꞌ somu yomoꞌ sina, “Zakheus, muun mei! Onu itih Okuꞌ halus ngilumon deꞌ boli muꞌu.”

translation.en: Annas and Caiaphas were the high priests. During this time, John, the son of Zechariah, was living in the desert, and he received a message from God.
translation.bj: Yohanes odi keꞌ suaꞌ daerah deꞌ sungi Yordan yoh moꞌ tanon saꞌ suaꞌ-suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ duoh obuah baptis saꞌ Topaꞌ ngapun dosa-e.

translation.en: If you are full of light, and there is no part of you that is dark, then you will be all bright, as though you have the light of a lamp shining on you.”
translation.bj: Nyam suaꞌ gonanmuꞌ telang, duoh diꞌ-e sit pun deꞌ mopung, idipmuꞌ inoh telang-binelang kodaꞌ jawaꞌ lapu deꞌ sukup telang.” Yesus malah tuduꞌ ulang Farisi duoh gulu-gulu agama

translation.en: The son said, ‘Father, I have sinned against God and have done wrong to you. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’
translation.bj: Sobab onakkuꞌ itih samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos, deꞌ moh paliꞌ idip; samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moyap, deꞌ moh paliꞌ lagiꞌ. Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e munoꞌ moꞌ man simadi-e bisukul.’

translation.en: Then Jesus said to the people, “I tell you, my friends, don’t be afraid of people. They can kill the body, but after that they can do nothing more to hurt you.
translation.bj: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ: Ingan dingan-dinganKuꞌ, maꞌ ingan tolu tuduꞌ manusia deꞌ jok-e ponai ngabos gonan nyeꞌ sijaꞌ-e, jok-e inoh, doiꞌ yoh ponai nai oni deꞌ lobih soꞌ noh.

translation.en: But even the smallest part of a letter in the law cannot be changed. It would be easier for heaven and earth to pass away.
translation.bj: Lazarus sukup pilai-e, yoh bialap ogiꞌ puluh pinguman labuꞌ soꞌ mija sidagal inoh ngan-e kadu-kadu-e man sisaꞌ-e. Idoh diꞌ-e jok-e inoh kosuang nog kanoꞌ odi silaꞌian pinonaꞌ deꞌ gonan-e.

translation.en: They are like a man building a house. He digs deep and builds his house on rock. The floods come, and the water crashes against the house. But the flood cannot move the house, because it was built well.
translation.bj: Iyoh kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngan-e kajuag boli-e, yoh kaliah tanaꞌ nai lubang tuluap-tuluap-e nog-e dapod batuh, yoh moꞌ kajuag tiang tun batuh inoh. Takal ogiꞌ ubaꞌ, yoh moꞌ ubaꞌ obuah boli inoh, biguyut bigogos idoh geh, sobab boli noh togap.

translation.en: “So when someone invites you, go sit in the seat that is not important. Then they will come to you and say, ‘Friend, move up here to this better place!’ What an honor this will be for you in front of all the other guests.
translation.bj: Simoꞌo muꞌu obuah ngunang guluꞌ leh deꞌ topat deꞌ bokon, podo-podo nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli nog yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ muꞌu, ‘Dingan odileh guluꞌ keꞌ jowin,’ danoꞌ leh muꞌu obuah nabiꞌ deꞌ jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.

translation.en: The teachers of the law and the Pharisees were watching Jesus closely. They were waiting to see if he would heal on the Sabbath day. They wanted to see him do something wrong so that they could accuse him.
translation.bj: Danoꞌ ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan gulu agama Yahudi, ogiꞌ geh ulang Farisi danoꞌ ngite-e yaꞌ kalik salah Yesus saꞌ-e ogiꞌ alasan ngan-e nyalah Yesus. Jadi odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kajon podo Yesus yaꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tongan-e kobos noh odaꞌ mokuaꞌ daang onu Sabat.

translation.en: They said to Jesus, “John’s followers often fast and pray, the same as the followers of the Pharisees. But your followers eat and drink all the time.”
translation.bj: Kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Pinunaꞌ Yohanes duoh pinunaꞌ ulang Farisi silalu puasa duoh bidoa. Pak-e pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌMuꞌ man duoh nuak.”

translation.en: He filled the hungry with good things,but he sent the rich away with nothing.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ pilai Iyoh odaꞌ busuah, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya Iyoh odaꞌ buꞌu boloh-boloh-e.

translation.en: They are like children sitting in the marketplace. One group of children calls to the other children and says,‘We played flute music for you,but you did not dance;we sang a sad song,but you did not cry.’
translation.bj: Duoh Onak Manusia nog Iyoh man nuak, ingan nang, ‘Ningaꞌ Nyaꞌa noh! Jolua, pimabuk, bidingan duoh pinagih suke duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa!’

translation.en: years old. People thought that Jesus was Joseph’s son.Joseph was the son of Eli.
translation.bj: onak Malkhi, onak Adi, onak Kosam, onak Elmadam, onak Er,

translation.en: James and John, the followers of Jesus, saw this. They said, “Lord, do you want us to call fire down from heaven and destroy those people?”
translation.bj: Daang pimonu Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e odi keꞌ Yerusalem, deꞌ lopot olan ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Okuꞌ yaꞌ nunaꞌ Ingan kaki sijaꞌ-e Ingan odi!”

translation.en: Nahshon was the son of Amminadab.Amminadab was the son of Admin.Admin was the son of Arni.Arni was the son of Hezron.Hezron was the son of Perez.Perez was the son of Judah.
translation.bj: onak Enos, onak Set, onak Adam, onak Topaꞌ.

translation.en: Many tax collectors and sinners came to listen to Jesus.
translation.bj: Ayua ngan pinagih suke duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa nog tuduꞌ Yesus ngan-e yaꞌ ngojit pingunang-E.

translation.en: The Lord said, “Listen, there is meaning in what the bad judge said.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Suba ingan tiluti oniꞌ deꞌ nang hakim deꞌ diꞌ-e adil noh!

translation.en: years. Her back was always bent; she could not stand up straight.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ Yesus gan tongan-e deꞌ dayung inoh, yoh lasuꞌ mujuag tongon mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e, yomoꞌ mudi Topaꞌ.

translation.en: Crowds of people came to be baptized by John. But he said to them, “You are all snakes! Who warned you to run from God’s judgment that is coming?
translation.bj: Yohanes moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Moꞌ ingan ogiꞌ bojuh duwoh, nginleh niꞌ bojuh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ doiꞌ bojuh-e nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ pinguman-e, kutungleh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pilai.”

translation.en: But Peter got up and ran to the tomb to see. He looked in, but he saw only the cloth that Jesus’ body had been wrapped in. It was just lying there. Peter went away to be alone, wondering what had happened.
translation.bj: Pak-e Petrus mokat mujuag yoh moꞌ bikoduh keꞌ kubul inoh. Iyoh ningaꞌ keꞌ daang lubang kubul inoh, jok-e kilin kain deꞌ pakai nyaꞌa molut Yesus deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ. Petrus moꞌ buꞌu paliꞌ daang-e bipikil, ilan oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi deꞌ munoꞌ. Yesus bitanga odop-e daang olan yaꞌ odi keꞌ Emaus

translation.en: There may be two women working together. One will be taken and the other will be left.”
translation.bj: Duwoh naꞌan dayung deꞌ poh podi, niꞌ naꞌan obuah toban buu, niꞌ naꞌan obuah supiah.

translation.en: jars.’
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ takal sidagal inoh puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ nai nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus halta-e inoh, yoh moꞌ mudi-e nang nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus halta-e inoh bijak.” Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ samung sina-e inoh, “Sobab biasa-e nyaꞌa deꞌ idip-e nunaꞌ dunia itih lobih bogoꞌ wat akal-e ngulus idip daang dunia soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip daang jawaꞌ.”

translation.en: Jesus said to his followers, “Things will surely happen that will make people sin. But it will be very bad for anyone who makes this happen.
translation.bj: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Oniꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa nai dosa totap ogiꞌ. Pak-e binasaleh nyaꞌa deꞌ singaji-e odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon nai dosa!

translation.en: Then Simeon blessed them and said to Mary, “Many Jews will fall and many will rise because of this boy. He will be a sign from God that some will not accept.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ Simeon bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ blokat Yusuf duoh Maria. Simeon sina tuduꞌ Maria, “Topaꞌ moꞌ pilih onak itih kaꞌan ngukum duoh nyilamat bogoꞌ ulang Israel. Yoh kodaꞌ tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ pak-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ nulak-E.

translation.en: And if I ask you, you will not answer.
translation.bj: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nang, “Dusah nyeꞌ jolaꞌ kalik saksi tiaꞌ neh! Otoꞌ moꞌ ngojit lasuꞌ soꞌ bobaꞌ Odop-E.”

translation.en: James and John, the sons of Zebedee, were amazed too. (James and John worked together with Simon.)Jesus said to Simon, “Don’t be afraid. From now on your work will be to bring in people, not fish!”
translation.bj: Watnoh geh dingan-dingan Simon, Yakobus duoh Yohanes onak Zebedeus. Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Simon, “Maꞌ tolu! Soꞌ adin muꞌu idoh tiaꞌ kalik ikian pak-e kalik manusia odaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.”

translation.en: The next day, Jesus, Peter, John, and James came down from the mountain. A large group of people met Jesus.
translation.bj: Takal munua molot daang gonan-e, yoh moꞌ lika nang bogan duoh guyang-gusuaꞌ gonan-e sape luah loyang soꞌ bobaꞌ-e, sape mun jolaꞌ-e odaꞌ-e nak munua inoh laꞌan buu soꞌ-e.

translation.en: He sent them to the Lord to ask, “Are you the one we heard was coming, or should we wait for someone else?”
translation.bj: Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ odi sikien tuduꞌ Yesus, “Ingan keh nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nog kodaꞌ deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ, podo koꞌih kajon nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon?”

translation.en: “Then a Samaritan man traveled down that road. He came to the place where the hurt man was lying. He saw the man and felt very sorry for him.
translation.bj: Tiaꞌ pagi-e yoh moꞌ ngin duwoh kiping duit pilakh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ topat soꞌ nyaꞌa ngilumon. Yoh moꞌ in-e, ‘Okuꞌ mitiaꞌ ingan bina yoh tih, simoꞌo duit tih kulang takal kuꞌ paliꞌ lagiꞌ katiꞌ okuꞌ gati-e.’ ”

translation.en: They said,“‘Welcome! God bless the king who comes in the name of the Lord.’ Psalm
translation.bj: In odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Obuah bilokatleh Laja itih deꞌ nog daang adon Topaꞌ! Sonang-moꞌon daang sulga duoh mudileh Topaꞌ.”

translation.en: If a man locks the door of his house, you can stand outside and knock on the door, but he won’t open it. You can say, ‘Sir, open the door for us.’ But he will answer, ‘I don’t know you. Where did you come from?’
translation.bj: Takal ingan ningaꞌ Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja deꞌ nyuang joman. Abraham, Ishak yoh moꞌ Yakub baya suaꞌ nabi sonang, pak-e ingan siꞌien, duoh jolaꞌ sobab ingan diꞌ ingan dapod suaꞌ!

translation.en: God has helped Israel—the people he chose to serve him.He did not forget his promise to give us his mercy.
As Jesus stood beside Lake Galilee, a crowd of people pushed to get closer to him and to hear the teachings of God.
translation.bj: Takal Yesus deꞌ bingon Donu Genezaret Deꞌ ayuh, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa bikuluk yomoꞌ bitodod-todod ngan-e yaꞌ ngojit pingunang Topaꞌ soꞌ Yesus.

translation.en: It is worth nothing for you to have the whole world if you yourself are destroyed or lost.
translation.bj: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Ogiꞌ ingan deꞌ mujuag datiꞌ adin totap yaꞌ ningaꞌ Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.” Yesus daang jawaꞌ soꞌ sulga

translation.en: A woman was there who had an evil spirit inside her. It had made the woman crippled for
translation.bj: Takal Yesus moꞌ ningaꞌ-e, Iyoh mogan-e duoh sina tuduꞌ-e, “Adin Okuꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu mokuaꞌ soꞌ onammuꞌ!”

translation.en: There were also two criminals led out with Jesus to be killed.
translation.bj: Ogiꞌ geh duwoh naꞌan ulang jaꞌat deꞌ toban odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ obuah ukum ngabos bibaya duoh Yesus.

translation.en: Jesus said to them, “I wanted very much to eat this Passover meal with you before I die.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e munoꞌ, “Jobong nyam Kuꞌ yaꞌ man pinguman paskah itih duoh ingan ngan-e aluaꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ obuah jolaꞌ.

translation.en: Jesus shouted, “Father, I put my life in your hands!” After Jesus said this, he died.
translation.bj: Yomoꞌ Yesus nang sina deꞌ dolas-E, “Samaꞌ! Keꞌ daang tongan Ingan, Kuꞌ ngin asongKuꞌ!” Mokuaꞌ Yoh nang sina inoh, Yoh lasuꞌ kobos.

translation.en: Everyone was crying and feeling sad because the girl was dead. But Jesus said, “Don’t cry. She is not dead. She is only sleeping.”
translation.bj: Onak opot inoh moꞌ paliꞌ idip lagiꞌ, duoh takal inoh geh yoh lasuꞌ mokat. Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ maꞌan onak opot inoh.

translation.en: The time came for them to eat the Passover meal. Jesus and the apostles were together at the table.
translation.bj: Takal onu moh yaꞌ ngalom, Yesus moꞌ man duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E.

translation.en: Some followers asked Jesus, “Teacher, when will these things happen? What will show us that it is time for these things to happen?”
translation.bj: Odop deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikien tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu siniaꞌ hal inoh yaꞌ jadi? Duoh oni tanda-e moꞌ nog onu-e hal inoh yaꞌ jadi?”

translation.en: And one of them did use his sword. He cut off the right ear of the servant of the high priest.
translation.bj: Bilang konu okuꞌ deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ, doiꞌ ingan odi takap Okuꞌ. Pak-e moꞌ nog onu-e saꞌan ingan yaꞌ takap okuꞌ, onu Laja Muot kiloja.” Petrus diꞌ-e ngakuꞌ Yesus

translation.en: No, they were not. But if you don’t decide now to change your lives, you will all be destroyed like those people!
translation.bj: Idoh! Natong nyeꞌ suaꞌ ingan tuang kobos geh nyam suaꞌ ingan diꞌ ingan paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ.

translation.en: In the past Pilate and Herod had always been enemies. But on that day they became friends.
translation.bj: Daang onu inoh geh Herodes duoh Pilatus paliꞌ bidingan, deꞌ dioꞌ-e odop-e duwoh bitomi.

translation.en: What you should be thinking about is God’s kingdom. Then he will give you all these other things you need.
translation.bj: Pak-e idipleh nunaꞌ plitah Topaꞌ daang idip ingan, ke suaꞌ-suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ plelu ingan Topaꞌ ngin-e.” Halta deꞌ sulga

translation.en: Even you who are bad know how to give good things to your children. So surely your heavenly Father knows how to give the Holy Spirit to the people who ask him.”
translation.bj: Ingan nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat, pak-e ingan tuong puꞌan geh oni deꞌ paguh kaꞌan onak-onak ingan. Lobih lagiꞌ Samaꞌ ingan deꞌ sulga! Iyoh yaꞌ ngin Iyang-E tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ-e!” Yesus duoh Beelzebul

translation.en: “On the judgment day, you people who live now will also be compared with the people from Nineveh, and they will be witnesses who show how guilty you are. I say this because when Jonah preached to those people, they changed their hearts and lives. And you are listening to someone greater than Jonah, but you refuse to change!
translation.bj: Takal Onu Kiamat, ulang Niniwe yaꞌ bangkit nyalah ingan nyaꞌa joman itih, sobab joman nouh-e nyaꞌa Niniwe inoh moh bitobat soꞌ dosa-dosa-e takal Yunus kotbah tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ. Pak-e deꞌ datiꞌ adin ogiꞌ Okuꞌ deꞌ lobih ayuh soꞌ Yunus pak-e ingan doliaꞌ ingan bitobat.” Jawaꞌ duoh mopung

translation.en: Jesus said to his followers, “So I tell you, don’t worry about the things you need to live—what you will eat or what you will wear.
translation.bj: Yesus sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Sobab inoh Okuꞌ sina tuduꞌ ingan, maꞌ bigaduh duoh idipmuꞌ, oni deꞌ yaꞌ man muꞌ, oni deꞌ yaꞌ pakai muꞌ.
